loans.name: Sahera

texts.en:
Sahera is a married woman of 56 years old from Dhupguri. She is illiterate and can sign her name only. She lives with her husband in a small village, Islam Para, in Jalpaiguri district.

Sahera is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer who has a plot of agricultural land where he grows various vegetables and sells those in the local markets. His wife Sahera is a big support in his work, especially at the time of harvesting. Now they decided to cultivate paddy on their farmland for an additional income.

Sahera is a tenacious woman who is ready to give her best effort for the betterment of her family. She has taken economic support from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy agricultural supplies such as good-quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, etc. Her long-term goal is to go ahead with paddy cultivation, as it is profitable, being the staple food for the people of their region. She and her husband want to harvest the crop in abundance.

She thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, such as seeds and fertilizers, for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Saneka

texts.en:
Saneka is a married woman of 50 years. She is from Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district. She lives there with her husband and three sons. She has not received elementary education, so she is illiterate and can sign her name only.

Saneka's husband is associated with agricultural activities. He mainly grows rice paddy in his field. He has good knowledge and experience about paddy cultivation. Saneka has also engaged herself in this business. They have their own plot of land, where they work from dawn to dusk. 

Her goal is to go ahead and provide a more financially secure life for her family. They have decided to cultivate more paddy, which is a profitable crop. Paddy is a crop that grows well in a tropical country like India, but she cannot invest much in this business due to lack of capital.

Saneka heard about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and that they give business loans to needy rural women. She took a loan from them with an aim to cultivate more paddies. She wants to utilize the loan to buy planting materials and fertilizer to start the cultivation. She is striving for a better life through farming. Saneka hopes to have a better life with her family in the future.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva for this financial help.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs to cultivate paddy.

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is an ambitious 22-year-old young man living with his 9-member family in Irbid-Jordan. 

He is a university student majoring in Air Conditioning Engineering who is beginning his program.   Waleed plans to work in his field after getting his Bachelors degree. 

He will use the loan  to pay the fees for his upcoming semester.

loans.use: to pay the fees for his upcoming semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a living room furniture set to furnish his home.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 22-year-young lady living with her 5-member family. 

She is a university student majoring in Economics, and is in her third year. Her family currently faces financial problems. She plans to work in her field after graduating and help her family. 

She will use this loan to ask for your help in paying her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay the fees for her upcoming semester.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, a youthful 62-year-old guka (old man), is a wise farmer who is respected as a mentor by his neighbors and other farmers. 

He farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Eldoret which is in the Rift valley region of Kenya. For the past 15 years, he has been involved in mixed farming and he grows maize and vegetables. He also raises dairy cows. 

William has been able to provide nutritious food for his family and requests  a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to buy a quality breed of sheep. 

He will benefit from wool which fetches a high price both in the local and international market. He will also benefit from  using the meat and manure to save money. 

The benefits of this loan are astronomical. William is an old man who is making a change for himself and for others in the community because he intends to employ someone who will help with farm work. With your loan, William will improve his living conditions and assure his children and grandchildren of a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a sheep.

loans.name: Christal

texts.en:
Christal is a 30-year-old married woman with two children. One child attends school.

Christal has raised pigs for 10 years and requestes 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other farm supplies.

She has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Christal would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Shobha

texts.en:
Shobha is 44 years old. She is from Dhupguri. She is married, a housewife, and is blessed with two sons. One of them receives education, and the other is engaged as a cycle-van puller.

Shobha's husband Keru, aged 52 years, is in the cycle-van puller profession (a kind of transport widely used in rural West Bengal). He has been transporting people and goods to different places inside as well as outside of his village. With the income that he earns, he helps his family with household expenses. It is going well for him because he is dedicated to his job and responsible; he transports his clients and goods safely. Unfortunately, of late, his van met with an accident and was severely damaged. He needs to buy a new cycle-van.

So, Shobha asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to help her husband by purchasing a new cycle-van. He will continue working with the same determination and enthusiasm and will improve his family's quality of life.

She and her husband appreciate the help of their generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 43-year-old married woman with two children who are 17 and 11 years old.

Agnes has sold poultry  for 2 years and earns a monthly income of 4,000 KES.

Agnes requests 30,000 KES to purchase poultry. Agnes will be able to  support her family and provide their basic needs and save money for her future plans.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. 

Agnes hopes and dreams of being a poultry distributor.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and chick marsh.

loans.name: Phelister

texts.en:
The agriculture sector accounts for 45% of Kenya's gross domestic product, generates 70% of Kenya’s export revenue, and employs approximately 70% of Kenyans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Kenya and its economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Kenya remain under served by financial institutions. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers. 

Meet Phelister. She is a mother of 4 with a deeply engraved passion in dairy farming. After all, that is what she has been doing for over 10 years. She owns a small farm in Kipkaren village which is situated in the Rift valley Province of Kenya. The income she makes from farming is not sufficient to comfortably sustain her family. As a result, Phelister has ventured into a couple of small side businesses to make extra shillings. With the aid of her husband, Phelister also rears poultry and grows maize, amongst other crops. 

Phelister is seeking a loan of KES 65,000 for constructing a cowshed. She plans to put up a well-designed barn that will provide a clean, comfortable home for her herd and a pleasant, efficient workplace for her. In a bid to increase milk production, the cowshed will provide a favorable environment for the cows. With your loan, Phelister has carefully planned for the storage and handling of milk, feed, bedding and manure, as these account for most of the labor in any dairy farm. The housing will have a plentiful, dependable supply of good water, made available 24 hours a day. The income she will make from this investment will put her in a position to comfortably afford increasing farming costs. Her family also stands to benefit from the growth of their agri-business.

loans.use: To build a dairy unit

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 37-year-old married woman with five children. Her husband is employed at a university, and his income wasn’t enough to cover his children needs. 

Fatima has operated a cosmetics shop for one year and her business is profitable. She plans to expand it and will use a loan to buy a new collection of cosmetics that her customers have requested.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Verene

texts.en: Verene, 26, is married. She has two children, ages 2 and 7, one of whom goes to school. For the past three years, Verene has been selling foodstuffs. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, rice, and cassava to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans, rice, and cassava to sell

loans.name: Suchitra

texts.en:
Suchitra is a 43-year-old, energetic entrepreneur from Dhupguri. She is married and the mother of three children. She lives in the countryside far from the major city with her husband and children. 
 
Suchitra's husband Dwijen works in a saloon shop. Suchitra has been engaged in a cattle-breeding business. She started the business with one dairy cow and sold the cow’s milk to her neighbors, who are her main clients.  

Now, with her own efforts, she has established her own business. She wants to grow her business, and for this reason she has turned to Kiva’s partner BJS and asked for a loan from them. She plans to buy one more dairy cow to improve her milk supply business. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately generate more income for her.   

She greatly appreciates the financial help of her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his vegetable farm.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 51 years old. He is married and has eleven children, who are between five and twenty-eight years old. Four of his children attend school. 

For the past eighteen years, Martin has been selling foodstuffs. He would use the loan to buy more beans, sorghum and rice to sell. The profits from the business will used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more beans, sorghum, and rice to sell

loans.name: Sohagi

texts.en:
Sohagi is a 29-year-old married woman and is blessed with two sons. She lives in a small village of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal with her family. She is an energetic and active woman. She is involved in the livestock business.

Sohagi is married to 35-year-old Palash. He is engaged in goldsmith work. She is engaged in a dairy business. She mainly sells cows’ milk and other dairy products. There is a high demand for milk and milk products in their area. She decided to purchase a dairy cow to expand her business. She came to BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan. 

Sohagi always supports her family financially. With her business profit, she can increase her family’s income and ensure her financial stability so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

She conveys her hearty thanks to the lenders for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a youthful 35-year-old mother, is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. 

She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Eldoret, which in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Grace is happily married  and is blessed with two lovely children. 

For the past 2 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and she grows maize and vegetables.  She also has dairy cows. Grace has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. 

She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with a challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up and she states:  “I have to do something for my family“. 

Grace  joined Juhudi Kilimo which is a micro finance institution that assists aspiring women like herself. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Grace is from a remote village that has poor  roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) which require timely delivery to the market.  This loan will help Grace to achieve her dream and reach her goals. 

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Grace feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. 

The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Grace will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering  produce to the market.  She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market.  Her income will  increase.  

Grace is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Grace will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children and grandchildren of a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a  34-year-old married woman with 3 children between the ages of  8 and 1. 

She has sold shoes  for 4 years and would like to buy more shoes. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more shoes.

loans.name: Urumuri Cb Group

texts.en:
Donata is a 40-year-old group leader.  She is married and has 6 children between the ages of 5 and 17, all attend school. 

Her group is called URUMURI which means “The light”.   They sell different items and have a common goal of improving their standard of living. 

Donata has sold foodstuffs for the past 2 years and will  use  the loan to buy more beans and nuts.  She will use the profits to pay her  children's  school fees and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy beans and nuts.

loans.name: Mathirde

texts.en:
Mathirde is 26 years, married, and a mother of three children between the ages of five and 11, one of whom goes to school. She has been selling  clothes for five years. 

Mathirde has requested this loan to buy more clothes for resale. The business profits will be used to buy land.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Berthe

texts.en: Berthe is 36 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 2 months and 7 years; one goes to school. She has a shop and has been maintaining the business for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, rice, and salt for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, rice, and salt for sale.

loans.name: Myriam Dalinda

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Myrian, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella y estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Myriam para ayudarla a su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica al comercio, compra y vende  de adornos y cerámicas,  el viaja con todos sus productos a varias ciudades de la sierra lugares donde tiene  sus clientes, viaja una vez por semana y se queda dos a tres días en  estos lugares. Sus productos los compran a artesanos de la zona ya que estas cerámicas son de muy buena calidad.
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de crédito y le gusta por los servicios que les da la institución. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para que su esposo venda sus productos.
texts.en:
In La Pila in the canton of Montecristi, the communal bank "Para el Futuro De la Mujer" (Women with a Future) meets fortnightly. Montecristi is very well known for its rich traditional culture, and a wide range of handicrafts made by local inhabitants can be found there.

Myriam lives here, who is 47, married, and has three grown-up children. Two of the children still live with her and study at university and at secondary school. Her husband is a craftsman.

Myriam is asking for the loan for her husband to use in his business. He works in commerce, buying and selling ornaments and ceramics. He travels with all his products to varies cities in the mountains where he has customers. He travels once a week and stays two or three days in these places. He buys his products from craftsmen in the area because these ceramics are of a very high quality.

Myriam wants this loan to buy more handicrafts of all types and styles. She has been a member of the communal bank since it started. She likes this organisation because of the services it provides to them. Her dream is to buy a car to help her husband in selling his products.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Forty-three-year-old Sumitra is a rural woman of Maynaguri. She is a married woman and a mother of two sons. Her husband, 46-year-old Bhutu, is a rickshaw puller by profession.

Sumitra is a very hardworking woman. She works as a day laborer after managing her household work and taking care of her children. Sumitra and her husband are illiterate, and just know how to sign their names. Due to poverty, they cannot receive education. 

Sumitra’s husband pulls a rented rickshaw, so the profit is low. Now he wants to generate more income for his family. Thus, she is thinking to buy a new rickshaw for her husband to carry people for additional income. There are very few means of transport in the villages; rickshaws are in great demand in rural areas. 

Thus, Sumitra has sought a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner), which gives business loans to rural women. She wants to purchase a rickshaw for her husband. It will help her husband to earn more money by carrying people, and in the long run, give him more earnings. The loan will help Sumitra and her husband take a step closer to their goal of improved earnings and a better future for their family and better education for her children.

She is grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Abakoranumwete Cb Group

texts.en:
Claudine is a 37-year-old group leader.  She is married and has 2 children who are  4 and 8 years old. One child attends school. 

The group is called “ABAKORANUMWETE” means "let us rise up and work" in English. The members of the group sell different items and they wish to provide a  better future with their  business. 

Claudine has sold medicine for 3 years and would  like to buy more drugs to sell. The profit from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more drugs.

loans.name: Germain

texts.en:
Germain is 28 years old. He is not married. 

For the past six years, he has operated a bakery. He is requesting a loan to buy more baking powder, sugar, and cooking oil to bake bread. Germain will reinvest his business profits.

loans.use: to buy more baking powder and cooking oil to make bread

loans.name: Luisa Beatriz

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Luisa, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 16 y 10 años de edad, las dos mayores estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su esposo es maestro.
Doña Luisa para salir adelante y ganar algo por su cuenta sin depender de su esposo se dedica al comercio, ella  tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de víveres y dulces de muchas formas y sabores los cuales son muy apetecidos por los turistas que pasan por el sector, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayuda en su negocio cuando ellos pueden, lleva más de 10 años con su negocio y le va bastante bien porque gracias a los créditos cada vez lo surte mas.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para surtir más su tienda, va a comprar víveres y dulces. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  desde hace 17 años  y le gusta porque con un crédito empezó su negocio. Sus metas son seguir aumentado su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos
texts.en:
The Para el Futuro De la Mujer [For Women's Future] communal bank meets every two weeks in La Pila, Montecristi. La Pila is known for a rich traditional culture, and visitors  to the area can find a tremendous variety of handcrafted goods made by local residents. La Pila is also the home of Señora Luisa, the 41-year-old wife of a teacher and mother of three children ages 18, 16, and 10. The two eldest children are in high school and the youngest in primary school. 

Doña Luisa feels it is important to earn her own income and not be dependent on her husband, so she went into business for herself. She opened a small grocery store in the family's home over 10 years ago, where she sells a wide variety of groceries as well as candies that come in many varieties and flavors and attract great interest from tourists who visit La Pila. Doña Luisa works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., and sometimes later. Her children help her in the store when they can. The store is doing well, helped by loans that allowed Doña Luisa stock it with more goods. 

Doña Luisa will use this loan to purchase more groceries and candy for her store. She has been a member of the communal bank for 17 years and is pleased that a loan allowed her to open her business. Her goals are to keep growing the business and ensure that her children receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and candies.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 32 years old. He is married with four children aged between 8 years and 5 months, two of whom go to school. 

He sells clothes and has been selling in a business for 10 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more hats for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more hats for sale.

loans.name: Veronique

texts.en:
Veronique is 36 years old. She is married with four children aged between 11 and 5 years, all of them go to school. 

She has a shop and has been working in a business for 7 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, sugar, and soaps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, sugar, and soaps for sale.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise is 37 years old. She is married with two children aged between 15 and 11 years, and both of them go to school. 

She sells food stuffs and has been selling in a business for 12 years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy onions, groundnuts, and bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy onions, groundnuts, and bananas to sell.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 8 de Diciembre  se formo en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, son 17 mujeres jefas de familia, que se pusieron el desafío de capacitarse e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida por medio del trabajo en grupo. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 1 se encuentra por debajo de la línea de pobreza, y ella es consciente que debe seguir esforzando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Blasida, quien es una vendedora sacrificada, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo luchadora, todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy  tempranas horas, vende comidas que hace ella misma y que sale a vender de manera ambulante. Su sueño es poder tener un puesto de comidas, y así no tener que vender más de manera ambulante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de carnes, fideos, leche, azúcar, pan,  entre otras cosas para poder hacer sus comidas y seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace.
texts.en:
The group “8 de Diciembre” (December 8th) was formed in the city of Villa Elisa. These 17 female heads of household have taken on the challenge of the training classes and improving their living conditions through their work as a group. They have taken the poverty elimination survey, which indicated that one member is below the poverty line. That individual is aware that she must continue striving.

One of the members is Sra. Blasida, who is a self-sacrificing merchant. She is a hardworking individual who does her very best. Every day she begins her work in the early morning hours. She sells food that she prepares herself and conducts her business as a street vendor. Her dream is to have a food stand, but since she does not have one, she must sell more a street vendor.

Blasida is requesting a loan in order to buy meat, noodles, milk, sugar, bread, and other supplies for preparing her dishes. As a result, she can continue delighting her customers with the delicious food that she prepares.

loans.use: to buy meat, noodles, milk, sugar, bread, and other supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is 44 years old and has three children. She is a married woman and one of her children is in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Sherly has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Berthe

texts.en:
Berthe, aged 40, is married with four children aged between 18 and 10 years, all of whom go to school. 

She sells clothes and has been running a business for 10 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more shirts and shorts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and shorts for sale.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette, aged 30, is married with two children aged between 8 and 1 year. One of them go to school. 

She sells vegetables and has been selling in a business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more tomatoes and cabbages for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Placidie

texts.en: Placidie is a married 37-year-old woman with seven children, ages one to fourteen.  Four of her children go to school.  She has a restaurant and has been working in a business for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, soda, and meat in order to make food to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, soda, and meat for making food.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard  is 38 years old and married with six children, ages two to twelve years old.  Four of them attend school.  He has a shop and has been running a business for ten years. With the loan, he would like to buy more rice, beans, lotion, and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, lotion, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent 50 years old and married with four children, ages two to nineteen years old.  Three of his children go to school. He has been selling food items for six years. With the loan, he would like to buy more beans, rice, and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve his welfare.

loans.use: to buy more beans, rice, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ciliaque

texts.en: Ciliaque is 23 years old, and he is not married. He has been selling cassava flour for five years. With the loan, he would like to buy more cassava flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve his welfare.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en: Philomena, age 28, is married with one child who is 4 years old. She has a shop and has been running a business for 10 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more sugar, soaps, rice and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soaps, rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Salvator

texts.en: Salvator is 52 years old and married with four children, ages ten to twenty-one years old.  All of his children go to school.  He has a bar for 23 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 37 years old. She is married with two children aged between 2 and 5 years, and one of them goes to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been in a business for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy tomatoes and cabbages to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Shirley is 35 years old and has one child in school.

Shirley has a buy and sell cosmetics business in the Philippines. Shirley requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more cosmetic products to sell.

Shirley has been in this business for three years.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 42 years old. She is married, with six children between the ages of 9 and 24 years.  Four of them go to school. 

She sells clothes, and has been selling in a business for nine years. 

After getting her loan, she would like to buy more shirts and bed sheets to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and bed sheets

loans.name: Theonille

texts.en: Theonille is 36 years old and married with six children, ages two to fifteen years old.  Four of her children go to school. She sells food items and has been running a business for eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 66-year-old, married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like bananas, and rearing animals. He also sells local beer. He faces challenges of price fluctuation. Besides that, he hopes to have enough monthly income and to educate his family to higher levels of learning. Paul needs a loan to buy a heifer for his farm.

loans.use: to buy a heifer for his farm.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 35-year-old, married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells tomatoes and grows food crops like Irish potatoes, matooke and sweet potatoes. He faces a challenge of limited capital. Besides that, he hopes to have a good business and a healthy family. John needs a loan to buy iron sheets for roofing his house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for roofing his house.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a 41-year-old single woman with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda.  She is a poultry farmer who also operates a general merchandise shop where she earns additional income. She began the business in order to look after her children.  Annet has a dream of educating her children; however, she is faced with limited capital. Annet wants money to buy poultry feed and  more chicks.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds and more chicks.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a hardworking man, age 40 years; he is happily married, with four children. He grew up in a very humble family which had little assets and even without school fees to educate him. 

He opted to work in the nearby national park as a gardener to earn a living. Due to his hard work, he managed to save some money and bought a piece of land in Ruti Trading Centre in Mbarara District, where he planted bananas. This enabled him to get income to earn a living to the extent that he even managed to start constructing a house, which is yet to be completed. 

He is therefore requesting a loan of 2,000,000 to finish the family house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is a very young housewife who lives in the small village of Subhas Pally in Maynaguri under the Jalpaiguri district. She has two children and one of them is going to school. Her husband is a carpenter, purely on a daily basis with no permanent earnings. That occupation gives their family a temporary living condition and they always feel anxious about their present situation. 

So Rama wants to change their situation consciously and decided to purchase a cow to supply milk and milk products in her area. The milk and milk products enhance their capacity of earning money and by selling those products they can earn more profit in the near future. 

Rama applied for a Kiva loan through BJS who is the field partner of Kiva. After receiving the loan from BJS, Rama and her family are feeling safe and secure. She gives her heartfelt thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk and milk products selling business.

loans.name: Quirina

texts.en:
Quirina is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan. She used this for her sidecar business, which her husband drives. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and to meet their daily living expenses. To augment her income, she recently went into direct selling.

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more personal products, such as beauty products, footwear, and cleaning agents. Dealers buy the products at a lower price than shown on the catalog then sell them at a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. Her added income of 2,000 PHP a month helps in meeting their daily household expense. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be provided.

Quirina hopes to improve her business and aims to give her children the best education possible so that they may have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for household and personal products to sell.

loans.name: Asanairi

texts.en: Asanairi is twenty-eight years old and married with no children.  He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and has been in that service for four years.  He likes his profession. He also practices farming to earn additional income. He has a dream of starting a business that generates daily income.  Asanairi is faced with a challenge of long distances between home and work. Asanairi wants money to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate is a 36-year-old lady with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a retailer and also does farming. She faces a challenge of defaulters. However, she has hopes of building a permanent home. Immaculate needs a loan to buy soap, cooking oil, bread, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, cooking oil, bread, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en:
Zakayo is a 55-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He distills alcohol, alongside farming, the business he started in 2002 with a hope of raising his income to look after his family. He faces challenges of little capital, but besides that, he has hopes of having enough land and a healthy family. 

Zakayo has asked for a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a 28-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer, and at the same time, a teacher. He faces a challenge of little capital, besides that, he has hopes of having enough stock and educating his family to higher levels of learning. 

Tadeo needs a loan to buy cooking oil, sugar, salt , and soap to sell.

loans.use: to add a stock of cooking oil, sugar, salt and soap

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en: Rossett is a 40-year old woman with twelve children who depend on her for survival.  All children attend school.  She is married to a man who does not offer any support to the family.  As he steals his wife’s money to go and drink, all of the responsibilities are left to her. Because of such a big family and responsibilities, she decided to open up a baby shop.  This business has helped her to manage school fees for her children and to look after the whole family. The business has also enabled her to construct a semi-permanent house for her family.  She is requesting a 5,000,000 UGX loan to add stock to her business.

loans.use: to buy baby items to sell.

loans.name: Agam

texts.en:
Agam is a married 36-years-old woman with two children, ages ten and eighteen years old. Many year ago, she established her poultry farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy chicks for her business. In the future, Agam plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her business.

loans.name: Ram Maya

texts.en:
Ram Maya is a married 52-year-old woman with three children. Many year ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan buy seeds and fertilizers for her business. In the future, Ram Maya plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ruku

texts.en:
Ruku is a 46-years-old married woman with two children. Many years ago, she established her poultry farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent to buy chicks for her business. In the future, Ruku plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inputs for her vegetable business.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a single man, 23 years of age, living in Kasese, Uganda. For two years Gerald has been in teaching and was inspired by other teachers to join the profession. Gerald has a dream of developing himself.  However, he is faced with a challenge of being overworked and under little pay. Gerald wants money to buy sugar, soap, cassava flour and other general merchandise to sell and to increase on his income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, cassava flour and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 29 years old, and single with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. Christine has been in teaching service for nine years. Christine has a dream of having a business. She is a simple woman and easy to approach.  However, she is faced with a challenge of under payment and being overworked. Christine wants money to buy cement and sand for construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand for construction of her house.

loans.name: Phulajalan

texts.en:
Phulajalan is 42 years old woman and has an only son who is in ninth grade. Her husband Tahiruddin is engaged in agricultural work. They have an agricultural land where they farm seasonally. Maynaguri area is well-known for tea gardening and a tea plantation is one of the profitable businesses here. So she and her husband think it is useful for them to utilize this for wellbeing of their family. 

Phulajalan wants to take a loan and with this loan she wants to start a tea plantation business to help her husband and family too. She is seeking a loan from BJS who is the field partner of Kiva and with the loan amount she will buy tea saplings, fertilizers, and other necessary inputs to grow tea plants in their farm land. 

To choose the right business at the right time is one of the biggest capacities of Phulajalan and with this quality she may able to run her new business in an accurate direction. Her enthusiasm and capacity to inhale the sense of business is truly appreciable. She and her husband are now feeling comfortable and secure for their future life and they may capable of educating their only son to establish his life. 

She gives heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for a tea plantation.

loans.name: Raquel Esther

texts.es:
Raquel es una joven que quiere estudiar derecho, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Raquel, soy de San Pedro de Macorís, Republica Dominicana. Tengo 20 años y vivo con mis padres, una hermana y dos sobrinos. Mi padre trabaja como taxista en motocicleta y mi Madre es ama de casa.
Quiero estudiar Derecho en la Universidad del Caribe, Santo Domingo. Finalice mis estudios de secundaria en el Politécnico Gastón Fernando Deligne, en el área de comercio, tuve la dicha de encontrarme con materias relacionadas al derecho, como las leyes de tránsito, Derecho laboral, La constitución, etc. Verme relacionada con las mismas fue provocando que cada vez más me enamorara de esta carrera.
Poder entender la belleza de esta, el orden, las reglas, la justicia, las leyes… La Universidad del Caribe, es una de las mejores en el país en cuanto al derecho, para mí sería un verdadero honor poder ingresar con la oportunidad educativa que me brinda FUNDAPEC-KIVA.
Provengo de una familia humilde, mis padres no tienen los recursos necesarios para costearme la carrera, soy asistente de un médico, cobro mensual $5,000.00, este pequeño sueldo y ayuda de mis padres podrían costear mis pasajes, comidas y libros. Estoy pidiendo un préstamo de KIVA para pagar mi matricula. Sino encuentro una beca o un préstamo, no voy a poder estudiar.
Si me aprueban este préstamo, voy a estudiar mucho para graduarme en tiempo y conseguir un buen trabajo, me gustaría trabajar en el Tribunal de Justicia de Sato Domingo. Es indignante ver cómo va en nuestra sociedad las injusticias, quiero trabajar para el bienestar de la sociedad y dar a demostrar que puede haber abogados justos, honestos y de principios.
texts.en:
Raquel is a young woman who wants to study law. She is requesting a loan in order to cover her expenses. This is her story:

“My name is Raquel and I’m from San Pedro de Macorís in the Dominican Republic. I am 20 years old and live with my parents, a sister, and two nephews. My father works as a motorcycle taxi driver and my mother is a homemaker.

I want to study law at “Universidad del Caribe” (University of the Caribbean) in Santo Domingo. I completed my secondary studies at the Gastón Fernando Deligne Politechnical Institute with a specialization in business. I had the pleasure of discovering subjects related to the law, such as traffic law, labor law, the constitution, and other topics. Seeing how all of these subjects are interrelated was what attracted me to this degree program.

To understand the beauty of the subject – the order, the regulations, the justice system, and the laws – the University of the Caribbean is one of the best law schools in the country. For me, it would be a real honor to pursue this educational opportunity being offered by FUNDAPEC and Kiva.

I come from a humble family, so my parents don’t have the necessary income to afford my degree program. I work as a medical assistant and earn a small monthly salary of $5000. Along with the help of my parents, I am able to afford the cost of travel, food, and books. I am requesting a Kiva loan in order to pay my tuition. Unless I receive a scholarship or a loan, I won’t be able to study.

If I get approved for this loan, I will study hard so that I can graduate on time and secure a good job. I would like to work for the Supreme Court in Santo Domingo. It is shocking to see the injustice that exists in our society, so I want to work for the public welfare and demonstrate that I can be a fair, honest, and principled lawyer.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education expenses.

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin is 33 years old, and married with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. Godwin has run a grocery and a general merchandise shop since 2009, and he also owns a mobile money shop to supplement his income. Godwin has a dream of growing his business into a supermarket. Godwin wants money to buy sugar, salt, rice, soya and groceries to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, rice, soya, and groceries to sell.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su ciclo 11 de programa de comités, son 20 mujeres, que quieren salir adelante mediante su esfuerzo y su unión, cada una de ellas forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana, quien ha ido mejorando a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo. Ella se dedica a ser peluquera, es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy luchadora, que se sacrifica por sus seres queridos, para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su peluquería, para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Ella agradece por la oportunidad que todas reciben de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
This group is in its 11th loan cycle with the committee program. It consists of 20 women who want to get ahead through their effort and their unity. Each member is a participant in the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Sra. Juana, who wants to keep improving through her work and her continued efforts. She works as a hairdresser. Juana is a hardworking woman, but most of all, she is a determined individual who is willing to make sacrifices on behalf of her loved ones. She wants them to have everything that she was not able to have. Juana is requesting this loan so that she can buy various supplies for her beauty salon. As a result, she can continue offering good service to her customers.

Juana is grateful for the opportunity that all of the members have received so that they can improve their living conditions and those of their families.

loans.use: to buy various supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es estudiante, está cursando el cuarto año de la carrera de contabilidad pública en una de las mejores universidades. A pesar de la distancia y de las dificultades y con el apoyo de su familia  comenta que llegará a culminar su carrera.
Una vez terminada la carrera espera ocupar un lugar importante como profesional y su meta futura es llegar a especializarse en el exterior y así poder ayudar también económicamente a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en: Sandra is a student. She is currently in her fourth year in one of the best the universities studying public accounting. Despite the distance and the difficulties and with the support of her family Sandra is about to culminate her studies. Once she finishes her degree, she hopes to find an important position as a professional. Her goal is to eventually specialize in foreign affairs so that she will be able to help with her family's finances. Sandra is requesting this loan to pay her university fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Sajana

texts.en:
Sajana is a 38-years-old married woman with two children. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Sajana plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores (pasal) are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 29-year-old married woman with two children. Many year ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business. In the future, Anita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Soma

texts.en:
Soma is a very young woman entrepreneur who wants to stand with her husband for smooth running of their family by running a business of her own. Soma only 23 years old and has one child. She and her husband both are educated up to school level and her husband has his own business, too. 

Soma wishes to run a grocery shop where the daily-need-based products will be sold. There is a lack of these necessary shops within the locality. She is a very young entrepreneur so there is a zeal to establish herself in the best manner and Soma tries to utilize that chance. 

But the only constraint is sufficient funds by which Soma may able to cross her hurdles and successfully win the race of her life. She heard about BJS and Kiva and then she decided to take a loan from Kiva through BJS. She also decided that with the loan, she will purchase more modern and necessary grocery items for which there is extreme demand in their locality. 

Soma gives heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock of grocery items to start her grocery shop.

loans.name: Rayiimsoom Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yacouba est le représentant du groupe RAYIMSOOM. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 07 enfants, le plus âgé a 27 ans et le moins âgé a 06 ans. 03 vont à l’école. Il a 12 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est vendeur de pièces détachées depuis 06 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont les habitants son quartier.
Il  veut s’acheter 05 pneus, 05 chambre à air, 05 moyaux, 05 chaines à vélo.
Monsieur Yacouba veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Il ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin et subvenir au besoin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Monsieur Yacouba is the representative of the Rayimsoom group. He is in good health. He is married and the father of seven children between the ages of six and 27. Three of his children go to school. He has 12 dependents in all. 

He has been selling parts for six years. He buys his supplies in the neighboring markets. His clients are neighborhood residents.

He would like to buy five tires, five inner tubes, five wheel hubs, and five bicycle chains. Monsieur Yacouba would like to use his profits to strengthen his business. He would like to open a large store and meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: buy five tires, five inner tubes, five wheel hubs, and five bicycle chains.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a chainsaw services business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her chainsaw services business.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her chainsaw services business

loans.name: Palita

texts.en:
Palita lives in a small village called Bengkandi, Kamarbari under Maynaguri. She is a housewife but she wants to help her husband to run their family smoothly and hassle-free. Her husband is a mason and his work is purely seasonal and temporary. 

She is the mother of two children who go to a nearby school. Palita and her husband have the dream that one day their children would be well educated and established in their life.

Palita and her husband know that the dreams can be fulfilled only by running their family smoothly with sufficient monthly income. So they decided to take a loan to purchase a cow for the business of milk and milk products. 

The demand of milk and milk products is high in their locality and if they supply more milk and milk products, their profit will be increased day by day.  They understand the market requirements; she wants to enhance her dairy business in a fresh mode with more cows so that she can expand the farm’s products.

She is grateful to her kind lenders those who extend their hands of assistance towards her.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk and milk products selling business.

loans.name: Nabina

texts.en:
Nabina is 28 years old. She is married and has 3 children aged 3, 2 and 1. Many years ago, she established her poultry farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy small chicks for her business. In the future, Nabina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chicks

loans.name: Hiyari Group

texts.en:
Prosperia is in her early 40s and is single with two sons who are still in school. She has been selling charcoal for two years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Prosperia's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she will use it to buy sacks of charcoal to resell. She dreams of opening a tailoring shop.

Prosperia will share this loan with her group "Hiyari" which consists of eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 33 years old and married with five children, who are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds.

Roselyn has been pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from buying and selling recycled materials.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more bamboo, paint varnish, paint brushes, etc., for her furniture making business.

Helen has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from buying and selling recycled materials.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo, paint varnish, paint brushes, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 56 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Victoria is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to 
buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Victoria has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to  buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Amalia is borrowing 18,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 33 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Matilde requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Matilde has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Matilde would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anniemaude

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Anniemaude. She is married and has three children, ages 16, 4 and 1. In 2003, Anniemaude established her pharmacy business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband in taking care of their home. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month form this business. 

Anniemaude used proceeds of her last loan to pay school fees for her children and to provide a livelihood for her family. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Anniemaude requires a loan in order to buy more medicines for her pharmacy. In the future, Anniemaude plans to open another shop, provide support for the education of her children to university level, and to become an international businesswoman. She is very hardworking, and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medicines for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Kpanmanga- Nakpayili Group

texts.en:
Safura is a 56-year-old, hardworking woman, from Nakpayili in the Northern region of Ghana. She is married and has five children. She is the individual pictured with her hands on the shea nuts, among members squatting.

Safura is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last 13 years. The name of the group is ‘Kpanmanga- Nakpayili’. Safura earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana, on how to improve their shea butter processing business, so that they can always produce premium quality for the local markets around Bimbilla and non-local markets.

Safura and ‘Kpanmanga- Nakpayili’ have asked for a loan of GHS 7,300.  Her share of the loan is GHS 700, which would be used to buy shea nuts for processing into shea butter. Safura aspires to earn more income, as well as to repay this loan and to support her family with food and educational materials. Safura thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts for processing into shea butter.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in hand-carved wood sculptures. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials for his designs.

Armando has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"I learned the art of woodcarving thanks to my brother Salvador. For a very long time, this has been the way we bring food to our homes. Sometimes I also work planting coffee, or as a brick mason; I paint houses and give them maintenance. I believe that we should take advantage of all that God gives us to get ahead in life. The most important thing for me is to be more successful day by day, to watch my children grow and to offer them better opportunities through my work."

"Thanks for your support! With this microcredit, I will be able to invest in my business."

Use the link below to view Armando's hand-carved wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8311

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in bulk for his designs.

loans.name: Ratamanegre Group

texts.fr:
Mme Clarisse est la représentante du groupe RATAMANEGRE. Elle se porte très bien. Marié, elle est mère de 03 enfants, le plus âgé a 09 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle  a 03 personnes  en charge.
Madame est vendeuse de mèches depuis 08 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les femmes.
Elle  veut s’acheter  05 douzaines de mèches, 10 douzaines de perles.
Mme Clarisse veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un salon bien équipé et aider son mari dans la charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Madame Clarisse is the representative of the Ratamanegre group. She is in good health. She is married and the mother of three children between the ages of three and nine. One of her children goes to school. She has three dependents. 

She has been selling hair extensions for eight years. She buys her supplies in the neighborhood market. Her clients are women. 

She would like to buy five dozen hair extensions and 10 dozen beads. She would like to open a well-equipped salon and help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: buy five dozen hair extensions and 10 dozen beads.

loans.name: Narasco

texts.en:
Narasco, who is in his late 20’s, is single.  He has been selling secondhand shoes since 2012. He works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly report.  

This will be Narasco's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase the secondhand stock and can now sell to many customers.  He used the profits to take care of himself and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy the updated styles to meet his customers' requirements.  He dreams of going abroad to buy his stock. Narasco will make sure that he repays his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy the updated styles to meet his customers' requirements.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
Heriberto es estudiante de la carrera de Derecho, vive con sus padres que son comerciantes, dentro de unos años se ve ejerciendo su profesión. Le gustaría  terminar su carrera y trabajar en el palacio de Justicia.
Comenta que es un joven que se esta esforzando por poder cumplir con sus metas, y es por ello que se esta esforzando y esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le será muy útil para poder seguir con su esfuerzo y lucha.
texts.en:
Heriberto is a law student. He lives with his parents, who make a living as business owners. Heriberto sees himself practicing his profession. He would like to finish school then work with the Palace of Justice. Heriberto is a young man who works hard to achieve his dreams. For this reason he is working with such dedication. 

Heriberto is requesting this loan to pay for his studies. This will be very useful to help him continue working hard and fighting.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 44 years old. She is married with eight children, aged between 5 and 20 years, and all of them go to school. She sells charcoal and has been running a business for the past 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 37 years old. She is married and has four children, aged between 3 and 11 years. Two of the children go to school. She sells foodstuffs, and has been working in a business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy potatoes and yams to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and yams to sell

loans.name: Neema Kimara Group

texts.en:
Nelly is in her early 30s and is single with no small kids. She has been running a business of selling charcoal for one year now. She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be one of Nelly's many loans from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her charcoal stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support. She used the profit to buy a TV set, a deck, a sofa set, a bed, a cupboard for kitchen ware, and covered household expenses to take care of her child as she is a single parent.  She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell. She dreams of opening a big charcoal business.

Nelly will share this loan with her loan group "Neema Kimara," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Olegario

texts.es:
El Señor Olegario, está casado, tiene ya una familia formada, sus  hijos ya son mayores de edad, todos profesionales, que con mucho sacrificio y con la ayuda de su esposa pudieron sacar adelante.
El tiene una despensa bien surtida que tiene desde hace 15 años aproximadamente, donde surte a la comunidad de productos envasados, así como también de panificados, leche, carne, verduras, también cría, faena y vende en su negocio o de forma particular animales de granja como chancho, gallina, pato, ganso, y su esposa se encarga de administrar el negocio.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche, panificados, carne y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su modesto negocio.
texts.en:
Olegario is married and has children who are already grown up. With much sacrifice and with the help of his wife, he was able to support the children to become professionals.

He has a well-stocked food store that he has kept for about fifteen years. He offes to the community canned food products, as well as 
baked goods, milk, meat, and vegetables.

He also raises farm animals such as pigs, hens, ducks, and geese, for slaughter and selling in the store or through private sales. His wife runs this business.

He is requesting this loan to purchase milk, baked goods, meat, and other items so that he can continue with his modest business.

loans.use: to buy milk, baked goods, meat and other items.

loans.name: Leoncie

texts.en: Leoncie is 42 years old. She is married with three children aged between 12 and 18 years, and all of them go to school. She sells vegetables and has been doing this business for the past 10 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more onions, cabbages and carrots to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more onions, cabbages and carrots to sell.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 35 years old. She is married with five children aged between 3 and 18 years old, and all of them go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been running a business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum, beans and groundnuts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum, beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en: Mr. Bat-Erdene, 41 years old, lives with his pregnant wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 1999. His wife works in the banking sector, but currently took her maternity leave. Their two children go to high school. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some repairs, so he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy insulation materials such as fiberglass, foam and bricks for house renovation. After renovation, his pregnant wife will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned for heating, and then fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 42 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell nipa palm business in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Bernadette has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell for 20 years and also earns an income from manicure services. Bernadette aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Byambachimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Byambachimeg used her previous loan to buy computer spare parts from China and expanded her business substantially. She has been selling computers and spare parts for many years. Now she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy smartphones in large quantity in order to launch a new business. Recently the demand for smartphones has increased in Mongolia, but demand for computers declined greatly, so she wants to gradually change her business into one of smartphone sales.

loans.use: to buy smartphones in large quantity for her business.

loans.name: Khaliun

texts.en: Mrs. Khaliun, 27 years old, lives with her husband and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as physical education teacher at college since 2011. Her husband rents out a cafeteria for a living. Their child stays at kindergarten. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) in order to live outside the capital city. She is pregnant and soon getting her maternity leave. Ulaanbaatar is the most polluted city in Mongolia, so she wants to stay in a clean atmosphere during her maternity leave, in order to give birth.

loans.use: to buy a Mongolian traditional ger in order to move outside of the polluted city.

loans.name: Sari Makmur Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut feels very grateful, because she and the Sari Makmur Group were successful enough to make their payment. As they expected, all the pigs grew healthy and fat, and they sold out. The group members earned a satisfactory profit. The profits are used to fulfill their families' daily needs, plus their children's school fees and savings. Two of the members have decided to stop borrowing, because they intend to focus on helping their husbands at their gardens, to plant the crops. Those members were replaced by two new members.

For this new loan, Ni Ketut has been chosen as the head of the group again, because she’s a responsible woman. Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase good-quality feed only. She has already bought piglets, using her own money taken from the profit earned during the last loan period. She hopes she can increase her savings, which she will later use as business capital.

One group member is not in the picture, because of illness.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality feed.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy materials for her tailoring business.  Her earnings are a big help to sustain her family's daily needs. 

She would now like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy more fabric, thread and other items needed in her business, and some personal direct selling products for added income.  Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily personal, household, and school needs.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Elizabeth hopes that she will have more clients this coming Christmas season. She dreams to give her family a better future and to be able to send her children to the best schools until college. She meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.
 She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 42 years old and married with five children who are in school. Cleofe works very hard to provide for them. She raises pigs in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Cleofe has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Cleofe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en: Mr. Davaa used his previous loan for installing vacuum insulated windows and hardwood floors, which made his home a more comfortable and warm place to live. This time he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as shingles, bricks, fiberglass and foam for house renovation, as winter is coming closer to Mongolia. A renovated house will shield the family from catching cold while living in their house. Also, the family will burn less coal for heating, releasing fewer pollutants into the air and saving money on coal purchase.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Don Francisco tiene 73 años de edad, está casado hace mas de 25 años, tiene 2 hijos todos mayores  de edad y vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, él cómo su esposa siguen trabajando y luchando para procurarse una vejez digna. 
El señor Francisco trabajó más de 20 años como empleado de una curtiembre, con la plata que ganaba fue ahorrando por un buen tiempo y así logro comprarse un camioncito para poder hacer trabajar en el servicio de fletes. Actualmente cuenta con camiones grandes guiados por su hijo, que se dedica al servicio de fletes, y de esa forma la familia se ayuda.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cubiertas para su camión para seguir brindando buen servicio, y poder continuar con su trabajo, luchando.
texts.en:
Francisco is 73 years old. He has been married for over 25 years and has two adult children. Francisco lives in the city of Carapeguá. He and his spouse are still working and fighting every day to obtain a dignified old age. 

Francisco worked more than 20 years as an employee for a tannery. With the money he earned, Francisco saved up to buy a small truck so that he would be able to work as a cargo service. Currently, he has large trucks that his son guides. His son also makes a living in this cargo service, helping his father. 

Francisco is requesting this loan in order to buy tires for his truck to continue offering good service and be able to continue with his work, fighting.

loans.use: to buy truck tires.

loans.name: Ulzii-Utas

texts.en:
Ulzii-Utas, who is 27 years old, lives with her husband in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a lithographer at a carpet factory since 2007. Her husband is a cook and works at a bakery. Last year, they built a small house of blocks.
