Năng lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Năng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Năng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Năng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Năng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain the success of the business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to catch fish to sell

loans.name: Rubiela Alaide

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajadora, así es Rubiela, una mujer guerrera que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Medellín, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como almuerzos y desayunos en un pequeño restaurante.

Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su restaurante porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.

Rubiela ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para comprar sillas, mesas y surtido de gaseosas y frituras y de este modo aumentar el inventario de productos que vende alternamente.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Rubiela is humble and hard-working, a fighting woman who has dedicated a large part of her life to taking care of her children.  She lives in the city of Medellín and she makes a living preparing various foods such as lunches and breakfasts at a small restaurant.  

Her cooking is well known by the residents of the area who visit her restaurant because they know that they can eat delicious food there.  

Rubiela has decided to improve her business and increase her sales, so she is asking for a loan to buy chairs, tables, and supplies of soft drinks and fried foods and therefore increase the inventory of the products that she sells alternately.  

This loan will allow her to move her business forwards to make enough profits to give her the opportunity to continue sustaining her family and her business.

Support this woman with a loan and help her make her dreams come true!

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, and supplies of soft drinks and fried food for her restaurant

loans.name: Entente Group

texts.fr: Entente est un groupe de deux femmes battantes qui exercent dans le domaine alimentaire. Ces femmes sont à leur troisième prêt avec ACFIME et elle font des remboursements correctes. Korotimi, la responsable du groupe fait des gâteaux pour vendre et cela fait trois ans qu'elle fait cette activité. Cette brave dame est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont dans la vie active et un continue d'aller à l'école. Avec ce crédit, Korotimi compte acheter de la farine de blé et autres ingrédients pour faire des gâteaux vendre. Le bénéfice de ses ventes lui permettront de contribuer aux charges familiales, de mieux prendre soin de ses enfants et de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Entente is a group of two warrior women who work in food. This is their third loan with ACFIME and they are making proper repayments. 

Korotimi, the group manager, has been making and selling cakes for three years.  This brave woman is married and the mother of three children—two of whom work and one of whom goes to school. 

With this loan, Korotimi would like to buy wheat flour and other ingredients to make and sell cakes. The profits will allow her to contribute to the household expenses, take better care of her children, and strengthen her business.

loans.use: buy wheat flour and other ingredients to make and sell cakes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Anife

texts.en:
Anife is 34-years-old, married and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement. With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. 
Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan to buy additional feed for her growing hogs to generate more income. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to more easily keep sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her growing hogs to generate more income.

loans.name: Nhóm 14 Thôn 10 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyệt operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools to catch fish for sale. Nguyệt is 39 years old and she is married with 1 child. Nguyệt is the group leader of the Nhóm 14 thôn 10 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. Nguyệt lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nguyệt's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Nguyệt has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nguyệt faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business' profit, Nguyệt hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase tools to catch fish for sale.

loans.name: Oysara

texts.ru: Ойсара уже 2 года как занимается продажей миндаля. Ее предки занимались торговлей, и Ойсара решила тоже начать торговую деятельность из-за финансовых затруднений семьи. Ойсара не имеет прилавки или магазина, она, как и многие продавцы приносит свой товар в мешках, располагает их прямо на земле и занимается продажей. Она не жалуется на условия работы, но ей бы хотелось расширить торговую деятельность, увеличить доход и создать условия работы. На данный момент Ойсара обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести большое количество миндаля оптом для дальнейшей перепродажи. Ойсара надеется, что кредит ей поможет и для реализации ее планов, а также улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Oysara has been selling almonds for two years already.  Her family has long been involved in commerce, so Oysara herself decided to start her own commercial business, in the hope of solving some financial difficulties.  She doesn't own a shop or a booth.  Instead, like many other vendors, she brings her merchandise in bags,  and displays the goods that she sells directly on the ground.  Oysara is not complaining about her working conditions, but she would love to increase her activity and her income, and improve her work environment.  She is currently taking a loan to buy a bulk quantity of almonds for resale.  Oysara is hoping that this loan will help her to achieve her goals and will enable her to improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy almonds for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and to buy educational equipment for her son

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Thôn Trung 8 -Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Hằng is 40 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Hằng has been a fisherman for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hằng is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 06 Thôn Trung 8 - Quảng Nham solidarity group. This is Hằng's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is applying for a loan to purchase equipment to catch fish to sell. 

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to catch fish to sell.

loans.name: Duyên

texts.en:
Duyên is 32 years old and is married with three dependent children. She lives with her family in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Duyên has worked in agriculture farming poultry and cattle for five years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having  a hygienic latrine. Therefore, Duyên is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Duyên hopes to build a new house, and that her family will be healthy and happy, and her children will do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda, aged 60, is a widow with three adult children. As a way of generating income, she has been engaged in cooking and selling meals and snacks within her community. She aims to make her business profitable so she can earn sufficient income. 

Luzviminda wants to cook more kinds of recipes to sell but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to take out a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fresh vegetables, meat, fish and the seasonings necessary for cooking the food that she sells. 

Through this loan, Luzviminda believes that some day, she will improve the business as well as her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables, meat, fish and the seasonings necessary for cooking the food that she sells

location.town: Brgy. San Fernando, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Phượng

texts.en:
Phượng is 54 years old and is married with three children, two of whom are dependent. She and her family live in the Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Phượng has worked in agriculture farming food for more than 10 years.

In 2011, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and has successfully repaid one loan. The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet .

In the future, Phượng hopes to remodel her house, that her business will do well, and that her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Lực

texts.en:
Lực is 50 years old and is married with three children, none of whom are dependent. She lives in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  Lực has worked in agriculture farming food for more than 10 years.

In 2013, Lực joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business and has successfully repaid one loan. The main hardship that Lực faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Lực hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Higinio

texts.en:
Higinio owns and operates a food stall. He has been successful in this business for years, and he repaid his previous loan used for the business. He also finds ways to improve his income through selling meat products.

Relative to this, he would like to take a new loan to increase his profit. He is requesting an amount of PHP 15,000 to buy products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, in larger quantities.

Higinio hopes to open branches of his business and he also desires that his children will be able to complete their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and buy a bicycle for her daughter

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She also has been operating her own house rental business for 14 years and she earns a good income from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for their children. The couple had to work hard, with the determination of having better income to provide their children with better education, that they do not currently have. 

To improve her profit, Jean would like to apply for a new loan for the maintenance of the boarding house. An amount of PHP 51,000 could already help her in the renovation and beautification of their place so that they could attract more boarders. She will also utilize the loan to add to the capital needed for her buy-and-sell business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Jean hopes that they will have more boarders and customers. She also desires to start other businesses for  additional income in order to giver her family a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent and to use it as a secondary business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and buy a new bicycle for her son

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris, 46 years old, is married and a resident of Canlambo, Siquijor, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold at the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already. Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. 

On July 17, 2011 both Iris and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail themselves of a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings. She has now applied for a loan to buy fish for resale to gain more profit and benefit her family. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience & diligence of her husband she can look forward to being a successful vendor someday and to own a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale to gain more profit and benefit her family.

loans.name: Silvia Guadalupe

texts.es: Silvia de 47 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 23 y 27 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que por sus propios medios ha sabido sacar adelante a sus hijos, por lo que cada día sale desde muy temprano a ganarse la vida con la venta de ropa que realiza desde hace más de 20 años en los mercados cercanos de su localidad. Silvia desea invertir en su negocio ya que casi es la temporada de mayor venta por lo que desea adquirir productos por mayoreo para obtener una mejor ganancia por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, camisas, blusas, faldas, camisetas, vestidos, etc. Para ampliar su negocio y poder así aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su ganancias.
texts.en:
Silvia, 47, lives in her own house with her two children aged 23 and 27. She is a woman who has been able to look after her children on her own.  

To do this, she leaves home very early every day so she can earn a living selling clothes.  She has been doing this activity for more than 20 years in the local markets. 

She would like to invest in her business as she is approaching the time of the year when sales are at their highest.  Therefore, she wants to purchase products wholesale to improve her profits.  

She is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, t-shirts, dresses, etc.  This will widen the range of products she offers and as a result, increase sales and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia es divorciada y tiene 5 hijos, ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Delia se gana la vida como comerciante de una tienda de barrio pero el problema es que DElia no puede competir en igualdad de condiciones puesto que su tienda es pequeña, por eso necesita un credito para poder surtirse de mayor mercaderia (refrescos) Delia es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y sus hijos todavia son muy pequeños para colaborar, por eso quiere su ayuda, ademas la clienta goza de buena salud
texts.en:
Delia is divorced and has five children.  She lives in La Paz in a brick house which she pays to rent.  She earns a living as a trader in a local store.  

However, the problem is that Delia cannot compete on the same level as others because her shop is small.  For this reason, she needs a loan to be able to stock her store with more market goods (soft drinks).  

Delia is the only source of income in her home as her children are still too young to work.  Therefore, she needs help.  In addition, she is a healthy woman.

loans.use: to buy more products (soft drinks).

loans.name: Rafael Angel

texts.es: Rafael Ángel, tiene la edad de 46 años, está casado, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de algunos insumos y fertilizantes adecuados aplicarlos en  suplantación de café, además de comprar algunas plantas de  almácigo con un buen desarrollo y sanidad para que rápidamente tenga un tamaño parecido al ya plantado y así mejorar la densidad de plantas por área, también realizar algunos trabajos de labores agrícolas, como lo son la conservación de suelos por medio de realización de canales a nivel para que el agua de lluvia no pueda realizar lavados, principalmente en las partes con más pendientes, con estas prácticas de trabajo espera cumplir con el objetivo de tener una plantación con mejor sanidad y un suelo con más fertilidad y por ende una mejor cosecha. Con esta compra de productos adecuados tendrá una calidad mejor de producto para el consumidor. Él ya ha recibido préstamos con FUDECOSUR y no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, además  FUDECOSUR siempre le ha brindado préstamos con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rafael Angel, 46, is married and lives with his wife and two children who are his main priority.  He wants to use the loan to buy supplies and fertilizers for his coffee plantation and also wants to buy healthy, well-developed nursery plants so they grow quickly to the same size as his crops to improve plantation density.  He also will do other farm jobs such as soil conservation by digging canals to avoid rain damage to slope areas.  This will help with his goal of having a healthier crop and more fertile cropland, improving his harvest.

Through buying the right products the quality of the end product will be better for consumers.  He has already received loans through FUDECOSUR and has had no other state bank loans.  FUDECOSUR has always given him better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To care for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Productividad, utilidades e ingresos, se incrmentaron con su anterior credikiva aplicado al negocio de Maria.  Ella ha mejorado su vivienda y su negocio ha incrmentado sus ventas. Hoy requiere una vitrina mostradora y necesita finalizar sus adecuaciones locativas en la vivienda de su propiedad, por eso una vez mas acude a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará materiales cosntructivos y una vitrina mostradora, realizará esta inversión para que su negocio mejore cada vez mas . Maria envia un mensaje de agradecimiento y dice que gracias a los finaciadores de Kiva su negocio prospera y esto es justamente el éxito de un credikiva.
texts.en:
Maria was able to improve productivity, profit and income thanks to her last Credikiva loan.  She has improved her home and has improved sales in her business. 

Right now, she needs a display cabinet and to finish some improvements to the house she owns.  For this reason, she is asking Credikiva for a loan once again.  

She will use the loan to buy building materials and a display cabinet.  This investment will help her business to improve more and more. Maria wants to send a message of thanks by saying that because of the help from Kiva financiers, her business is prospering, which is what Kiva success is all about.

loans.use: to buy building materials and a display cabinet for her business.

loans.name: Seidy

texts.es: Seidy, tiene la edad de 43 años, está casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de algunos insumos y fertilizantes adecuados aplicarlos en  suplantación de café, además de comprar algunas plantas de  almácigo con un buen desarrollo y sanidad para que rápidamente tenga un tamaño parecido al ya plantado y así mejorar la densidad de plantas por área, también realizar algunos trabajos de labores agrícolas, como lo son la conservación de suelos por medio de realización de canales a nivel para que el agua de lluvia no pueda realizar lavados, principalmente en las partes con más pendientes, con estas prácticas de trabajo espera cumplir con el objetivo de tener una plantación con mejor sanidad y un suelo con más fertilidad y por ende una mejor cosecha. Con esta compra de productos adecuados tendrá una calidad mejor de producto para el consumidor. Él ya ha recibido préstamos con FUDECOSUR y no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, además  FUDECOSUR siempre le ha brindado préstamos con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Seidy, 43, is married and lives with her husband and two children, who are the most important thing in her life. With the loan she wants to buy some supplies and suitable fertilizers to use on her coffee plantations.  

She would also like to buy some seedlings which are well developed and healthy, which means that they will soon have the same size as those which she already has in her plantations.  In this way, she will have greater density of plants on her land.  

She would also like to do some agricultural work, such as looking after her land with channels that will prevent the rain water from washing away the seeds, especially in the areas where there are slopes.  By putting all of this into practice, she hopes to achieve her aim of having a more healthy plantation, more fertile soil and as a result, a better harvest.  With the purchase of these products she will produce a better quality product for the customer. 

She has already received loans through FUDECOSUR, but has not had any loans through any of the state banks.  Besides, FUDECOSUR has always made it easier for her to secure a loan with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: sow more coffee seeds.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
Jose tiene 38 años de edad  de estado civil casado vive con su hijo de 12 años en el cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar, en la comunidad Nueva Esperanza.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Rural Cooperativa Curi-Ñan  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva esperanza, esta se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Jose se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, papas y trigo. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida y para su mantenimiento para sembrar papas. La compra lo realiza en Guaranda. Su meta es aumentar la siembra y sacar a su familia adelante. Su desafío es las enfermedades en los sembríos. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jose, 38, is married and lives with his wife and 12-year-old son in Guaranda in the Bolivar province, in the Nueva Esperanza community.

He is a member of the solidarity group 'Rural Cooperativa Curi-Nan' which operates in the Nueva Esperanza community.  They are dedicated to agricultural work and livestock.

Jose works in agriculture and grows corn, potatoes and wheat. He is asking for a loan to buy compost, insecticide, fertilizers, urea and fungicides; all of which he will use for the maintenance of his potato crops. 

He buys his supplies in Guaranda. His goal is to increase the amount he sows and provide for his family. His main challenge are the diseases that blight his crops. 

In his free time he likes watching television and doing sport.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his potato crops.

loans.name: Reina Morena

texts.es: Reina de 44 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que desde hace mucho tiempo se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia que es lo más importante para ella, además su esposo apoya para la economía de su hogar por medio de su trabajo como enfermero. Para Reina lo más importante es su familia por lo que desea darles un poco más de comodidad, para lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo de piso, cemento y arena para colocar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda. Agradece el apoyo que recibió en el pasado para la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Reina, 44, is a hard-working woman who for quite some time has earned a living as a domestic employee, thanks to which she has been able to support her family which is her priority.  Her husband helps with the household economy through his work as a nurse.  The family is the most important thing for Reina so she wants to give them a more comfortable lifestyle.

She has decided to request a loan through FUSAI to buy floor tile, cement and sand to put in a tile floor in her house.  She is grateful for the support she has received in the past for renovation of her house.

loans.use: To buy floor tiles, cement and sand for her house.

loans.name: Km 6 El Bajio Group

texts.es:
Florinda es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera, madre de dos niños de tres y cinco años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos por catálogo y venta de ropa.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza de forma ambulante en el sur de su ciudad, un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas.
Florinda es de tez trigueña, cabello largo castaño, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (a la derecha, polera negra, bermuda beige). Su vida la comparte con sus dos hijos, uno ya asiste a la escuela primaria. Debido a sus deseos de superación, formó una banca de personas con negocios para solicitar un préstamo.  Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos por catálogo y también la venta de ropa, ella visita ferias, oficinas,  escuelas; donde las mujeres siempre están en grupos, gimnasios,  colegios particulares, centros de salud, etcétera, cargada de sus catálogos, muestras, también productos para entregar y otros para vender. El tiempo es su principal problema, las distancias que recorre en busca de clientes y para cuidar a sus niños son largas y hace que muchas veces llegue tarde o pierda citas. Este es el primer préstamo que solicita y ya lleva con esta actividad un año. Su sueño es tener su propia tienda de cosméticos y ropa de marca. Ella desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para ofertar más productos y generar mejores ingresos económicos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Florinda solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos y ropa de catálogo por mayor para pagar los gastos de sus dos niños.
texts.en:
Florinda, 20, is a young single mother of two children who are aged three and five.  She sells clothes and cosmetic products by catalogue.

She is an enterprising, responsible and hard-working young woman as well as a good mother. She sells her products on the streets in the south of her city, which is a place well-known for its commerce.

She has a dark complexion, long brown hair, is medium-sized and her native language is Spanish.  She also speaks Guarani because of her family background (she is on the right of the photo, in a black top and beige shorts).   She shares her life with her two children.  One is already going to primary school. 

Thanks to her desire to overcome any difficulties in life, she has set up a communal bank with some other people in order to ask for a loan.  

Her business, as was said before, is the sale of cosmetics by catalogue as well as the sale of clothes.  She visits fairs, offices, schools and other places where women often spend time together.  These can include gyms, private schools, health centers, etc.  She takes with her catalogues, samples, merchandise for delivery and other items that she is selling.   

Time is her main problem.  She has to cover a big area looking for customers and as she also has to look after her children, which means that she often arrives late and misses appointments. 

This is her first loan and she has been in this business for a year. She dreams of having her own store for selling cosmetics and labelled clothes. She hopes to improve the capital her business has so she can offer more products and generate more income to improve the quality of life of her family.

This is why Florinda is asking for a loan to buy cosmetics and clothes in bulk from catalogues so that she can pay for her children's expenses.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes wholesale by catalogue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, accessories and supplies for clothes-making.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 29 años de edad  de estado civil casada vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 9,7 y 1 años en el cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar, en la comunidad Nueva Esperanza.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Rural Cooperativa Curi-Ñan  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva esperanza, esta se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, papas y trigo. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida y para su mantenimiento para sembrar papas. La compra lo realiza en Guaranda. Su meta es aumentar la siembra y comprarse una casa. Su desafío es las enfermedades y el carretero. En su tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 29, is married and lives with her husband and her children aged nine, seven and one.  They live in the canton of Guaranda in the Bolivar province, in the Nueva Esperanza community.

She is a member of the solidarity group 'Rural Cooperativa Curi-Nan' which operates in the Nueva Esperanza community.  They are dedicated to agricultural work and livestock.

Rosa works in agriculture and grows corn, potatoes and wheat. She is asking for a loan to buy compost, insecticide, fertilizers, urea and fungicides; all of which she will use for the maintenance of her potato crops. She buys his supplies in Guaranda. Her goal is to increase the amount she sows and buy a house. Her main challenge are the diseases that blight her crops and the roads. In her free time she likes spending time with her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors and windows for his home.

loans.name: Minasmayo De Garavito Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MINASMAYO DE GARAVITO”; Este banco se ubica en el sector de Garavito, distrito de Santa Ana, provincia de La Convención, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Adela ella es soltera y tiene 52 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos, cafe, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "MINASMAYO DE GARAVITO" which is located in the Garavito sector in the district of Santa Anta, province of La Convención in the department of Cusco.
   
One of the members is Adela, 52, who is single and has three children.  She is a fruit farmer and has land where she grows bananas, coffee, tangerines and oranges.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. and has been running her business very well for several years.  Her dream is to expand her plantation.  Adela is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

The other members of the group work in animal sales, agriculture, a grocery store and food sales.

Adela is grateful to everyone taking part in her dream and she is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Yovana Liliana

texts.es:
Yovana es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora, trabaja como costurera en una empresa de su ciudad natal, Lima.
Cada mañana Yovana sale muy temprano a trabajar y regresa tarde, porque quiere sacar adelante a su familia. El gran esfuerzo que le pone a su labor se da gracias a que recibió un buen ejemplo de sus padres quienes también luchaban y trabajaban muy duro para sacarla adelante.
Ahora Yovana tiene muchos deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por ello piensa utilizar el crédito para poder comprar un juego de muebles para su casa, ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto su familia se sentirá más cómoda, ella espera más adelante poder ascender en su trabajo para brindar un mejor futuro a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Yovana is a very enterprising and feisty woman. She works as a seamstress at a business in her native city of Lima.

Every morning Yovana goes out very early to work and arrives home late because she wants to help her family to get ahead. Yovana's great efforts at work come from her parents, who taught her well as they fought and worked very hard to help their daughter to progress in life.

Now Yovana really wants to improve her family's quality of life. She is therefore thinking of using this loan in order to buy furniture for her home.

Yovana is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity. She wants them to know that, with this loan, her family will be more comfortable in their home. Yovana hopes in the future to be promoted at her work in order to give her loved ones a better future.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her house.

loans.name: Elida De Lourdes

texts.es: Elida tiene dos negocios y 19 años de experiencia en el mercado, por un lado es confeccionista y por otro vende helados. Su primer negocio inició cuando fue al Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje (SENA) escuela técnica donde se capacitó en el arte de confeccionar; luego con su propio capital, organizó el taller de confecciones, comprando poco a poco cada máquina y empezó a coser sobre medidas, a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. Su clientela fue creciendo y posteriormente, pensó en aprovechar este mercado cautivo, para ofrecerle otro product;, fue así como empezó el negocio de vender helados, pues su amiga le recomendó vender colombinas, para que le regalaran un enfriador y así lo hizo. Hoy sus dos negocios generan gran parte del sustento de su hogar y sus metaas de crecimiento no se detienen. por eso trabaja en un horario que inicia desde las 7 de la mañanan hasta las 8 de la noche. Su meta es continuar generando mas entradas de dinero a su hogar y su capital de trabajon no es suficiente para realizar sus compras. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos de confecciones, como telas e hilos, y helados de diversos sabores y especificaciones. Con esta inversión sus ventas se iniciar con su credikiva una vida crediticia intachable, para poder obtener créditos de mayor valor y cumplir sus sueños con paso firme.
texts.en:
Elida, with 19 years experience on the working market, has two businesses: she is a seamstress and also sells ice creams.

Elida started her first business when she went to Colombia's SENA (a higher education institute) where she received training in dressmaking. Then, with her own capital, she opened her sewing workshop, gradually buying each machine and starting to prepare orders for her neighbours, friends and family.

Elida's customer base grew and later she decided to take advantage of the market and began selling another product. And so it was that Elida started her ice cream business. Her friend recommended her to sell products from "Colombina" as this brand would also give her a fridge to help her.

Today Elida's two businesses generate a large part of the household income and there is no stopping Elida as she sets new goals.

Elida works from 7am until 8pm. Her goal is to continue to increase her income for her household as her income is still not enough to cover her expenses.

As a result, Elida is applying for a Kiva loan, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. Elida will use this loan to buy dressmaking supplies, such as threads and material, and ice creams of various flavours.

This investment will give Elida higher sales and an unblemished credit rating to be able to take out loans of more money and to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies, such as threads and material, and ice creams.

loans.name: Alvera

texts.en:
Alvera aged 74 years, is married with seven children aged between 14 and 43. Two of them go to school. She has been farming for 13 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for potatoes. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for potatoes.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is 46 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 5 and 12, and all of them go to school. She has been farming for 14 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for her potatoes. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for potatoes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 36 years. She is married and has four children aged between four months and nine years, three of whom go to school.  She sells shoes and has been selling in a business for three years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Constasie

texts.en:
Constasie is 59 years old. She is married with seven children between 8 and 34 years old, 4 of them go to school. She has been farming for 25 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay the school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the school fees of her children.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 30 years old. She is married and has two children aged between two and four years, who do not yet go to school. She sells domestic equipment and has been working in a business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cupboard and chairs for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more cupboard and chairs for sale.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is thankful for the financial assistance that was extended to her because she was able to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nerissa desires to buy her own house. She wants for her business to grow and expand. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 27 years old; she has been farming for 5 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 23 years old; she has been farming for 1 year. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from the business will be used to improve her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  DANAYA est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 6ème prêt. Les 5 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce   d’ustensiles de cuisine à l’image de MAÏMOUNA qui est la 2ème femme debout dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 20 paires de tasses “super” avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of 6 married women with an average age of 35 and, on average, 5 children. They live in traditional extended families in the district of Massablacoura in the town of Bougouni. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and business relationships, and friendships. They joined the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better do business, and are on their 6th loan. The 5 previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Maimouna, the group representative standing second from the right in the picture, sells kitchenware. She plans to use her loan to buy 20 pairs of "super" cups from the Bougouni wholesalers. She makes her sales at the market and door-to-door, for cash or credit to a mixed retail clientèle. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30 000 francs which she will use to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy cups.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABALI est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  FARABA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 7ème prêt. Les 6 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments à l’image de AWA  qui est la 2ème femme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 cartons de pattes de tomates, 250kg de sels iodes et 3 sacs d’oignons avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sabali group is made up of 6 married women with an average age of 35 and, on average, 5 children. They live in traditional extended families in the district of Faraba in the town of Bougouni. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and business relationships, and friendships. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better do business, and are on their 7th loan. The 6 previous loans have been properly repaid.

Awa, the group representative who is standing second on the left in the picture, sells condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy 5 boxes of tomato paste, 250 kilos of iodine salts and 3 bags of onions from the Bougouni wholesalers. She makes her sales at the market and door-to-door, for cash or credit, to a varied retail clientèle. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs which she will use to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various items for her shop.

loans.name: Misael Antonio

texts.es: Misael de 42 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 42 años habita en vivienda propia, actualmente vive al lado de su esposa y su hija de 5 años de edad. Él siempre busca lo mejor para su familia y es por ello que desde hace 12 años se gana la vida apoyado en su negocio de venta de vitaminas, dicha venta la realiza en los cantones y caseríos cercanos. Misael desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, y las lluvias están deteriorando sus pocas pertenencias por las filtraciones que tiene el techo y es por ello que solicita este crédito el cual invertirá en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible y así lograr que sus pertenencias no se sigan deteriorando y dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Misael is 42 years old and is a hard-working man who for the past 42 years has lived in his own home.  Currently he lives with his wife and his five year old daughter.  He always looks for the best for his family and for that reason 12 years ago he began a business selling vitamins. He makes his sales in the restaurants and bars nearby.  Misael needs a loan from FUSAI in order to get a new roof for his home since his current roof has deteriorated.  The rain is entering and ruining his few possessions because of the leaks in the roof and for that reason he is asking for a loan which he will invest in the following: galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails in order to change the roof on his home as soon as possible and in that way protect his belongings from ruin and provide a better qualify of life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails in order to change the roof on his home

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: Lucio de 47 años de edad habita en vivienda propia al lado de su esposa y su hija de 7 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde muy temprano se levanta para preparar su mercadería, la que sale a vender de casa en casa para llevar el sustento a su hogar, la amabilidad de Lucio y sus precios accesibles logran que sus ventas sean muy buenas y cada día logra tener una mayor cantidad de clientes. Lucio siempre busca lo mejor para su familia y en los alrededores de su vivienda hay taludes de tierra y piedras, y es por eso que él desea construir un muro perimetral, por lo que él ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: piedras, cemento, arena y grava para construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda.
texts.en: Lucio is 47 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and their 7 year old daughter.  He is a hard-working man who from very early gets up to prepare his merchandise.  He goes from door-to-door making sales in order to sustain his family.  Lucio's kindness and his accessible prices allow him to have good sales and each day he gets more and more customers.  Lucio always looks for the best for his family and around his home there are steep slopes and inclines filled with dirt and rocks, and for that reason he wants to build a perimeter wall. For that reason he has made the decision to request a loan from Kiva partner FUSAI in order to invest in rocks, cement, sand and gravel in order to build a perimeter wall for his home.

loans.use: to invest in rocks, cement, sand and gravel in order to build a perimeter wall for his home.

loans.name: Viimdoogo Group

texts.fr:
Madame Aissa  est le représentant du groupe VIIMDOOGO. Il se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants, le plus âgé a 09 ans et le moins âgé a 28 mois. 02 vont à l’école. Il a 08 personnes en charge.
Madame est commerçante depuis 10 ans. Elle  s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont les commerçants de son quartier.
Elle  veut s’acheter (01) balle de pagnes,  12 paquets de  vêtements pour enfants.
Madame Aissa  veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour s’occuper des études de ses enfants et du bien être de sa famille. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique et si possible se rendre hors du pays pour s’approvisionner.
texts.en: Mrs Aissa is the representative of the VIIMDOOGO group. She is doing well, is married, and the mother of three children, the oldest being 9 years old and the youngest 28 months. Two of them attend school. She has responsibility for eight persons overall. She has been working in commerce for 10 years. She stocks up on merchandise in the neighboring markets, and sells to a client base of storekeepers in her neibhorhood. She is asking for a loan to purchase wax cloths and 12 bags of children's clothing. Mrs Aissa would like to use her profits to take care of the school fees for her children and the overall well being of her family. She hopes to one day open a storefront qnd if possible stock up on merchandise outside of her country.

loans.use: purchase wax cloths, and 12 bags of clothing for children

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BALIMAYA est constitué de 4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  DIALANIKORO de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 12ème prêt. Les 11 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  tasses à l’image de  BATOMA qui est la 1ère femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 15 paires de tasses avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The BALIMAYA group is composed of four married women who are, on average, 35 years old and have five children. They lives in nuclear families in the DIALANIKORO neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. They met each other through links of neighborhood, friendship and commercial activity. In order to reinforce their financial capacity with the aim of incrasing their commercial activities, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are asking for their twelfth loan. The previous eleven loans were successfully reimbursed. This group of women is involved in the sale of mugs with BATOMA's image on them (first person from the left in the photo). She plans to purchase, with her loan, 15 pairs of mugs from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells at the market as well as door to door, in individual quantities for credit or cash to a mixed clientele. She hopes to earn monthly profits of 40 000 FCF which she will reinvest in her commercial activities and use to reimburse the loan.

loans.use: purchase mugs

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 6ème prêt. Les 5 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  savons à l’image de MOSSOKOURA qui est la 3ème femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 7 cartons de savons koulikoro avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group is composed of 6 married women who are, on average, 38 years old and have four children. They lives in traditional extended families in the TORAKABOUGOU neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. They met via links of neighborhood, friendship and commercial activity. In order to reinforce their financial capacity and increase their commercial activities, they adhered to the microfinance institutino Soro Yiriwaso and are asking for their sixth loan. All previous loans were correctly reimbursed. These women are involved in the sale of soaps, as seen in the photo by Mossokoura (third in the photo from left to right). She plans to purcase, with her loan, 7 cartons of koulikoro soap from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells the soaps individually in the market and from door to door, for credit or cash, to a mixed client base. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 20 000 FCFA which she will reinvest in her commercial activity and use to reimburse the loan.

.

loans.use: purchase soaps

loans.name: Nilza

texts.pt:
A senhora  Nilza é professora reformada, de 51 anos de idade, mae solteira de 2 filhos já maiores vive na casa propria sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ela.
Ela diz que com este valor irá comprar banheira, sanita, lavatorio e cimento para dar continuidade a construcao de sua casa.
No futuro tem como planos faze  terminar a casa, mobilar como forma de dar mais conforto a sua familia.
Diz tem enfretado desafios  financeiros e que ira pagar conforme o calendario e solicitar mais emprestimos.
texts.en:
Mrs  Nilza is a retired teacher who is 51 years old and the single mother of 2 children. They are both of age, living in their own homes, but she also supports 2 grandchildren who live with her.

She says that she will use this loan to buy a bathtub, toilet, sink and cement to continue building out her house.

In future she plans to complete the construction of her house so as to provide more comfort for her family.
She faces financial challenges but she will pay her loan repayments on time as agreed and solicit further loans.

loans.use: buy a bathtub, toilet, sink and cement to continue building out her house

loans.name: Ana Dilia

texts.es: Ana de 20 años de edad es madre soltera y desde hace 3 años se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad. Ella habita en vivienda propia desde hace 20 años por lo que se siente muy feliz de contar con su casa aunque esta sea humilde y sencilla. Ana desea darle lo mejor a su hijo y es para el que sale todos los días desde muy temprano a prestar sus servicios domésticos para llevar el sustento a su hogar teniendo la satisfacción de proveer a su pequeño con lo más necesario. Ana ha tomado la decisión de adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: alambre eléctrico, interruptores, toma corriente, caja térmica y mano de obra para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en: Anaat 20 years old is a single mother. For the past three years she has been making an effort to get ahead with her young 4 year old son. She has lived in her own house for 20 years. It makes her feel happy to be able to have her house even if it is humble and simple. Ana wants to provide the best for her son and for that reason she gets up very early every day to work as a domestic and bring home the sustenance for her house. She has the satisfaction of providing her with one with the basic necessities. Ana has made the decision to get a loan from FUSAI to invest in electrical wire, switches, electrical outlets, a breaker box and pay for labor to install electricity in her house.

loans.use: to invest in electrical wire, switches, electrical outlets, a breaker box and labor to install electricity in her house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Senhora Maria tem 40 anos de idade, casada, tem 3 filhos frenquentando ensino primário e secundário,  é negociante, vive em casa própria com a sua familia.
Com o montante solicitado vai comprar farinha, arroz, açúcar, para revender na sua mercearia.
No futuro espera ampliar seu negócio, visto que agora vende em pequenas quantidades e também construir uma loja.
O grande desafio é de garantir o sustento escolar dos filhos, e reembolsar bem o empréstimo sem cair em mora de modo a garantir mais financiamentos.
texts.en:
Mrs Maria is 40 years old, married and has 3 children who go to primary and secondary school. She is a trader who lives in a house she owns with her family.

With this loan amount she will buy flour, rice and sugar to resell in her grocery store.

In future she hopes to expand her business, seeing as she deals only in small quantities at the moment, and also to build a shop.
Her great challenges are to guarantee her children's education and to make every repayment on time so that she is eligible to request further loans.

loans.use: buy flour, rice and sugar to resell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
A sra Lidia tem 43 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de dois filhos, dos quais um está na 8ª classe e o outro na 10ª clase.
Ela tem uma mini mercearia que vende prdutos da  1ª necessidade tais com o emprestimo pretende comprar feijão, arroz, óleo, frangos e peixe para revender. Para além da mercearia, faz trabalhos de costura.
 O seu sonho é possuir uma mercearia bem grande para que possa vender  todos produtos.  A pesar de enfrentar dificuldades financeiras, o seu  desafio é  de adquirir uma viatura para facilitar as deslocações no seu seu negócio.
texts.en:
Mrs Lidia is 43 years old, single and the mother of two children - one in 8th grade and the other in 10th.

She has a small grocery shop where she sells essential products such as the ones she plans to buy for resale with this loan: beans, rice, oil, chicken and fish. Aside from her grocery store, she also works as a seamstress.

Her dream is to own a really big grocery store where she can sell all kinds of products. Aside from her financial difficulties, her challenge is to buy a vehicle to facilitate getting to and from her place of business.

loans.use: buy beans, rice, oil, chicken and fish for resale

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt: O Senhor Pedro é casado vive com a esposa e tres filhos.  Ele é policia, com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir material de construçao nomeadamente , chapas de zinco, pedra, arreia. Tem  sonho de adquirir uma viatura para o uso pessoal. Tem como maior desafio  ter mais financiamentos para o alcance dos seus sonhos
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro is married and lives with his wife and three children. 
He is a policeman and with this loan he wants to buy construction materials, specifically sheets of zinc, stone and sand. 

His dream is to buy a vehicle for personal use. His biggest challenge is to have more loans to he can make his dreams come true.

loans.use: buy construction materials, specifically sheets of zinc, stone and sand

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 29 years old. He has been farming for four years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for banana production. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for bananas.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Rosa de 56 anos de idade tem 2 filhos um com idade escolar e outro esta no lar. E auxiliar de limpeza a mais de 7 anos o seu horario de trabalho e das 7:30h as 17:00h, sustenta 5 netos que vivem com ela.
Com o valor de emprestimo vai comprar cimento , pedra e tudos para concluir uma fossa da casa de banho da sua casa.	

Os seus sonhos sao de concluir as obras da sua casa e dar acompanhamento nos estudos do filhos e netos.
A Rosa tem com principal desafio concluir as obras da sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old, has 2 children of school-going age and another one who is at home. She has been a cleaning lady for more than 7 years and her work schedule is from 07:30 to 17:00. She supports 5 grandchildren who live with her.

With this loan she will buy cement, stone and plumbing to finish building a cesspit in the bathroom of her home.

Her dream is to finish the construction work on her house and be able to support her children and grandchildren's studies.
Rosa's main challenge is to finish building her home to improve her family's levels of comfort.

loans.use: buy cement, stone and plumbing to finish building a cesspit in the bathroom of her home.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro de 51 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Él es un hombre que siempre ha buscado la manera de llevar lo mejor a su familia, algo que ha logrado gracias a que presta sus servicios de seguridad en una empresa cercana. Pedro desea construir el broquel del servicio sanitario de su vivienda, además desea cambiar el techo de la misma ya que este se encuentra en muy malas condiciones, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, lámina, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir el broquel del servicio sanitario y cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Pedro is 51 years old and lives in his own house together with his life companion and his 2 year old son. He is a man who is always looking for how to provide the best for his family. He manages this thanks to his work as security at a company that is close by. Pedro wants to build the foundation for a washroom and he also wants to replace the roof on his house as it is in very poor condition. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, laminate sheeting, gravel, bricks and re-bar to construct the foundation of a washroom and replace the roof of his house

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, laminate sheeting, gravel, bricks and re-bar to construct the foundation of a washroom and replace the roof of his house

loans.name: Teresa

texts.pt:
Teresa de 53 anos de idade, solteira, tem 2 filhos, eles vivem nos seus lares, Ela vende na sua casa e também possui duas residencias na sua casa que da de aluguer isso ajuda nos seus rendimentos.
Com o valor  vai comprar chapas de zinco para a cobertura da sua casa ainda em construcao.
A sua esperança concluir a sua obra para dar de aluguer isso aumentara os seus rendimentos
O seu principal desafio é adquirir um espaço na numa nova zona para construir um estabelecimento comercial para venda de produtos da primeira necessidade
texts.en:
Teresa is 53 years old, single and has 2 children who live in their own homes. She sells products from her home and also rents out two rooms in her house to help bring in more money.

With this loan she will buy sheets of zinc to cover her house which is still under construction.

Her hope is to finish the building of her home so she can rent it out and increase her income.
Her main challenge is to acquire a space in a new area where she can build a commercial establishment to sell essential products.

loans.use: buy sheets of zinc to cover her house which is still under construction.

loans.name: Saline

texts.en:
Saline is aged 38 years. She is married with four children aged between 5 and 17; two of them go to school. 

She has been farming for 18 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for Irish potatoes. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.pt: A Senhora Yolanda é solteira vive com duas filhas e 3 irmãos.  Ela é secretaria e comerciante, vende produtos alimentares trazidos da Africa do Sul. com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir um congelador para o uso no seu negocio. Tem  sonho de ser uma empresaria de renome. Tem como maior desafio  trabalhar muito
texts.en:
Ms Yolanda is single and lives with two daughters and 3 siblings. 
She is a secretary and a merchant, selling food products which she brings from South Africa.

With this loan she wants to acquire a freezer to use for her business. 

Her dream is to be a well renowned businesswoman. Her biggest challenge is that she has to work a lot.

loans.use: acquire a freezer to use for her business.

loans.name: Xavier

texts.pt: O Senhor Xavier é casado vive com a esposa e uma filha.  Ele é militar, com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir barrotes, chapas de zinco e azulejos. Tem  sonho de ver a sua casa concluida, com melhores condicoes habitacionais. Tem como maior desafio  ter mais financiamentos para o alcance dos seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Mr Xavier is married and lives with his wife and one daughter.

He's in the military and with this loan he wants to buy beams, sheets of zinc and tiles. 

His dream is to see the building work on his house completed, providing his family with better living conditions. His challenge is to be able to solicit further loans to pursue his dreams.

loans.use: buy beams, sheets of zinc and tiles

loans.name: Honorable Rosa Group

texts.es: “HONORABLE ROSA” es un nuevo grupo conformada por socios ansiosos. Dedicados al comercio minorista y a prestar servicios. Diana tiene 26 años de edad es soltera con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella expende ropa a través del internet y a la vez decoraciones para cualquier tipo de eventos. Hace varios años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa y materiales para hacer sus decoraciones. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Diana es la adjuntada en la parte superior derecha que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
“HONORABLE ROSA” is a new group made up of eager members. They work in retail and provide services.

Diana is 26 years old, is single, and has two young children. She sells clothing on the internet and also sells decorations for many different types of events. She has done this for several years. She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of more clothing and materials to make her decorations.

The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan that they have provided. Diana's photo is pasted in the upper right hand part of the photograph because she could not attend the meeting due to work commitments.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and materials for decorations.

loans.name: Liliana Yasmin

texts.es: Liliana de 32 años de edad es soltera y habita en vivienda propia desde hace 5 años al lado de su madre. Ella es una mujer que desde hace mucho tiempo se esfuerza por dar lo mejor apoyada en su negocio de venta de ropa para hombre, mujer y niños, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 11 años en los cantones cercanos. Liliana desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este actualmente se encuentra deteriorado, para dicho cambio solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible y así evitar que sus pertenencias se sigan deteriorando por las filtraciones de su techo deteriorado.
texts.en:
Liliana is 32 years old and has lived in her own home with her mother for the past 5 years. For a long time, she has worked hard to give her best to her business, where she sells clothing for men, women, and children. She has done this work for the past 11 years in nearby cantons. 

Liliana would like to replace the roof of her home, since it is currently deteriorating. In order to make the change, she has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails. This way, she will be able to make the replacement as soon as possible so that her belongings won't continue to be damaged by the leaks in her deteriorated roof.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es: Don Abrahan, tiene 51 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 5 hijos, reside con su familia en una aldea del Municipio de Siguatepeque, cerca de Taulabe.  Toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, y hace 10 años decidió cultivar café. Esta producción de café la vende en pergamino a los intermediarios de la zona. Lleva invertido 5 prestamos que ha solicitado para mantener en buen estado el cultivo. Actualmente solicita otro por 15,000 Lempiras para siembra, fertilización y limpieza de sus cultivos para mejorar su finca y producción. El plan es sembrar 1 manzana mas de café para seguir aumentando la producción y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Abrahan is 51 years old and is in a common law marriage with his wife, with whom he has 5 children. He lives with his family in a small town in the Siguatepeque municipality, near Taulabe. For his whole life, he has worked in agriculture and has grown corn and beans. Ten years ago, he decided to grow coffee. He sells the coffee in its husk to agents in the area. 

He has received five loans, all of which he has used to maintain the good status of his crops. He is currently requesting another 15,000 Lempiras to plant, fertilize, and clean his crops in order to improve his farm and his harvest. His plan is to plant 1 manzana of coffee so that he can continue to increase his production and earn more money.

loans.use: to plant, fertilize, and clean his crops in order to improve his farm and his harvest.

loans.name: Vilma Veronica

texts.es: Vilma, tiene 41 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en el Municipio de Macuelizo Santa Bárbara junto a dos de sus hijos. Vilma tiene 10 años de vender ropa como camisas, pantalones, blusas, gorras, etc. de donde obtiene ingresos para su hogar. Ella vende de forma ambulante o por pedidos. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 16,500 Lempiras, este dinero lo utilizara para comprar mas camisas, pantalones jeans, gorras, y blusas para surtir y contar con mayor inventario para incrementar las ventas e ingresos. Inició su negocio con capital propio y piensa hacerlo crecer para darle calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old, is married, and has three children. She lives in the Macuelizo Santa Barbara municipality with two of her children. For the past ten years, Vilma has sold clothing, like shirts, pants, blouses, hats, etc., which is how she earns money to support her household. She sells on foot and also takes orders. 

She has decided to request a loan for 16,500 Lempiras, which she will use to purchase more shirts, jeans, hats, and blouses to increase her stock and have better inventory so that she can increase her sales and income. She started her business with her own capital and she hopes to grow her business to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, jeans, hats, and blouses to re-stock and increase her sales and income.

loans.name: Edwin Danilo

texts.es: Edwin, tiene 26 años de edad, esta soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en una aldea del Municipio de Santa Rita Yoro, cerca del municipio de  Morazán.  Edwin siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con su familia, produce maíz y frijoles. En esta actividad cuenta con el apoyo de su padre y hermanos. También hace 4 años cultiva piña en los campos agrícolas. La fruta de piña la vende en el mercado local y es su mayor fuente de ingresos. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 12,000 lempiras, el cual invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, control de plaga y limpieza del cultivo de piña y poder asegurar su producción. Su deseo es tener una fuente de ingresos  estable y ayudar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Edwin is 26 years old, is single, and lives with his parents and siblings in a village in the Santa Rita Yoro municipality near the Morazán municipality. Edwin has always worked in agriculture with his family and has grown corn and beans. His father and brothers help him with his business. He has also been growing pineapple for the past four years. He sells the pineapple in the local market and it is his greatest source of income.

He is requesting a loan for 12,000 lempiras, which he will use to purchase fertilizers and pest control, and to clean his pineapple crops and improve production. His goal is to have a stable source of income and to help his family financially.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pest control, and to clean his pineapple crops and improve his production.

loans.name: Socheata

texts.en: Socheata is an 18-year-old student at a university. She is from Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. Since 2013, she has been studying and working as a cashier in a city. She earns approximately 4 USD daily. Due to a shortage of finances, Socheata would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees.
