With this loan, she will be able to get a higher education and find a good job. In the future, she wants to have her own business and own a house.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 49 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in Candanay Sur, Siquijor, Philippines. He operates a peanut processing business. Through Paglaum MPC he obtained the capital to start his own business, which has been doing well.  Renato has been doubling his time perfecting his own peanut recipes. 

Renato requested another loan from PMPC, which he will use to purchase additional raw ingredients and equipment needed for his peanut processing business. The loan will help him increase production and supply stocks in stores as well.  He has maximized his profits and keeps pursuing his goals for the good of his family. He hopes that his business will grow and benefit his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients and needed equipment for his peanut processing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in laminate, wood, nails, cement, sand, and gravel to build a room and cement the floor of his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, bricks, cement, sand, and gravel in order to install an iron gate and build a wall at his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in garlic and spices.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: El grupo “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA” es un grupo conformado por socios entusiasta dedicados al comercio minorista. Jaqueline tiene 41 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependiente. Ella implemento una pequeña bodega en su vivienda y a la vez se dedica a la agricultura y venta de fruta de estación. En sus tiempos libres teje chompas para bebes y niños pedido de sus conocidos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más productos para su bodega arroz azúcar y  bebidas aceite y golosinas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Jaqueline  es la primera persona sentada del lado derecho viste chompa negra.
texts.en:
The "Santa Rosa de Lima" group is made up of enthusiastic members who work in retail commerce. Jacqueline is 41 years old and lives with her two young children. She installed a small grocery store in her home and also works in agriculture and sells seasonal fruit. In her free time, she knits sweaters for babies and children, which her friends order from her.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of more products for her grocery store, like rice, sugar, beverages, oil, and snacks. The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that they provide. Jacqueline is the first person seated on the right hand side of the photograph and she is wearing a black sweatshirt.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, oil, beverages, rice, and snacks.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar, from Siquijor, Philippine, is 50 years old and blessed with three children. He joined Paglaum MPC in 2012 and appreciates the programs and services it offers. From his desire to provide the best for his family, for two years now he has been selling fish in various barangays in Maria, Siquijor, using his motorcycle to reach the markets. 

In need of additional working capital, Edgar has requested a loan from Paglaum MPC for Php 20,000.00 to purchase more stocks of fish to sell. Through this, he hopes to earn more income to better provide for the daily needs of his family and support the education of his children, his main priorities. 

In the future, Edgar wishes to own a truck for his fish deliveries because he wants to become a fish stockholder in their town.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish to sell in the fish market

loans.name: Fatima Yesenia

texts.es: Fatima tiene 34 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales y atol de elote desde hace 10 años, vende de forma ambulante por las colonias aledañas, tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar elotes por mayor, leche, azúcar, etc. para poder seguir con la elaboración de los alimentos y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Fatima is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. For the past 10 years, she has made a living by selling tamales and atol de elote, a corn beverage. She sells her products on foot in the nearby villages and has many customers.

She requests a loan so that she will be able to purchase corn in bulk, milk, sugar, etc., in order to continue making food so that she can earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase corn in bulk, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay household expenses and to pay for an accounting course.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a responsible mother who owns and manages a small retail store to earn additional income. She is 53 years old and has two adult-aged children. She aims to improve her retail store and generate sufficient income to cover the necessities of her family. 

To further improve her store, she would like to access an additional capital of PHP10,000 to buy more stocks of candies, biscuits, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, eggs and soft drinks to resell. Being a hard working mother, she believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of candies, biscuits, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, eggs and soft drinks to resell

location.town: Brgy. Belance, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Inmaculada

texts.es: La miscelánea, papelería, útiles escolares servicios de internet llamadas telefónicas y ventas de mercancías variadas, son los productos y servicios que ofrece Inmaculada, una mujer que conforma su familia con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos de 5 a 27 años de edad. Ellos son,  quienes la mueven a seguirlos apoyando en educación, con el fin de lograr un futuro exitoso. Su idea de negocio inició en el año 2004, cuando su esposo le entregó sus ahorros, para que ella misma generara sus propios ingresos. Hoy sus sueños no se detienen y ha logrado un importante crecimiento, pero aún le falta lograr metas que cumplir. Las navidades y el año nuevo, así como los meses de Enero y Febrero, son las temporadas de mejor desempeño, en la  que Inmaculada  aprovecha  para fortalecerse. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un crédito mediante el cual comprará  dos vitrinas y mercancía variada alusiva a las navidades, por eso su papelería será cambiada con motivos de esta bella época, donde las viviendas, calles, familias están más elegantes y los miembros del hogar son muchos más felices, porque el dinero rota y es la oportunidad de usar todo lo nuevo, que durante el año no habían podido, por la baja capacidad de compra; así Diciembre trae consigo  bonificaciones, aguinaldos que mueven la economía y hacen que la gente se sienta más feliz.
texts.en:
Miscellany, stationery items, school supplies, Internet services, telephone calls, and the sales of varied merchandise are the products and services that Inmaculada offers.  She is a woman with a family that consists of her husband and their four children, ranging in age from 5 to 27.  They are the ones who drive her to continue supporting their education in order for them to achieve a successful future.

Her business idea started in 2004 when her husband gave her his savings so that she could generate her own income.  Her dreams have not now stopped, and she has managed important growth.

However, she still has goals to achieve.  Christmas and the New Year and the months of January and February are the times for better performance.  Inmaculada takes advantage of this in order to strengthen the business.

That is the reason that she turns to a loan in order to buy display cases and varied Christmas merchandise.  This way her store will be changed for this beautiful time.  The homes, streets, and families are more elegant.  The members of her household are happier because the money turns over.  

It is the opportunity to use everything new that they were not able to during the year because of the small capacity to buy.  That is how December brings with it extra pay and Christmas bonuses that move the economy and make the people happier.

loans.use: to buy display cases and varied Christmas merchandise.

loans.name: Nora Josefina

texts.es: Nora de 42 años de edad posee desde hace 5 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes especialmente los vecinos ya que cuenta con una variedad de productos y por los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas productos como: sopas, café, azúcar, golosinas, refrescos, etc. y asi poder surtir mas la tienda y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Nora, 42, has owned a small grocery for 5 years.  She operates the business from a space in her house and has many customers.  She is successful, she says, because she sells the products most in demand here for a fair price.  Nora is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with products--soups, coffee, sugar, snacks, etc.--that she will resell.

loans.use: to stock her corner store.

loans.name: Marylyn

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Marylyn wants to re-start a small retail store to have an additional source of income. She is 56 years old and has three children. She wants to acquire more stocks of grocery items to resell but she has inadequate capital. 

For this reason, she would like to access a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, soaps, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps, candies and snack foods to resell. She is hoping that she access this loan amount to be able to re-start her small retail store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soaps, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps, candies and snack foods to resell

location.town: Brgy. San Fernando, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy educational equipment and pay tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fee and purchase educational equipment for her son, Tai

loans.name: Ymca School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Mukasa. He is the Executive Director of Mukono YMCA College, a mixed school in the Peri- Urban area of Mukono district with 800 students. Mukono YMCA College has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the students. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mukono YMCA College will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Mukasa ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school. 
  .

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. texts.en:

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and would like to be able to provide this for their students but boiling would take a considerable portion of its budget on firewood expenses. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be avoided. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system to go with a 1,000 litre tank that they already have, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Wanyange Girls will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Deborah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Green Valley School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Jane. She is the Head teacher of Green Valley Primary school, a mixed school in the Rural-area of Nakibizzi in Jinja with 400 students. Green Valley Primary school has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Green Valley Primary school will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Jane ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Kazo Junior School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ronald. He is the Head teacher of Kazo Junior School; a mixed school in the peri- urban area of Nansana in Kampala district with 600 students. Kazo Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kazo Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Ronald ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Hope Community School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ronald. He is the Head Teacher of Hope Community High School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Wairaka in Jinja with 620 students. Hope Community High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a Tulip water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase Tulip Filtration water treatment system, With 5 Sets of 20 Litre Buckets which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Hope Community High School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Ronald ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

Hope Community High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a Tulip water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra, a 24-year-old woman, lives in Nirendrapur in Maynaguri under district Jalpaiguri. She has two children who are too young to go to school. Her husband is a daily laborer who has no permanent source of income. Sumitra tries to help her husband to earn money for her family. 

Sumitra is already running her milk and milk products sales business but she wants to expand her existing business and her only constraint is insufficient funds. With extra money she will able to buy another cow and produce more milk and milk products. There is a demand for milk and milk products in their area and if the people get the product locally, then they give adequate money for the right and easily available products. 

So Sumitra is seeking loan from BJS and KIVA which she plans to utilize to buy a cow for her existing business.   Having understood the market necessities, she wants to expand her dairy farm in a modern manner with more animals so that she can diversify the farm’s products.

She is thankful to KIVA and BJS for their helpful attitude.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk and milk products sales business.

loans.name: St. Peter's School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ivan. He is the Head Teacher of St. Peters Primary School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Lumuli in Jinja with 900 students. St. Peters Primary School School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a Tulip water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase Tulip Filtration water treatment system, With 10 Sets of 20 Litre Buckets which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Peters Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Ivan ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 7ème prêt. Les 6 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de d’habits.
à l’image de DIATOU qui est la femme assise devant dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 pièces de pagnes, 20 mètres de bazin avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group is composed of five married women averaging 42 years of age, with four children. They live in nuclear families in the Heremakon Nord  neighborhood of the town of Bougouni. They know each other as neighbors, friends, or through their work. In order to bolster their financing capacity and better manage their businesses, they have joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with which they are on their 7th loan. The six prior loans have been duly repaid. 

The group members sell clothing, which is what Diatou does, for example, She is the one seated in front in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy ten pieces of traditional colorful “pagnes” fabric, 20 meters of the damask-like “bazin” fabric from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells at the market and out of her home, retail for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn an average monthly benefit of 35,000 West African francs, which will be used to invest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Santos Roberto

texts.es: Don Santos de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el trabaja en una empresa privada, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda y terminar de construir un cuarto para sus hijos que es el que muestra en la fotografía, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza por esa razón solicita un crédito para poder comprar cemento, arena, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra y asi vivir en condiciones favorables con su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 42 years old and lives in his own house with his life's companion and their two children. He works for a private enterprise and what he earns serves to cover some of the costs of his home. He wishes to improve his house and finish constructing a room for his children -- the room shown in the photograph. But with what he earns,  he can't afford it. 

For this reason, he is soliciting a loan to be able to purchase cement, sand, and blocks, and to pay for laborers and, thus, to live in favorable conditions with his family.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, and blocks, and to pay laborers to complete a bedroom for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to change the roof of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover costs of labor and materials for house repairs.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma, 44, is married with three children who are all in college now. Her husband is only a minimum wage earner in a private institution. Unable to cover the needs of the family with only her husband's income, she has found ways to attain income through buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for three years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. 

Elma is still continuing the business because it provides good income, due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children.  Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already accessed loans previously to purchase additional stock and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store to purchase additional grocery items to increase her stock and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store to increase stock and earn more income

loans.name: Effie

texts.en:
Effie is driven by passion in selling. She is singe and 42 years old. Effie lives with her parents in Helen Larena, Siquijor, Philippines. She runs a general store primarily to support her family’s needs. Effie never gets tired of tending her store. She became a full-fledged member of PMPC after hearing all the benefits given by the Co-op to its members. 

Effie is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. She will use her loan to pay for her mother’s health needs. Having enough inventories will increase her income opportunities. In the future, Effie dreams of sustaining her store and continuously providing for her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell to be able to pay for her mother's health needs

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvinida is grateful that she was granted a previous 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase spare parts needed for her jeepney vehicle. She used her earnings to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. Bienvinida runs a jeepney transportation business and her earnings help sustain her family’s daily household needs.

Bienvinida is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to maintain and repair her jeepney. It is very important that her jeepney is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service and continuous income. Bienvinida is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. Her goal is to own a van with a franchise for a wider service and bigger income. Bienvinida dreams of sending her child to college and to have a comfortable life when she reaches old age. 

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her  jeepney vehicle

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 32-year-old widowed lady from Maynaguri. After the death of her husband, she did not break down; she had to look out for her children. Amina needed adequate money to run her family. But it was not so easy for Amina to cope with her situation. She tried her level best to survive with her children by acquiring a skill to run a business. Her husband was a farmer and with his limited earning he always tried to arrange everything for his family. Amina has a milk cow that produces a good deal of milk, and after meeting the requirements of the family there was sufficient milk that was surplus which Amina decided to sell in the neighborhoods. In the end, the cow was the only earning source for their family after the sudden death of her husband. 

Amina has two sons; one is going to school and is in tenth grade but she was forced to send one of them to work as a daily laborer. Amina then decided to expand her business and purchase one more cow so that the production would be higher and she would be able to sell additional milk products to her customers. 

So Amina turned in an application for a loan to BJS who have played a catalytic role for Kiva lenders. The loan from Kiva gives Amina enough peace of mind. The financial conditions of her family have now been changed which makes Amina happy and affluent. Now Amina confidently thinks about the subject of to continue her son’s studies.

She is very grateful to BJS and Kiva for making her future easier.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beams, supports, wood and laminated metal sheets to replace the roof of his home

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza de 58 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años siembra maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños ya tiene clientes fijos, Esperanza vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 58 years old and has been working in agriculture for 20 years. She grows corn and beans. When her harvest is ready, she sells the produce in the neighboring villages, and she has regular customers. 

Esperanza lives in her own home with her husband and their son. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc. With these, she will earn more money for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Alengenet De Jesus

texts.es: Alengenet tiene 55 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el posee un taller de carpintería elabora una variedad de finos muebles, tiene clientes fijos que lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más materia prima como madera, clavos, barniz, pegamento, etc. y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Alengenet, 55, lives with his wife and two children in a house that they own.  Alengenet has a carpentry shop where he makes furniture.  He is known for the quality of his work and has many loyal customers.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs--wood, nails, varnish, glue, etc.--to carry on his business.  The investment will allow him to support his family and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his furniture-making business.

loans.name: Maria Corazon

texts.en:
Maria Corazon is 28 years old. She is known in the Enrique Villanueva area for her retailing business. Maria Corazon is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

Maria Corazon is requesting a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks to live comfortably in a decent house. She hopes to maintain her Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) membership in good-standing and have a good repayment record. It matters to Maria Corazon that she has been given priority as a member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for, when all the financing needs for her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lengths of African print cloth

loans.name: Amalia Noemi

texts.es: Amalia de 31 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 5 años vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con su familia, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar frutas y verduras por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Amalia is 31 years old and lives with her husband and three children. For the past five years she has worked selling fruits and vegetables as a street vendor throughout the various communities located near her house. With the sales she makes she manages to get by with her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale so she can have a higher income and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the costs of improvements to his family home.

loans.name: Neris Manuel

texts.es:
Neris, siendo un humilde pescador del municipio de Turbo, ha podido recoger grandes experiencias que han enriquecido su vida, pero también ha tenido sucesos que han marcado su vida como la muerte de su esposa.

Hoy en día se dedica a la pesca como medio de supervivencia, trabaja con un equipo de pesca artesanal y su deseo es poder comprar un buen equipo de pesca que le permita tener una mejor productividad.

Para esto solicita un préstamo, pues desea comprar dicho equipo y mejorar su actividad de una manera positiva.

Impacta la vida de Neris con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Neris, a humble fisherman from the town of Turbo, has been able to have great experiences that have enriched his life.  He also has had experiences that have scarred him, such as the death of his wife.

Currently he works as a fisherman to survive.  He works with traditional gear.  He wants to be able to buy good gear so he can have better productivity, so he's requesting a loan to buy that equipment and improve his work in a positive way.

Make an impact on Neris's life with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy new fishing gear to replace his current equipment, which is in bad condition

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is married with six adult children. She is from Sibugon, Lopez Jaena, Philippines. For the past five years, Esterlita has managed a direct-selling business where she sells products for men, women, and children such as soap, lotion perfume, clothes, shoes, sandals, cosmetics and other items. She finds her business interesting and she can easily earn income through her sales talk. Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for three years.

Esterlita is requesting a loan to purchase more stocks to offer more items to her customers. Expanding her inventories will mean an increase in her income. In the future, Esterlita hopes to provide a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell to offer more to her customers and gain higher profit

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha de 45 años de edad se dedica a la preparación de picadas para fiestas y a la venta de mercancía variada. Ella en su condición de separada, debe reunir el dinero suficiente, para apoyar el bienestar de sus hijos. Todo esto la lleva a trabajar mañana y noche, día a día, con el fin de lograrlo, para que tengan un mejor futuro. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos para picadas, y también ropa, calzado. Martha aprovechará la temporada de navidad y de año nuevo, época en la que llegan a sus manos muy buenas ofertas, para responder a las solicitudes de su clientela, por  las fiestas de graduación, navideñas, llegada de familiares desde otros países o ciudades, lo cual es el común denominador que aumenta la demanda de picadas  como deditos, ensaladas, derivados de la harina de trigo, etc. y la de ropa calzado perfumería etc. pues todos quieren bailar, comer y beber en familia y con sus amigos más cercanos, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión muy exitosa.
texts.en:
Martha, who is 45 years old, makes snacks for parties and sells a variety of party merchandise. She is separated and must earn sufficient money to provide for her children. All this she does from morning o night, day after day, for the purpose of assuring that her children will have a better future. 

At present, Martha is requesting a Kiva loan, her first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will purchase inputs for preparing party snacks, and also buy clothes and shoes for parties to sell.

Martha hopes to take advantage of the Christmas and New Year seasons, a time when she receives very good offers, to respond to solicitations from her customers for parties to celebrate graduation, Christmas,  or the arrival of family members from other countries or cities, which is the common denominator that increases the demand for party snacks, such as finger foods, salads, and wheat flour pastries, plus clothes, shoes, perfume, etc., because everyone wants to dance, eat, and drink with family and their closest friends, making this Kiva loan a very successful investment.

loans.use: buy inputs for making snacks for parties, plus clothing and shoes to sell for holiday parties.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагуль 54 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. У Айнагуль средне-специальное образование, по специальности повар-технолог. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, на собственном земельном участке мерою 0,40 ГА она выращивает клубнику и яблони для реализации. Начав свой бизнес в 1998 году, на сегодняшний день кроме развитого полеводческого бизнеса в ее хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 3 бычка и 15 овец. Также есть собственный магазин. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль Айнагуль составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнагуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Айнагуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, а также ремонт ее дома.
texts.en:
Ainagul is 54 and married with four children. She has a specialist high school education as a cook and technologist and works in animal husbandry and agriculture as the primary source of income for her family. She grows strawberries and apples for sale on her own 0.4 hectare piece of land, a business she began in 1998. In addition to her crops she currently has one cow, three steers and 15 sheep as well as her own shop, with a total monthly profit of about 6,000 KGS.

With the intention of further developing her business, Ainagul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 110,000 KGS to purchase steers. She plans to put profits from the loan into further expanding her business, as well as into home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase additional steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in 2012 and heard about the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Francisco tried his luck starting a business as a rice farmer. He feels he owes his fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money that he used as capital. 

Francisco is requesting another loan to purchase additional fertilizer to have a more productive rice harvest. His loan will help him maximize his profit from rice farming. Francisco looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to expand his business in his neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have a more productive rice harvest

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: Jose de 41 años de edad posee un negocio ubicado en su lugar de residencia donde comercializa una variedad de productos de primera necesidad y productos escolares, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más productos escolares y de primera necesidad como cuadernos, lapiceros, pegamentos, papel bond, aceites, golosinas, refrescos, pan dulce, sopas, etc. asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 41 years old and has a business selling a variety of staple goods and school materials which he runs from his house. He has a lot of customers because of the variety of products on offer and his good prices. He lives in his own house with his wife and their three children. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more school materials and staple goods like: notebooks, pencils, glue, bond paper, oil, candy, soft drinks, sweet bread, soups, etc so he can make more of a profit.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, glue, bond paper, oil, candy, soft drinks, sweet bread, soups, etc.

loans.name: Rhina Areli

texts.es: Rhina de 41 años de edad se dedica a la confección de ropa de cama (edredones, almohada, cubrecamas, sabanas, etc.)  y también a la venta de productos de uso personal, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años y tiene muchos clientes, Rhina es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas insumos  como: tela de diferentes estampados,  hilos, agujas, etc. y comprar otra máquina de coser  y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Rhina is 41-years old and makes her living making bedding (quilts, pillows, bedspreads, sheets etc.)  She also sells personal products.  She has made her living with these businesses for the last five years, and she has a lot of customers.  Rhina is a single mother who lives in her own home with her daughter.  Rhina is requesting the loan to purchase more supplies, such as differently patterned fabrics, thread, needles etc. and to purchase another sewing machine.  That way she will be able to have a better income and improved financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase differently patterned cloth, thread, needles etc. and to purchase another sewing machine.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 38 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is separated with two children now at their school age. Leonida has been engaged in agri-business, particularly in vegetable gardening and cow raising for 10 years already. She earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used to buy animal vitamins and agri veterinary supplies for her existing business activities. Leonida has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Leonida hopes to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to buy animal vitamins and agri veterinary supplies.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis de 48  años de edad, desde el año 2004 comercializa productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogos. Ella 10 años atrás,  trabajaba como empleada y vendía productos a crédito, para generar otros ingresos y estar cada vez mejor, pues en su condición de separada y madre de dos hijos,  debía lograr mayor bienestar para ellos.  Cuando Denis, decidió retirarse de su  trabajo como empleada, se dedicó cien por ciento a esta actividad,  ofreciendo ropa exterior e interior. Su meta  hoy es ampliar el capital de su oferta y adicionar productos como perfumería, colonias entre otros y así lograr aun mas crecimiento en su negocio, también proyecta comprar vitrinas para hace una mejor exhibición e impactar la decisión de compra de su clientela y finalmente mejorar las condiciones de su vida y la de sus hijos. En la actualidad ha acudido a un credikiva, prime financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará vestuario y ropa interior para damas, caballeros e infantil. Con esta inversión ampliará su capital de trabajo y mejorará su oferta de productos haciendo que su credikiva impacte exitosamente su negocio.
texts.en: Denis is 48 years old. Since 2004, she has sold products through specialized books or catalogs. Ten year earlier, she was working as an employee and selling products on credit in order to generate income and to improve each time. Because she is a separated mother of two, she had to do the most for them. When Denis decided to leave her job, she decided to dedicate herself 100% to this business, offering outerwear and undergarments. Her current goal is to increase the capital and add products like perfumes, colognes and other items and achieve even more growth with her business. She also plans to buy glass cases to do a better display to impact the buying decision of her customers. Finally, she wants to improve living conditions for herself and her children. Currently, she has a Kivacredit through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy a wardrobe and undergarments for women, men and children. With this investment, she will increase her working capital and improve her product offerings so that her loan will successfully impact her business.

loans.use: purchase a wardrobe and undergarments for women, men and children.

loans.name: Semeon

texts.en:
Semeon is 60 years old, married, has 2 adult children, and lives in Katipunan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. 

Semeon and his wife earn their living through rice farming. They mastered this activity after they were married, and it gave them the means to provide for their children's education until they graduated and got jobs. 

Semeon joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in March, 2012. He is a hardworking father who has always been known to provide the best for his family. He has the strong determination required to pursue his goals, and now Semeon wants to live comfortably with a decent house. 

He has applied for a loan to PMPC to purchase building materials to enlarge his house and make a safe living space for the whole family. The income from his rice farm shall be used for the loan payments. 

Semeon is thankful with all his heart.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to make a larger and safe living space for the whole family.

loans.name: Usufu

texts.en:
Usufu is a 55-year-old man, married, with six children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a driver, but he also deals in cocoa buying and selling. He has been in his business for 20 years now. 

He does not regret why he started his business because five of his children are attending school and he hopes to continue paying for their school fees and to expand his business.

Usufu wants a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Saniya

texts.en: Saniya is a 45-year-old woman, and married with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a food stall that is her main business, though she also deals in buying and selling cocoa.  She does this business for the survival of her family.  She is affected by seasons and inadequate capital. She wants a loan to buy foodstuffs and cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a 24-year-old, married woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has three children, two of whom are in school. She has worked hard to start and maintain her business of buying and selling cocoa, and is happy about this business. She hopes to have a bigger stock for her business though seasonality is her key challenge. She wants a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es:
Flor, de 41 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a salir adelante y tener una buena vida al lado de sus tres hijos.

Ella se desempeña como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros.

Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios.

Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.
Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de mercancía y de este modo tener inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Flor ¡
texts.en:
Flor, who is 41-years old, is very clear on what she wants out of life.  She is determined to get ahead and have a better life alongside her three children. 

Flor works selling a variety of merchandise, such as clothing, accessories (like wallets), some cosmetics and other items. 

She started this business with the desire to support herself and her education.  She is an entrepreneurial woman and very disciplined.  Flor is requesting this loan to purchase a wide variety of merchandise so she can have some inventory available to sell to her customers. 

Flor hopes to grow as a business owner and have a more stable income. 

With the loan that you make today, you can help Flor improve her business and her life!

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise for her business, such as clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.

Tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de alimentos, como la venta de jugos naturales y algunos pasabocas que ella misma prepara.

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su esposo y su hijo de 3 años quien es el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.

Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Diana solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de una licuadora e ingredientes para sus preparaciones.

Con esta ayuda podrá cumplir su sueño de otorgar una buena educación a su hijo.

Con tu ayuda Diana Podrá pagar la educación de su hijo que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Diana is a tenacious and entrepreneurial woman with big dreams that she has been nurturing and trying to fulfill. She has a small business selling food, such as natural juices and some appetizers that she prepares herself.

With this operation she intends to get ahead day by day and improve the living conditions for her family: her husband and her 3 year-old son, who is the driving force in her life and her motivation to persevere every day. Her biggest challenge is the competition in this sector, but with her excellent work ability she is capable of sustaining and improving her business.

Diana is requesting a loan in order to purchase a blender and ingredients for her creations. With this assistance she will be able to realize her dream of giving her son a good education. With your help Diana will be able to pay for her son's education, which is one of her greatest dreams!

loans.use: to purchase a blender and ingredients for her recipes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron bars and electrodes for welding, and pay for the labor needed to install security bars on her windows.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is an 18-year-old, single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small house in the city. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad is a student in his first year where he studies law. He would like to take the BA degree and find a job as a lawyer to help his family with part of their expenses. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to complete his studies faster and improve himself.  Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Yehya

texts.en:
Yehya is a 24 year-old single man from Gaza city.  He lives with his family in a small house in the city.  His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income.  This is the only source of income to the family.   Yehya is a student in his last year and he studies social science.  He would like to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses. 
Yehya took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester.
By taking this loan, Yehya will be able to complete his study faster and improve himself. 
Yehya appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
Lorena es una mujer de 26 años de edad, casada, madre de tres niños y su negocio es la venta de helados.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, trabajadora, responsable, constante e independiente. Su labor la realiza en la zona ‘Plan 3000’ un sitio caracterizado por el crecimiento constante del comercio en todas las áreas.
Lorena es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (sentada a la izquierda, usa blusa rosada sin mangas). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y sus tres hijos, dos estudian en la escuela y el tercero es muy pequeño todavía.  La necesidad por mejorar sus ingresos y prosperar en su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios diferentes para solicitar un préstamo. Su negocio es la venta de helados tipo bolo. El calor constante de la ciudad donde vive hacen de su labor un próspero negocio, pues los helados de todo tipo son consumidos en grandes cantidades a toda hora, el helado tipo bolo se caracteriza por ser de agua pero algunos son de pura fruta y otras veces se le hecha leche, encontramos de muchos sabores como el de lúcuma, mango, fresa, coco, maracuyá, chocolate, etc. y también lúcuma con leche, fresa con leche, coco con leche, etc. y viene empaquetado en un largo y delgado envase de plástico, tiene un precio muy accesible para la mayoría. 
Este es el primer préstamo que solicita y lleva en este negocio 7 años de experiencia, ella sueña tener un negocio grande y próspero para dar empleo a otras personas, y desea ampliar su negocio realizando una inversión mediante la compra de una congeladora para almacenar su 'bolos' y tener mayor cantidad de productos en oferta.
Es por esos motivos que Lorena solicita un préstamo para la compra de una congeladora y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lorena is a 26 year old woman, married, and the mother of three children. Her business is selling frozen treats.  She is enterprising, a good mother, hard-working, responsible, unchanging and independent.  She works in the area "Plan 3000", a location known for constant business growth in all areas.

Lorena is brown-skinned, of medium height, with long dark hair.  Her first language is Spanish and she also  knows the guaraní language as a family heritage. (She is seated on the left, wearing a pink, sleeveless blouse.)  Lorena shares her life with her husband who works in construction, and with their three children.  Two children are in school and the other is still very small.  The need to increase their income and prosper in her business has led Lorena to form a group of people with different businesses to ask for a loan.  Her business is selling frozen treats of the "bolo" type.

The  ever-present  heat in the city where she lives makes Lorena's work a prosperous business, since frozen treats of every kind are consumed in large quantities all the time.   The "bolo" type is typically made with water but some are of fruit alone and others have milk added.  We find them in many flavors such as  lúcuma, mango, strawberry, coconut,  maracuyá, chocolate, etc. and also lúcuma with milk, , strawberry with milk, coconut with milk, etc. and they come packaged in a long, thin plastic wrapping.  They mostly are priced affordably.  

This is the first loan Lorena has asked for, and she has been in business for seven years.  She dreams of having a large and prosperous business to employ others, and wants to grow her business  by purchasing a freezer to store her "bolos" and having a large quantity of products to offer for sale.  These are the reasons Lorena is asking for a loan to buy a freezer and to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and expand her business.

loans.name: Nelly Esperanza

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer con un gran corazón que por cuidar y apoyar incondicionalmente a su madre quien tiene un problema de discapacidad, dejo de vivir muchas experiencias en su vida y la verdad es que lo hace con gusto.
Ante la necesidad económica y cubrir con todas las demandas y cuidados que requería su madre decidió iniciar desde su casa un negocio de venta de lencería para el hogar y gracias a este negocio ha encontrado una estabilidad económica que le permita hacerse cargo de los gastos de su madre y poder estar siempre la cuidado de ella.
Solicita un crédito para comprar materia prima para realizar sus productos y gracias a este crédito podrá tener nuevas líneas de productos como lo son cortinas y acolchados nuevos. 
Su sueño es seguir con su negocio, que a su madre nunca le falte un medicamento y ni plata para transportarse a una clínica pues como anteriormente se menciono es una persona discapacitada.
texts.en:
Nelly is a woman with a large heart.  She unconditionally takes care of and supports her mother, who has a disability.  She let a lot of life experiences pass her by, and the truth is that she has done it with pleasure. 
Because of a financial need, and to cover the cost of her mother's wants and needs, Nelly decided to start a business in her home.  She sells household linens.  Thanks to the business, she has the financial stability that allows her to take care of her mother's expenses and to always be available to care for her mother. 
Nelly is requesting the loan to purchase raw materials to make her products.  Thanks to the loan, she will be able to have new lines of product, such as curtains and new cushions.  
Nelly's dreams are to continue with her business and for her mother to never lack for a medication she needs nor transportation to get to a clinic because, as was mentioned previously, her mother is disabled.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making household linens.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 49 years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 4 children; some are adult-age while others are still in school.  

Editha has been earning a living for the past 4 years as a casual employee in one of the offices of the Local Government Units of her town. However, she also earns income from direct sales of cosmetics and beauty products. Editha earns approximately 4,400 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

Editha has requested a loan to be used for the tuition fees and other school expenses of her school-age children.
 
Editha has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost 3 years. In the future, Editha hopes to expand her direct sales cosmetics business to increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for her children's tuition fees and other school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is 46 years old and is married.  She has eight children living in Kasese, Uganda.  She sells tomatoes and has been in  business for five years.  She also practices farming to get additional income.  Hellen has a dream of expanding her business, however, price fluactuations, competition and seasonal changes are her major challenges.  Hellen is requesting a loan to buy tomatoes for selling.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes for selling.

loans.name: Rogeline

texts.en: Being a responsible housewife, Rogeline has been engaged in selling fish, pork, chicken and frozen foods within the public market to generate income. She is 34 years old and has two school aged children. To continuously provide the necessities of her family, she would like to improve more of her business to increase her income. Having insufficient capital, she would like to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP50,000 to buy more  stocks of fish, dressed chicken, hot dogs, ham, tocino(pork sausages) and pork to resell. Being a patient and diligent mother, she believes that someday she will make her business a more profitable and viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more  stocks of fish, dressed chicken, hot dogs, ham, tocino(pork sausages) and pork to resell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita manages their vulcanizing and motorcycle repair shop in their village. She is proud that they retain their regular customers because of their good service. With their earnings from their business, Teresita is able to provide for her six children's basic needs. At present, most their income from their business is reserved for the education of her kids. Teresita hopes to have more customers to earn higher profit as well. Teresita would like to borrow a loan of P18,000 to buy spare parts and tools to be used in running their business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools to be used in running their business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals and animal feeds

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un almacén en el que vende repuestos para motocicletas y vehículos, es un negocio iniciado con el afán y la esperanza de poder darle una vida digna a su familia.

El desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta en materia de repuestos vehiculares.

Con este dinero podrá garantizar la sostenibilidad de su negocio.
Tiene grandes esperanzas en su almacén y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.

Mejora la vida de este colombiano con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Jairo is a man who, thanks to his hard work, has his battery charged to take on the world and live a full life.  

He has a store that sells spare parts for motorcycles and vehicles.  He started the business with the desire and the hope to give his family a respectable life. 

Jairo wants to expand the product line he has for sale and improve his sales by injecting some capital into his business.  That is why he is requesting a loan; he wants to purchase spare parts that he doesn't currently have in stock.  With the money from the loan, Jairo will be able to guarantee his business's sustainability. 

Jairo has great hopes for his store.  He think that his future can be greatly improved thanks to the entities that make it possible for people to dream of a better, more stable life. 

Improve this Colombian's life with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase a variety of spare vehicular parts, which will improve his inventory.

loans.name: Nora Margarita

texts.es:
Nora, de 47 años, es una mujer bastante trabajadora y soñadora.

Desea desempeñarse como distribuidora de mercancía variada como ropa y zapatos para ganarse la vida de una manera digna y al mismo tiempo poder ayudar a su esposo con la carga económica de su hogar.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y el de su familia. Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de ropa al por mayor y de este modo aprovechar la oportunidad que le presenta la vida de poder ser independiente.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables.

Impacta la vida de Nora con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
47-year-old Nora is very hardworking woman and also a dreamer. 

She would like to start working as a distributor of a variety of merchandise such as clothes and shoes so she can make herself an honest living and at the same time be able to help her husband with the financial burdens of the house. 

She's driven to start this job by her desire to find the necessary means to support her family. She is a very enterprising and disciplined woman.  

She is requesting a loan to buy a wide variety of clothes in bulk so she can make the most of this opportunity to be independent. 

She hopes to be able to progress as a businesswoman and have a more stable income. 

Make an impact on Nora's life by lending today!

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk so she can start her own business selling merchandise.

loans.name: Asasio

texts.en: Asasio is a 39-year-old married man, with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a business selling matooke (bananas) for four years to get money and support his family. He is also a painter and that is where he gets side income. He has a dream of educating his children. He will use the money to buy bunches of bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy bunches of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restore a stall.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 21 years old and is a student from Prey Veng province of Cambodia. She studies pharmacology. Due to the fact that she is short of financial support, Mary would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. This loan will help her graduate. In the future, after graduation, she is going to run a pharmacy.

loans.use: pay tuition fees

loans.name: Iringa Group

texts.en:
Felster, who is in her early 40s, is married with six school-going children. She has been selling charcoal for ten years now.  She works from 6am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Felster's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her charcoal stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay for school fees, bought a TV set,  deck, sofa set, fridge, and covered her household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.  She dreams of buying a plot of land.

Felster will share this loan with her loan group "Iringa" which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jelly Jahan

texts.es:
El señor  Jelly  de 38 años de edad es  casado, tiene 1 hijo que depende de él, vive en San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 7 años  a la remodelación de edificios, oficinas, bancos y casas residenciales, el construye cielos falsos, fachadas el tiene una pequeña compañía de remodelación.
Don Jelly es una persona trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de tres taladros para trabajos de tabla yeso. Con el apoyo de este crédito él pretende  mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida. Es un cliente nuevo su sueño es mejorar su taller de remodelación.
San Lorenzo, Honduras- Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Señor Jelly is 38-years old, married and has one dependent son.  He lives in San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras.  Don Jelly has his own home.  For the last seven years, he has made his living remodeling buildings, offices, banks and residential homes.  He builds false ceilings and facades.  He has a small remodeling company. 
Don Jelly is a hard-working person with a desire to get ahead.  He is requesting the loan to purchase three drills for working with drywall sheets.  With the help of this loan, don Jelly plans to improve his income and his quality of life.  
He is a new client, and his hope is to improve his remodeling business.  
San Lorenzo, Honduras- October, 2014.

loans.use: to purchase three drills for his business.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea is 26 years old and single. She is engaged in reselling handicrafts and souvenirs within the local community. She aspires to become successful and financially stable in the future. To achieve her goal, she aims to improve her business and make it more profitable to generate sufficient income. Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to access financial assistance amounting to PHP35,000 to buy more handicrafts and souvenirs to resell. Having patience and strong determination, she is hoping that someday, she will improve her business and achieve her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy more handicrafts and souvenirs to resell

loans.name: Donna Claire

texts.en: Donna Claire is 24 years old and single. She is engaged in selling of frozen foods in their village. She has been managing her business for almost one year. Donna Claire dreams to work abroad for higher income. She is managing her business well to gain income that she will use to fix her papers to go abroad. Donna Claire wishes to have higher sales and income as well. She will not achieve her wish if she only has limited stock. Thus, Donna Claire is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy tocino, hot dogs, sausage, and ham to sell.  She hopes to gain higher income through extending the goods she is selling.

loans.use: to buy tocino, hot dogs, sausage, and ham to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is so grateful for the 50,000 PHP loan granted to her to buy the needed products for her printing business. Her income from her T-shirt business is a big help in her family's everyday household expenditures. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday expenses. She also sells chlorine bleach for additional income.

Arlene would like again to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy paint, screens, and shirts, as well as clothing and other items for her business.  Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Arlene plans to put up another branch to serve her growing clients.  She wants to send her children to the bests schools until college. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy shirt printing supplies

loans.name: Lany

texts.en:
Lany is 45 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children now at their school age.
 
Lany is now engaged in her newly opened sari-sari store business. She is also receiving support from her husband as a member of the Philippine National Police.  Lany earns approximately PHP4,000.00 each month from her business. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of consumable groceries and other goods for retail.

Lany has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Lany hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is from Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena, Philippines. She is 63 years old, married and has three children. 

In order to sustain their family, Isabelita sells bleaching liquid in front of her house. Her product is salable since most of the women in the area are using bleaching liquid in their house especially in their laundry. She has had this business for 5 years and it's doing well.  She earns a meager income to support her family in addition to the income from her husband. 

Isabelita requested a loan to purchase more gallons of bleaching liquid to increase sales and serve more customers. Isabelita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years, she is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: buy bleach to resell

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Retailing helped Imelda make a living for her family. She retails bleaching liquid and brings a meager income of PHP 4,000 per month. She found the business of buying and selling "hypo" (bleaching liquid) easy and simple because all she needed to do is to fill in the empty bottles and gallons for her buyers. 

Imelda plans to expand her retailing business. She applied a loan to PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to restock inventories of "hypo" (bleaching liquid) for retail to gain more profit to sufficiently provide the family. Imelda smiles at the fact of seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: buy bleach to resell

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him, because he was able to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of his computer units. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for him to pay for the maintenance of his computer units. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Jason hopes to sustain the growing needs of his family. He also desires to give the best for the education of his children. He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional computers, spare parts, and supplies.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is twenty nine years old, married with two children, and living in Kasese Uganda. Jolly runs a retail shop selling general merchandise. She has been in that business since 2009.  She also practices farming, growing crops such as maize, cotton and beans to get side income.  

Jolly has a dream of expanding her business, however competition and limited capital are her major challenges. Jolly requested a loan to buy sugar, soda, millet flour, books, pens and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Mugambi

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Mugambi. He is a hardworking smallholder farmer based in Mugwe in the Chuka area of Kenya. He has been doing farming on his two acre plot of land for more than a decade. He keeps a dairy cow and seven chickens for milk and eggs. The 17 trees planted on the land shows how Mugambi is environmentally responsible.  The 45 year-old farmer is also a family man. He has been married six years to a woman who gave him three children. The youngest is only two years old. 

Mugambi is seeking a loan to purchase grains. For extra income, he brokers cereals. The only way he can expand this business is by getting his hands on more grains from the farmers. To do this, he has to leverage his business and pay the debt using the returns he will get from selling the cereals. 
Mugambi describes his childhood as difficult. It took hard work and street smarts to get him where he is today. The environment he has been exposed to has made him very cautious when approaching new business opportunities. The fact he is somewhat risk-averse makes him a favourable borrower with a sober approach on how he is going to spend and regain money. 
He stated  that he will use the increased income to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase Cereals

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a thirty-five-year-old married woman with five children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She has been in the business of cocoa selling for five years and is very hard working and committed. She serves both men and women and hopes to expand her business for better profits. She asked for a loan to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.use: buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, 35, is a small-scale farmer who specializes in horticulture. She is based in a small village called Ndubeneti, near Eldoret, Kenya. This charming mother has been doing agriculture on her small, fertile piece of land for five years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. 

Sarah is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. Her biggest challenge over the years as a farmer has been lack of adequate capital. It is very hard for small farmers to save enough capital for expansion since farming is marred with all sorts of external risks, such as climatic conditions, pests and diseases, political instability, fluctuation of prices and high costs of inputs. Because of these factors, the sure way farmers can obtain adequate capital is through leveraging their businesses. With your loan investment, Sarah is going to expand her horticultural farm in order to increase its output. If and when the investment pays off, Sarah will plough the profits back into the farm and increase her asset base.

loans.use: expand her farm

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with one child. She owns a house that neither has electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

Rukia operates a fruit and vegetables selling stall.  She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With this KSH 50,000 loan, Rukia wants to purchase more sacks of vegetable and fruits to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy fruits & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Yoern's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Speu province’s Somrong Tong district, Yoern is aged 64 years and married with four children. To make a living and support her family, Yoern and her husband have been selling various kinds of vegetables.  The current business earns her about 25,000KHR per day. 

This is the second micro loan for Yoern’s group of three with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to build a decent latrine for the use of her family. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family's use.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 21-year-old married woman from Nablus city. She lives with her husband and their young son in a simple house. Her husband has a butcher shop in the city, and this is the family's only source of income. 

Lina is a student in her last year of nursing school. She would like to take her Bachelor of Arts degree and find a job to help her husband cover the family expenses. 

Lina has taken a U.S. dollars loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help pay her university tuition for this semester. And by taking this loan, Lina will be able to complete her studies faster and continue to improve herself. 

Lina appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to pay for this semester's university tuition.

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla is grateful that she was granted a PHP 15,000 loan assistance which she has used to buy scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan on her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Precilla desires to prosper in her business for she wants to give her children a good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
