Narine is 36 years old and she lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Narine is divorced, and she has brought up her two children alone since she was a very young age. Now her son lives and works abroad and her daughter is married and lives with her family in Yerevan city. 

Now Narine lives alone and works at the bread factory. She dreamed for many years of repairing her house, which she finally managed to do with her saved money. This loan will be of great help to her since she wants to buy furniture for her guest room. 

She says her savings are gone, but she would like to meet her guests in a nice, clean house with comfortable furniture. This loan in the amount of 500,000 Armenian drams will be used for the purchase of furniture for her newly repaired guest room.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her newly repaired guest room.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo es un hombre de 60 años de edad que se dedica a la comercialización de frutas ambulantemente recorriendo los barrios buscando un cliente que quiera disfrutar un producto 100% natural.
Gustavo entre sus valores tiene la amabilidad y la excelente disposición que tienen las personas antioqueñas para prestar un servicio, y este negocio lo ha desempeñado durante mucho tiempo siendo el primero en el sector y gracias a ellos puede pagar una educación universitaria a sus hijos y aspira que con el negocio pueda atraer más clientes pues diversificara su oferta al traer frutas que normalmente no comercializa. 
solicita un crédito que invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de frutas. 
Su sueño es tener salud para seguir ejerciendo esta actividad que puede que no llene mucho su bolsillo pero llena su alma.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a 60-year old man who earns his living selling fruit as he walks around the neighbourhood looking for customers who want to enjoy products that are 100% natural. One of his many qualities is Gustavo’s friendliness—a characteristic of people from this area of Colombia. He enjoys providing good service to his customers. He’s had his business for a long time and was the first in the area. Because of this he has been able to pay for his children’s university educations. 

Gustavo hopes that his business will attract new customers because he will offer fruit that is not normally sold in the neighbourhood. He is seeking a loan that will used in its entirety to buy fruit. His dream is to remain healthy so that he can continue his business that is so much a part of his soul.

loans.use: buy different kinds of fruit and attract new customers

loans.name: John Antonio

texts.es:
John se desempeña exitosamente en su negocio de cerrajería y soldadura de metal, siendo una persona muy reconocida en el barrio por su buen trabajo y servicio. 

Ya que ha laborado 12 años con los conocimientos que adquirió por medio de su trabajo en distintos talleres, ha tenido la oportunidad de mantener su trabajo y ha intentado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 

Por esta razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de herramientas para facilitar su trabajo como tranzador, prensa, compresor, un soldador y herramienta de mano. 

Con estos elementos podrá continuar prestando su servicio ya que la herramienta que utiliza esta en mal estado y hay otra que le hace falta.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran taller con varios empleados y poco a poco podrá lograr su objetivo. 

Ayuda a un hombre emprendedor con ganas de salir adelante con un préstamo!
texts.en:
John has a successful locksmith and metal-welding business. In his neighborhood he is very well-known for doing a good job and offering a good service.

He has done this job for 12 years after having gained his knowledge though working in different workshops. He has had the chance to keep his job and has tried to improve his family's quality of life. 

With this in mind, he would like to request a loan to buy some tools to make his job easier such as: a tracer, a press, a compressor, a soldering iron and hand tools. 

The tools he uses at the moment are in bad condition and he is lacking some others so by having these new tools, he will be able to continue offering his service. 

His main goal is to have a large workshop with a number of employees and little by little work towards his goal of improving his family's quality of life. 

Lend to this enterprising man who is keen to get ahead in life!

loans.use: to buy tools for his business.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Салтанат 24 года, не замужем, детей нет. У Салтанат - среднее образование, работает официантом в ресторане. Салтанат живет с братом, ее родители погибли. В качестве дополнительного дохода она занимается животноводством и полеводством, выращивая на 1,0 ГА собственной земли картофель. Также в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, лошадь и 15 овец, на ежедневной основе Салтанат продает молоко. Благодаря упорному труду совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь Салтанат, так как всю заработную плату она откладывает на обучение, Салтанат очень хочет поступить в университет. Поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на сбор урожая картофеля и покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита Салтанат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на свое обучение и улучшение материального положения.
texts.en: Saltanat is 24 years old, single and has no children. Saltanat has a secondary education and works as a waitress at a restaurant. Saltanat lives with her brother because her parents passed away. To provide additional income, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming, growing potatoes on 1.0 hectare of owned land. Her business also contains 3 cows, a horse and 15 sheep. Saltanat sells milk on a daily basis. Thanks to her hard work, her aggregate income amounts to 8,000 som (KGS), but this money is not enough to have a decent life. Saltanat is saving her entire salary for education because she wants to go to a university. This is why, in order to further develop her business, Saltanat requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to gather her potatoes harvest and buy livestock for fattening up. Saltanat is planning to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities and saving money for her education and improving her financial situation.

loans.use: to harvest potatos and buy additional livestock in order to be more profitable and pay for her higher education

loans.name: Laura Cristina

texts.es:
Laura una mujer de 19 años de edad que carga con una gran responsabilidad y es que tiene un hijo de 2 años y como madre cabeza de hogar busco alternativas para mantenerlo y darle a su retoño un bienestar y calidad de viuda digno.
Laura es muy ingeniosa y creativa que busca a través de la corporación Interactuar iniciar su propio negocio de venta de calzado y accesorios para dama el cual atenderá personalmente y dedicara todos los días de la semana el tiempo que sea necesario pues necesita urgentemente una entrada de dinero. 
Con el crédito espera iniciar su empresa comprando poca mercancía pero aspirando a crecer y un poder abrir un local comercial.
texts.en:
Laura is a 19-year-old woman who bears a great responsibility, which is that she has a 2-year-old son, and as a mother who is the head of the household, she sought options for supporting him and giving her little one well-being and a dignified quality of life.

Laura is very ingenious and creative, and through the Interactuar Corporation she is seeking to begin her own business of selling footwear and accessories for women. She will attend to business personally and will work every day of the week for the time that is necessary, since she urgently needs an inflow of money.

With the loan she hopes to begin her business by buying a little merchandise, but she hopes to grow and be able to open a commercial shop.

loans.use: to begin her own business of selling accessories and footwear for women.

loans.name: Sidonia

texts.en:
Sidonia is married and has five children. There seven members of the family including her husband. Her husband is a carpenter. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She wants to open a bigger store in the future, so she will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as milk, candy, ketchup, soap, biscuits, shampoo, sugar, water and other things to sell, including soft drinks. 

Sidonia opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $100. She is happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy milk, candy, ketchup, soap, biscuits, shampoo, sugar, water and other things to sell, including soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for transportation of farm goods.

loans.name: Mpipi Group

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi, who is in her late 30s, is married with two sons who are still in school.  She has been running two projects, selling charcoal and food ingredients including soda, juice and water. She has been in her business since 2004.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and cooking ingredients including soda, juice and water.  She dreams of renovating her selling place buy putting cement on the shop floor.

Mwanamkasi will share this loan with her loan group, "Mpipi", which consists of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal, cooking ingredients, soda, juice and water.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 28 years old. She is married with two children between one and three years old. Neither goes to school yet. 

Olive sells shoes and has been running in a business for four years. After receiving her loan, she would like to buy more shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy land for building a new house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make the first payment on the second restaurant she is opening, and to purchase supplies.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 24 years old, single, and a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Shirley operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Shirley earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Shirley requested a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Shirley meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from  God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 21-year-old single man who opened his own barber shop three years ago to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker, and an independent and ambitious man who is trying desperately to improve his living conditions.

He is now acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to expand his business through opening a large new barber shop where he will be able to provide his customers with better service. He hopes to expand his business more in the future to save some profit and improve his social and financial situations.

loans.use: to expand his business through opening a large new barber shop.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 39 years old. She is married with five children aged between 10 and 19 years, all of whom go to school. She has a shop and she has been working in the business for ten years. 

With the loan requested, Seraphine would like to buy more rice, cooking oil, and lotions to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, cooking oil, and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Chrispiner

texts.en:
Chrispiner is married and has two kids who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry farming business which is her source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbors. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 30,000 she wants to add to her savings and purchase poultry feeds and medicine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds and medicine.

loans.name: Lucie Need Edit

texts.en:
Lucie is 44 years old. She is married with seven children between the ages of 10 and 25 years. Five of them go to school. 

Lucie is a carpenter and has been working in this business for five years. After receiving her loan, she would like to buy more wood for making more cupboards and chairs for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more wood for making more cupboards and chairs for sale.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.en:
Lucie is 30 years old. She is married with two children between six months and four years old, who do not yet go to school. 

Lucie sells vegetables and has been in the sales business for two years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy carrots and cabbages for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business and to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy carrots and cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Liliana Marcela

texts.es:
Liliana una bella joven de 21 años de edad que inicio un negocio de reparación de aparatos móviles gracias a cursos y capacitaciones que asistió para iniciar un negocio, es una joven muy emprendedora e inteligente que abrió su negocio con la esperanza de recaudar capital para poder viajar y conocer diferentes partes del mundo.
Solicita un crédito el cual invertirá en su totalidad en pagos de pasivos, diferentes negocios que realizo para abrir el local comercial y quiere ser muy puntual en sus pagos para seguir teniendo el apoyo de estas entidades y una de ellas es Interactuar con la que se compromete a pagar puntualmente.
texts.en:
Liliana is a lovely young woman of 21 who began a business of repairing mobile devices thanks to courses and training that she attended in order to begin her business. She is a very entrepreneurial and intelligent young woman who opened her business with the hope of raising money to be able to travel and know different parts of the world.

She is applying for a loan that she will invest entirely in paying debts to different businesses that she acquired in order to open her business space. She wants to be very punctual with her payments in order to continue having the support of these entities. One of them is Interactuar, which she promises to pay punctually.

loans.use: to pay debts to her providers in order to be up-to-date and continue having their support in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: maintain and improve the premises of her ice-cream store

loans.name: Felicia's Group

texts.en:
Felicia is 48 years old and she is engaged in full-time palm oil processing. This is a trade she has been known with since her youth, but because of limited capital, she finds it very difficult to meet up with her annual family responsibilities. As a single mother, she has the responsibility of taking care of her 5 children living with her. Since she joined Nke-Anyi Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society, she has learned to save through our weekly Osusu contribution and this has help her to manage her income wisely. 

This loan will help her and her group members to increase production this season, so as to be able to increase her income and support her family. 
   
Thanks to all Kiva lenders who find time to read through and support this loan.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is an 18-year-old student and an Engineering major. He lives with his parents in Pursat province of Cambodia. Due to a shortage of finances, David would like to request a loan to pay his tuition fees. This loan will provide him with a skill to build a bright future. In the future, he is going to find a good job. He wants to be a good engineer.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher successfully repaid his previous loan and used it to develop his business. He is very grateful to everyone who has helped him with the financing. Today, Alisher's business consists of two dairy cows and 32 sheep. He is the main provider of his family as his wife is in the household. She helps him with feeding the cattle. 

Alisher plans to build a new house for his family in the future from the profits. He is going to increase the number of cattle he feeds. He is asking for a loan of 8,000 TJS to buy sheep. He awaits your mercy and needs your help.

loans.use: to buy sheep for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is very thankful that she was granted loan assistance because she was able to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Luisa hopes to expand soon, and she only wants good health and strength for her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Elmelida

texts.en:
Elmelida is a rural farmer in Kisii, Kenya, an area known for producing the best bananas in the world. She is blessed with two children, and has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. 

On her farm, Elmelida grows maize, has a dairy cow, and keeps poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize, and when she is not farming, Elmelida engages in some personal business to help supplement the meager income she earns. However, despite the meager earnings, farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction. "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" 

Elmelida's biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. For a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Elmelida formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports small rural farmers. With her previous loan, Elmelida purchased a dairy cow that she later named Mrembo (Swahili for beautiful). Mrembo produces milk daily, which Elmelida sells to a co-operative. "The money from milk comes regularly and is not very affected by sudden changes in weather if you have stored feed," says Elmelida. The money Elmelida earned from selling the milk was adequate to repay her loan. 

Today, Elmelida is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. 

With this loan, Elmelida is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and a good livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin de 42 años de edad  es el propietario de una peluquería, que inició aproximadamente hace 28 años. Él inició en su colegio, con sus compañeros, para practicar un hobby y le gustó, por eso decidió preparase estudiando hasta convertir esta actividad en su actividad diaria generadora de ingresos con la cual sostiene a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijas en las edades de 10 a 20 años. Sus principales productos son los cortes de cabellos, tratamientos capilares, manicure, pedicure. Actualmente atiende a domicilio y sueña con ubicarse en un local, donde sus clientes encuentren un ambiente confortable además de un servicio personal de excelencia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales constructivos, pintura de paredes y de decoración de interiores, con el fin de hacer un mejoramiento a un local, que adecuará como su salón de belleza. Con esta inversión la imagen de su servicio mejorará en apariencia y en calidad, potencializando así el incremento de sus ventas por el acceso de nuevos clientes, a lo cual es lo que Edwin apunta.
texts.en:
42-year old Edwin owns a hair salon. He started the business approximately 28 years ago when he was a high school student. It began as a hobby with some of his friends, but he enjoyed the work so he decided to become qualified. Now this is the way that he earns money to support his wife and three children, all daughters between the ages of 10 and 20. 

Edwin’s principal services are haircuts, hair treatments, manicures and pedicures. He currently works out of his house, but his dream is to have a salon where his clients can find a comfortable environment while they enjoy his excellent service. 

Edwin is now seeking a Kiva loan, the first he has had with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the money he plans to buy construction materials, and paint and decorations for the walls so that he can improve the premises and make them more like a beauty salon. With this investment he will improve the image of his salon, both its appearance and the quality of the services he provides. His aim is to attract new customers and increase income.

loans.use: buy construction materials, and paint and decorations for the walls

loans.name: Yi's Group

texts.en:
Yi’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Yi makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer and tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jonilyn

texts.en:
Jonilyn is 47 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children who are now at adult and school ages. 

Jonilyn is engaged in a direct selling business, particularly ready-to-wear clothes, cosmetics and other beauty products. Jonilyn earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing roofing materials for her ongoing house construction.

Jonilyn became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Jonilyn hopes to expand her direct selling business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing roofing materials for her ongoing house construction.

loans.name: Nhoeb

texts.en:
Nhoeb is 51 years old, a rice seller, and a married woman with five children living in Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. She has been in this business since 2012. Her husband is 50; he is a motorcycle taxi driver. Two of her children are cooks, and three are students. Together, they can earn approximately $19 a day. 

Now Nhoeb would like to request a loan to buy rice seeds for farming. This loan will help her earn more money for the family. In the future, she is going to fill the soil around her house and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for farming

loans.name: Lucilla

texts.en:
Lucilla is thankful for the financial assistance given to her, as she was able to purchase more quantities of meat products needed to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to pay for more meat products that are necessary in her business. The more items displayed at her stall the better. More products to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lucilla hopes to give her family a better life through all of her hard work in business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for pork and chicken meat needed for her business.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a hardworking middle-aged man who lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya. He is married to a lovely, diligent, 39-year-old wife who gave him four children. He has been doing dairy farming for a living for the last seven years. His primary income source is milk.
 
Ben has always wanted to do poultry farming as a business. He has a few birds that give him eggs for food, but he feels it is time to upgrade it to becoming a business. 

He is seeking a loan of KES 65,000 to purchase a brood of hens for egg production. He will be selling the eggs he collects to neighbours, institutions, hotels, and to retail shops. 

Income from this business will help him deal with the high transportation costs that are eating into his profits. He will also use the increased income to meet his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Consuelo De Las Misericordias

texts.es:
Consuelo es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 13 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Consuelo y quieren que también progrese en su actividad.

Desde siempre sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de belleza y ropa para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de su hogar.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.

Haz que los sueños de Consuelo Se hagan realidad con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Consuelo is a very entrepreneurial woman with a great will to get ahead and make progress.

For 13 years she has been selling products by catalog such as clothing, accessories, beauty products, and household items. She sells these products principally to friends, neighbors, and relatives who know her and also want her to progress in her business.

She has always felt a great affinity for business and sales, and for this reason she now has great skills in this field, thanks to her friendliness and her excellent quality of service.

She is applying for a loan to buy a stock of beauty products and clothing to increase her inventory and improve her sales, thus obtaining some good income to contribute to the household expenses.

She hopes to be able to advance thanks to the support of the good-hearted people who support this type of project.

Make the dreams of Consuelo become a reality with a loan!

loans.use: to buy stock of beauty products and clothing to increase her inventory and improve her sales.

loans.name: Yourn's Group

texts.en:
Yourn’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Yourn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 20-year-old married man, who has been working selling charcoal and wood logs for two years. His current business is his only source for living, thus he has to work hard in order to make sure that he can expand it as much as he can, to reply to the increasing number of customers, and to develop his family's living.

Hassan is acquiring his second loan cycle from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, and has proven to be a borrower in good standing. His previous loan was requested to pay for his house furniture and to get married, which he achieved. Today, his acquired a Youth loan will be used to increase his business capital with new kinds of charcoal and wood logs to increase his selling, especially before the winter season. He hopes that in the future, he can open his own wide selling shop, instead of his mobile selling, which he is doing currently, moving from one village to another for his living.

loans.use: to increase his business capital with new kinds of charcoal and wood logs to sell.

loans.name: Snow White Group

texts.en:
Salwa is the featured borrower for the Snow White Group. She applied for  this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and improve their standard of living.

Salwa is a 26-year-old married woman with one child who started giving private lessons six years ago.  She helps her husband to cover the needs and expenses of their family. She works hard to improve her family's living conditions and will use  a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to open a souvenir shop.  This will provide  a second source of income which will help her in satisfying the needs of her beloved family.  She hopes to expand her business  in the future. 

Salwa is the lady sitting in the middle, Zeinab is the first lady on the right, and Aisha is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to open a souvenir shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, juice, soda, and water.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 49-year-old  single woman. She is currently residing in a rural community and earns her living  farming and raising hogs. 

She plans to improve business to generate a higher income but has insufficient capital.   She requests 10,000.00 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs. 

Through her patience and hard work, she is hoping that she will further improve the business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a very supportive mother for her children. She works hard just to give a formal education for her children. With her desire to provide her children allowances daily, Cristina engages herself in any kind of business that she may earn income. 

At present, Cristina sells grocery items in their village. She wants to expand her business, but she can’t pursue it due to a lack of capital. Hence, she is asking for a loan of P12,000 to buy additional items of groceries to sell. 

In the future, Cristina anticipates a positive result on being a responsible parent.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries items to sell.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor, age 53, is from Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with 4 children. He joined PMPC and he appreciates the programs and services of the Co-op. The Co-op supported him by providing the capital to start his fish vending business. From his desire to sufficiently provide his family, he gives his best effort to sell all his fish, in order to continue putting food on the table for his family. 

Nestor is now trying to expand his resources, so he decided to venture into the hog raising business to earn more income. He asked financial assistance from Paglaum MPC to buy fish nets and floaters for his fishing activities to generate more income. He is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing his capital needs. In addition, he wanted his business to be well known and to build a good business management for his loyal customers. With his extra income, he wishes to provide his family a good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and floaters for his fishing activities to generate more income.

location.town: Plaridel-Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is thankful that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan which she used to buy quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
She would like to apply for another Php 12,000 which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the will result in more sales and thus increase her earnings. It will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Luzviminda hopes to be able to expand her store soon. She dreams of having a brighter future and giving her children the best education.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Fernando José

texts.es: Fernando quiere comprar una fotocopiadora; él sabe que su negocio la necesita especialmente para estas venideras vacaciones y festividades, en las que se impactan sus ventas y hay muchos clientes, que están preguntando por este servicio, con el que planea mejorar sus ingresos, e impactar  la imagen de su unidad de negocio sustancialmente. Fernando tiene 59 años de edad y de ellos 38 los ha dedicado al comercio. Cuando quedó desempleado, lo primero que hizo fue comprar libros para venderlos y así generar ingresos, luego agregó a esta actividad el servicio de empaste y hoy tiene como meta ofrecer el servicio de fotocopiaje. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un crdikiva, primer financimeinto que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una fotocopiadora; mas adelante programa ubicar una librería en su barrio y persistir en su trabajo, para ofrecerle un mejor bienestar a su familia, lo cual es su propósito de prosperidad. .
texts.en:
Fernando wants to buy a photocopier. He knows that his business needs it, especially for these approaching vacations and holidays, in which his sales are impacted and there are many customers who ask for this service. With this, he plans to improve his income and impact the image of his business substantially. 

Fernando is 59 years old, and for 38 of these years he has worked in business. When he was left unemployed, the first thing that he did was to buy books to sell and thus generate income. Then he added binding service to this business, and now he has offering photocopying service as a goal. This is the reason why he is turning to a Kiva loan, the first financing that he has had from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which he will buy a photocopier. In the future he plans to locate a bookstore in his neighborhood and continue with his work, in order to offer better well-being to his family, which is his resolution for prosperity.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married and has been blessed with three school-going children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Zawadi has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge, the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. Zawadi dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and fruit to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for 2 sows and 1 boar as part of SSLLP's piggery program.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 63 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children now at their adult age. Naomi is a Lady Pastor in one of the religious congregations in the country. She receives a monthly love gift in the amount of not less than PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of ministerial work. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional sacks of cement, paints, tiles and home accessories for the ongoing house construction. Naomi has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Naomi hopes that all her family and church members will become members and be active participants of the cooperative’s activities.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of cement, paints, tiles and home accessories.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is thankful for the financial assistance given to her, as she was able to purchase more quantities of meat products needed to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan for her to pay for more meat products that are necessary in her business. The more items displayed at her stall the better. More products to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs, and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zenaida wants to save for their future, and so that she will also be able to have business expansion in the years to come. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of pork, chicken and beef

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment and inventories necessary for oxygen cocktail sales.

loans.name: Vardenik

texts.en:
Vardenik lives in the village Tavros of Syunik region. She is of 56 years old and lives with her parents, since her husband and children  temporally live and work in Russian Federation.   Vardenik also lived there for several years. 

She has a medical vocational education and during the years living abroad she received training in psychology and worked as a psychologist. She also worked at the pharmacy as a consultant. 

She returned to her native village to she help her parents farm.  She  missed the village-life and its residents.  She takes care of a cow, 2 bulls, 2 heifers and 15 chickens. Vardenik and her mother make cheese and butter to sell. Vardenik also sells milk, meat and eggs. 

She requests a loan to buy animal fodder and firewood for the coming winter months.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder and  firewood.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Julius. He is a brilliant, hardworking, heavy-set, Kenyan smallholder mixed-farmer from Kaplamai village in North Rift Province. His main sources of income are maize/corn and milk. Julius spends most of his time cultivating his land during planting season. For the rest of the year, he shifts his attention to his dairy cattle. He counts himself lucky to get the support of his 34-year-old wife and two daughters, who are still in their infancy. 

Julius is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements. The toughest problems he faces when working on his farm are the unreliability and inefficiency of the old equipment. Using such tools compromises the quality of work, and makes the user weary. With your loan, however, Julius will acquire modern tools that are comfortable to handle, more effective, and produce a better quality of work. This acquisition will save him a lot of time and effort that he spends on the farm.

Proceeds from the investment will help him meet his family's basic needs. He is striving to the the best dad his daughters could ever have.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Pamela, 41 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Nyakoe, a remote village in Kisii. She is happily married and is blessed with four adorable children. 

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years, and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Kisii area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. 

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. 

As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is married and she has six children. She has been involved in business activities since 2000, with her own working capital of $150 and she does her best on it. She has very high interest in doing business, so the second she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin, she is still improving her management for her business. She is earning good money but she still wants to improve her business so she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more additional items to keep in her store including shampoo, detergent, salt, cooking oil, coffee, sardines, milk, biscuits, noodles and other things to sell Including soft drinks and hard drinks. She lives near many people so they come to buy every day.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, detergent, salt, cooking oil,  coffee, sardines, milk, biscuits, noodles and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is very grateful because she was granted a PHP 50,000 loan assistance, which she has used to purchase more quantities of dried fish, biscuits, and frozen products that are needed to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time amounting to PHP 25,000. She will utilize the loan to pay for dried fish, biscuits, charcoal, and rice, which are necessary in her business. The more of stocks that she displayed at her stall, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Filipina's profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Filipina wants to become a successful entrepreneur someday. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of dried fish, biscuits, charcoal, and rice needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: Genoveva is 30 years old, married and has four children. She and her husband work together to earn income and sustain the necessities of their family. They aim to improve their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better living. To have an additional source of income, she is engaged in reselling wood carvings within the local community. She aims to acquire more stock of those products but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more stock of wood carvings and handicrafts to resell. She hopes that someday she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wood carvings and handicrafts to resell.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. He is a father of three children; his two daughters are married and live with their families and his son is passing his military service at the army. Armen graduated from constructional college. For several years he worked at the textile fabric as a worker. Now he has his small business; he is engaged in the sales and installation of antennas. He works by order around his city.

After planning of many years,  Armen finally did a repair on his house. He hopes that Kiva lenders will help him with a loan amount to buy furniture for his repaired living room. He thanks you in advance, and hopes to be supported for this situation.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his repaired living room

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora, 42 years old, lives in Kauswagan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental with her husband and four children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack & food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viand & snacks to their neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in March of 2012. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. 

Now, she applies for 10,000PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store for the continuous patronage of the buyers. 

She hopes that her business will continue, and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Hassana

texts.en:
Hassana is a 39-year-old widowed mother of six children and has been working hard for the last two years to provide for her beloved family a good living and education, especially after her husband passed away.

Hassana has a shop which she inherited from her husband. Because she doesn't have enough capital to start a business, she sets it up for rent and lives through its return. The renting income is just fine to cover her family's necessary living expenses, but not enough to cover increasing and unexpected requests.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's school tuition fees. She believes that education is very important for a brighter future. She might also use part of the loan to buy necessary food and wood logs to be prepared for the coming winter season.

She hopes to continue to be independent in raising her six children well, and will work hard to save some money so that in the future she can open her own grocery store.

loans.use: To pay for her children school tuition fees

loans.name: Rabih Al Akhdar Group

texts.en:
Lina is the featured borrower for Rabih Al Akhdar Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Lina is a 31-year-old married mother of three children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband and the increasing living costs, she decided to start selling cosmetics from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their beloved kids. 

Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. She hopes to achieve success in her new business, which will help her to open her own cosmetics shop. 

With respect to the other group members, Hala is a 45-year-old married mother of three children who owns both vegetables and shoe shops, and wants to increase her business merchandise in the two shops. Saada is a married mother of four children who works as clothes saleswoman and wants to pay the school's tuition fees of her children, and increase her business merchandise with new fashionable clothes.

Lina is the lady standing in the middle, Hala is the first lady on the left, and Saada is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to start selling cosmetics from her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to start selling dry food in addition to fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lazos Unidos Y Rumbos Distintos Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAZOS UNIDOS Y RUMBOS DISTINTOS” es conformado por socios dedicados a prestar servicios y al comercio minorista. Janet tiene 41 años de edad  es casada con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas hace 10 años y a la vez  cultiva algunas frutas que produce en la  zona que radica. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Janet es la primera persona sentada del  lado izquierdo
texts.en:
The group “Lazos Unidos y Rumbos Distintos” (United Ties and Different Paths) is composed of members dedicated to providing services and retail business. 

Janet is the first seated person on the far left. She is 41 years old and married with 3 dependent children. For the past ten years she has worked selling fruit while also growing some fruit in the area where she lives. She will invest the loan in the purchase of more fruit. 

The group expresses their gratitude to the KIVA investors for the loan provided.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of a 12-year-old child from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 21 years now. This is the source of their income. Analyn is asking for a loan from CEVI, a micro finance partner of Kiva in the Philippines to buy a new boat engine. This will enable her and her husband to improve their business and income. In the future, Analyn hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. She also wants to save enough money for the school expenses of her child.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 36 years old. She is known in their barangay for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. 

She is very thankful when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house to have a decent and safe living space for her family

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Luna is able to turn the tide in her favor, and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce to maintain her inventories for her customers. 

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce to maintain her inventory for her customers

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is a 41-year-old married father of three children, who has been working on repairing car body work since 1994.

Twenty years of experience provided him with an excellent reputation in his domain and special talents, in addition to customers' trust and support.

Antoine is a hardworking man and his hard work helps him in developing his career properly. In addition to his current business, he started transporting children from school as an additional income business to improve his beloved family's living.

He is his family's sole earner; thus he has to make sure that he can cover all of his family's needs. Since education is very important to him, he works hard to provide his children with the best, since he didn't have the chance to acquire more than the intermediate level and had to start working to support his parents.

Antoine is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his children's increasing school tuition fees, which currently he can save from his acquired income.

He hopes to expand both businesses to make sure that he can provide his children with university degrees.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Sophoan

texts.en:
Sophoan is a 44-year-old married farmer with two children; she lives in Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1990. One of her children attends school. Her husband is 45 and has been a fish seller since 2003. Both of them can earn approximately $30 a day. 

To improve her husband’s business, Sophoan would like to request a loan for her husband to buy more fish to resell. This loan will help her husband earn more income. 

In the future, Sophoan is going to buy a motorcycle with a trailer for her husband to transport fish to sell, will build fences around her house and will help her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids, who attend school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Anne has operated a poultry-selling business for over three years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Anne dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 34 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children, now at their school age. 

Madelyn has been engaged in operating a sari-sari (general) store for six years already. She earns approximately 1,000 PHP each month doing this business activity, which is so helpful in meeting her family's needs. She has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. 

Madelyn has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to expand her sari-sari store.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Mukaddasa

texts.en:
Mukaddasa was born in 1983. She is married and a mother of 2 children. As a mother, she wants to continue to improve the well-being of her children.

Mukaddasa buys and sells shoes in a local market. She has been in this business for 10 years. She would buy the shoes in bulk, then resale them to the local community. The profit from her business is used to improve her family's living condition. 

Mukaddasa wants to increase her working capital to improve business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a variety of shoes for the new season. She awaits your support. This loan will help her to maximize profit and to enable her to send her children to good school.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of six grown-up children from Carles, Iloilo. She has  been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than three years now. Celsa also earns a supplemental income through her retail sales of gasoline. 

Celsa needs a loan for the improvement of their fishing business. She is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat and gasoline. 

A loan will help her and her husband in improving their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. This will also help her gasoline retail business. 

Celsa hopes that she will be able to expand her business so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and gasoline

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto is a hardworking father from Southern Looc, Plaridel, Philippines. He is managing his fishing activities. He owned two fishing boats where he hired 5 fishermen to work for him. He personally sells the catch from his fishing boats in a nearby fish market. Since he became a member of Paglaum MPC, he has been a member in good standing for almost seven years. 

He wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 50,000 for the purchase of new nets, foams, and other fishing accessories. As much as possible, he has to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. 

He already has floaters to help guard his fish cages. He also wants to buy the fish catch of his neighbors so he can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where he will fetch higher prices. 

In the future, he dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.

loans.use: purchase of new nets, foams, and other fishing accessories

loans.name: Twizerane Cb Group

texts.en:
Mwamini is a group leader, age 39 years; she is married with three children between the ages of 7 and 15. 

The group is called “TWIZERANE” means "Let Us be Trusted" in English. The members of the group sells different items, and they wish to scale up for the better future of the businesses. 

Mwamini has been selling clothes for seven years.

With the loan requested, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profit from the business will be used to increase their savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 62, is a Kenyan farmer from Kisiara village in the mountainous South Rift region. He stays with his beautiful wife Salina and his five children. David has been running a mixed farm for at least 12 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea.

David heavily relies on milk production for his regular income, because tea farming follows a seasonal cycle and the poultry farm is not so big yet. The problem arises when, for one reason or the other, he cannot milk his cow. This often occurs whenever the cow is under treatment. It is for this reason that David is seeking a loan to purchase an additional cow.

With your loan, the acquired cow will cover such periods of temporary shortages. When both cows are milked, the farmer will get more milk for sale thus more income. David being a man so concerned about the future of his kids, he has already committed any income generated from this investment to his children's education fees. He believes that through education, his children will have a better living.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 68 years old and lives in San Isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now at their adult age. 

Lucia is engaged in agri-business, specifically in hog raising, for three years already. She earns approximately PHP1,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing an additional piglet for her existing hog raising business. 

Lucia has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Lucia hopes to expand her hog raising business.

loans.use: To purchase an additional piglet

loans.name: Moreno

texts.en:
Moreno is a 19-year-old single man from Carles, Ilo-ilo. He operates a fishing business to earn an income. He catches fresh fish and then sells them to the people in his community. Moreno has been engaged in this business for almost 3 years.

Moreno is requesting a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy an engine and a compressor for his fishing motorboat. With them, he will be able to increase his ongoing catch and help to buy enough food for the whole family.

In the future, Moreno would like to expand his fishing business to reach a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy engine and compressor for his fishing boat

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle is a farmer. She requested a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, which she will use to purchase seedlings and compost for a healthy rice crop. This loan will help give her farming income a big boost. Anabelle looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and compost

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 42 years old, married, and has five children. She is a resident of Lao Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She and her husband have a fishing business from which they earn a living. They work hard in selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. 

Nida requested a loan from Paglaum MPC for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more fish to sell to maximize her profit and support her family's needs. With their savings, Nida and her husband want to expand their business.  She hopes to see her children get their diplomas one day.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
"Eighty percent of Kenyans are farmers, and by that, I mean people who make a living off of the land, and 80 percent of the food that people eat comes from people who sell in the rural marketplace,” says David, a 49-year-old mixed farmer based in Etago, a remote village in the Kenyenya area of Kenya.

David is a proud father of two school-going children whom he truly loves and greatly adores. David describes his upbringing as challenging, so he is doing everything in his power to provide a good foundation for his children and to help secure their future. 

David has been farming for over 12 years. Over the years he has gained much experience and is now considered to be one of the best farmers in his village because of the immense knowledge he possesses. Since he has excess food for dairy cattle and enough space on his land, David has always wanted to buy another dairy cow, but his challenge is a lack of finances. That is why Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring men like David to turn their dreams into reality. David believes the loan will help him to satisfy the demand for milk in his area and enable him to realize his dream of developing his business into a large enterprise.

Many men in Kenya are responsible for not only producing food, but also feeding their family. David wants to provide all of the basic needs that his children and parents require. David is very disciplined with his finances and he knows that, with the accumulated profits, he will be able to fully repay his loan.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is juggling her business responsibilities with supervising the renovation of her family's home. Adelfa hopes to live comfortably, with a house of good roofing and wide living space for the family, supported by her loan of PHP 50,000.

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. Adelfa was given a priority, as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for, because all her financing needs for her retailing business have been supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her house renovation, so she can have a good roof and wide living space for the family.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thankful that she was granted a PHP 10,000 loan, which she used to buy materials needed for her rug-making business. From her sewing earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

Now, she would like to apply for another loan of PHP 10,000. She will use this loan, like the previous one, to buy fabric, thread, and other materials necessary for her sewing business. She is positive that her earnings will increase, as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you, in advance, for the financial help that will be given her.

She dreams that her business will grow, to give her family a bright future. She wants her grandchildren to earn a College Degree. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies she needs for her rug-sewing business

loans.name: Cyclin

texts.en:
Cyclin is a hardworking, 44-year-old mother who resides in Siquijor, Philippines. She has 4 children and is married to a butcher. 

The wage that her husband earns is not enough to sustain the daily family needs. So, Cyclin opened a meat shop where she buys one pig at a time and sells the pork cuts. Cyclin has been in the business for more than 2 years now and she wants to expand. She has decided to include beef and chicken, and she wants to improve the store space as well. This way, she hopes to gain more profit and earn enough to sustain her family, especially her children as she would like to be able to send her son to college. 

In order for Cyclin to make her wish possible, she needs 50,000 PHP additional capital and will use the money to expand her business. She intends to purchase more inventories of meat to sell in her shop and to gain more profit. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her meat shop

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane signed up for a membership with PMPC, and availed herself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that PMPC extends to small-time borrowers, like her.

Mary Jane was able to turn the tide in her favor and has been making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she obtained a new loan. She is using it to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, and soft drinks. Her plan is to increase her inventory and sales. In the future, she hopes to establish a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, which will increase her sales

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
In 2012, Carmelita learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and the financial assistance it gives to start-ups. Carmelita tried her luck at business, focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to PMPC, for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

Now, Carmelita has borrowed another amount, to pay for seedlings and compost for a healthy, growing rice crop. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Carmelita looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost for a healthy, growing rice crop

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Juan está en su ciclo número  2  del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, quieren salir adelante e ir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Albina quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación, ella vende leche, queso, huevo de gallina, pato,  también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones.
La Sra. Solicita de este prestamo para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named “San Juan” is in its second loan cycle with the committee program. All of the members are working and helping one another move forward because they want to get ahead and keep growing.

One of the members is Sra. Albina. Through her efforts, her continuous work, and the application of vital training, she has become a successful woman. As a result, her situation has improved. Albina sells milk, cheese, chicken eggs, and duck eggs. The work of the advisors should also be mentioned since they provide constant training and verification.

Sra. Albina is requesting a loan so that she can buy balanced feed for fattening her animals and other items. This will help to solidify her business plan, which will enable her to continue improving her earnings.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for fattening her animals.

loans.name: Puthtra's Group

texts.en:
Puthtra’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Puthtra works as a farmer to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nueva  Generacion - Sayllapata Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva  Generación - Sayllapata” está ubicado en el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
La socia Santusa continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva años dedicándose a sus negocios los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a sus negocios, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
La socia agradece la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
Los demás socios se dedican a la ganaderia, venta de cerelaes, crianza de animales, agricultura.
texts.en:
Santusa is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Generación – Sayllapata” which is located in the District of Colquepata in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, Peru. She continues to raise small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and other livestock. Santusa also continues to engage in farming. She has been in these businesses for years and is doing well because of the effort she puts into her work each day. Santusa wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy guinea pigs for her business. Santusa is grateful for the opportunity that has been given to her and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

The other members engage in raising livestock, selling grains, raising animals, and agriculture.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Jasurbek

texts.en:
Jasurbek, who was born in 1992, lives with his parents. Now in his fifth year studying economics at the Tajikistan State University of Politics and Business, Jasurbek is a successful student. He also has a business selling food items in a local market. 

Now, Jasurbek is requesting a loan to pay for tuition fees at the university. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Kemravy's Group

texts.en:
Kemravy’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Kemravy works as a farmer to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yem's Group

texts.en:
Yem’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Yem works as a farmer to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Sokun’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sokun works as a farmer to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ana Rose

texts.en:
Ana Rose is a 23-year-old, married woman, and a mother of a 2-year-old son, from Carles, Iloilo. Ana Rose earns a living through fishing. She and her husband have been in the business for more than five years, now. They sell their catch at the market nearest to their place.

Ana Rose wants to improve their venture, but lacks the capital to do so. So she requested a loan from CEVI, which she will use to buy a new fishing boat and a new boat engine. A loan will give them the opportunity to augment their daily catch.

In the future, Ana Rose hopes to make their fishing business more productive and stable.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and a new boat engine, which will enable them to increase their daily catch

loans.name: Phoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Phoeurn’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phoeurn makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a tailor and village coordinator to support his family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rawya

texts.en:
Rawya is a 39-year-old married mother of two. She works hard with her husband, who's a soldier, to provide them with the the necessary living needs.

Rawya has been working for seven years from her house as a hairdresser and makeup artist; she is well-known in her region with the special talents she has and the encouraging prices she sets.

Rawya is a hardworking woman, with an excellent reputation in her region. Rawya runs her business from her house because currently she can't afford opening a separate beauty salon. She prefers to be next to her children in the meantime to stay ready to reply to their needs.

Unfortunately, her income, combined with her husband's limited salary, aren't enough to cover any extra unexpected requested payment, which is why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children's increasing school tuition fees.
