Rawya hopes that one day she can develop her business in a well-managed way and that her children will be capable of depending on themselves so that she can move her business outside her house to attract more customers.

loans.use: To pay for her children's increasing school tuition fees

loans.name: Elnor

texts.en: Elnor is from Carles, in Iloilo Province. For 20 years, she has been engaged in fishing, together with her husband. This is how they support their children, ages 13 and 17. While her fishing business is thriving, Elnor needs to do maintenance on maintain her boat. She is asking for a loan to buy plywood, epoxy, paint and an engine. It is important that she conduct regular maintenance on her boat, in order for her fishing activities to run smoothly. In the future, she hopes to expand her business. so she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy plywood, epoxy, paint and an engine to maintain her fishing boat.

loans.name: Martuhi

texts.en:
Martuhi, this charming and nice lady, is 39 years old and lives with her big family in Vanadzor city of the Lori region. She is the mother of three children; two daughters and a son. Martuhi’s husband works as a rescuer at the fire rescue service.

For 15 years Martuhi has worked at the city court as a commandant and simultaneously she has her small business trading cosmetics, perfume and purses for women. Her customers are her colleagues, friends and neighbors. She also takes orders from her customers. As she says, she is very happy to help her husband financially with her business income, since her family needs are a lot; her elder daughter is a student (she studies at the paid division) and two others are school-aged.

Martuhi is asking for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams in order to enlarge the assortment of her perfumes for sale and she also wants to buy stylish purses for women to sell.

loans.use: to enlarge the assortment of her perfumes and to buy stylish purses to sell

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is a resident of the town of Carles, Bohol. She is 47 years old and has six children. Minerva earns a living through her fishing business. She has been in this venture with her husband for more than 27 years, now.

Miverva wants to avail herself of a loan, to buy a new fishing boat. A new boat will help them to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Minerva hopes to make their business more sustainable and profitable. Furthermore, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat

loans.name: Fina

texts.en:
Fina is 53 years old and comes from the town of Carles, in Iloilo. She is married and has one adult son. Twenty-eight years ago, she went into the fishing business with her husband, while also keeping a sari-sari (variety) store.

Fina would like to expand her store and is asking for a loan to buy more stock, including snack foods, coffee, milk, canned goods, and toiletries. Any income generated will be used for food, savings, and reinvestment in the same business.

In the future, Fina hopes to make her store bigger and more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock, including snack foods, coffee, and milk

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
A 43-year-old, married woman, Rosana makes a living through fishing. She has done this for more than 28 years, now. She has seven children. Rosana resides with her family, in the town of Carles, Iloilo. Rosana has supported her husband in their fishing venture.

Now she wants to avail herself of a loan, to buy a new fishing boat and engine. This will enable her and her husband to improve their income from fishing. Furthermore, she wants to save enough money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and engine.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of nine children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than thirty years now. Fishing has been the source of their income. 

As of now, Tessie has decided to access a loan to buy a new boat engine and materials such as plywood, nails, a hull and propeller for the repair of her fishing boat. This loan will help her to improve their business as well as their income. 

Tessie is optimistic that their fishing venture will become more profitable and stable in the future. In addition, Tessie wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and materials such as plywood, nails, a hull and propeller for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothes, bed sheets and pillowcases to resell

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en: Brigida is 41 years old and married. She was blessed with four children. They live in a rural community. She owns and manages a small retail store, to generate income. Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, she needs to increase her income in order to provide for the family's living needs and finance the education of their children. Having inadequate capital, Brigida is asking for an additional PHP 15,000. She will use the loan to buy more stock to resell, including grocery items and wood carvings. With this financial assistance, she believes that she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to resell, including grocery items and wood carvings

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth is thankful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various materials for her rug-making business. Through her earnings she has been able to meet her family's daily living expenses.

Now she would like to apply for a 40,000 PHP loan. She will use this loan to buy more fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her rug-making business. Her income from her business helps sustain her family's basic needs. She is thanking God and you, in advance, for the financial help that will be given her.

Jenneth aims to serve a big refinery for their cleaning needs. Her products are used for wiping and cleaning surfaces. She dreams of a brighter future and a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials she needs for her rug-making business.

loans.name: Rommel

texts.en:
Rommel is a fisherman who has been fishing for six years now to provide for himself and his wife. He works hard in order to save money. He hopes to have a big family some day. 

Rommel is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and an engine to run his fishing business smoothly.

In the future, Rommel would like to have another source of income while sustaining his fishing venture and making it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and an engine.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEGNA est constitué de 7 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 6ème prêt. Les 5 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers à l’image de MAÏMOUNA qui est la 2ème femme assise devant dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 20 paires de chaussures, 5 pièces de pagnes avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Badegna Group is made up of seven married women who, on average, are 30 years old and have four children. They live in nuclear families in the Heremakono Nord neighborhood of the town of Bougouni. They know one another through neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. 

In order to strengthen their financial capacity in order to better run their business, [the group members] joined microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their sixth loan. The five previous loans have all been correctly repaid.

This group of women is selling various goods through Maimouna, who is the second woman seated, left to right, in the front row in the photo. With her loan, she plans to purchase 20 pairs of shoes and five pieces of pagne [traditional] fabric from Bougouni's wholesalers. Maimouna makes her sales at the market and from her home, at retail prices for cash and credit to a group of customers made up of men and women.

Maimouna expects to see an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs, which will be invested in the businesses and will repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase various goods.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en: Ra’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Ra makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a construction worker and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Aun's Group

texts.en: Aun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Aun makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as tailor and clerk to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Boran's Group

texts.en: Boran’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Boran makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a posho mill.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en: Sarom’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sarom makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a tailor and village coordinator to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Eun's Group

texts.en: Eun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Eun makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a scrap dealer and tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 44-year-old married woman from the town of Carles, Iloilo. She has eight children and some of them are still attending school. Jessica earns a living through fishing. She helps her husband in their venture. For more than 28 years, fishing has given Jessica and her family the income that they need.
 
Jessica would like to borrow a loan to buy a new fishing boat. A loan will greatly help her and her husband in improving their income and profit. 

For now, Jessica's priority is the expansion of their business so that it will provide more revenue necessary for their needs, especially for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase boot-making inventory, preparing for the peak demand that comes in winter, to increase their sales

loans.name: Nolvia

texts.es:
La señora Nolvia de 41  años de edad, vive con su hija en su casa propia, vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de venta de tortillas, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y vecinos que la prefieren por su buena atención y su buen producto.
Doña Nolvia es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz y leña, que son los productos más necesarios para la elaboración de sus tortillas, con el apoyo de este préstamo,  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es una cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Octubre de 2014
texts.en:
Nolvia, 41, lives with her daughter in her own home.  She lives in the city of San Lorenzo, in the Valle department, in the southern part of Honduras.  For 3 years, she has had a business selling tortillas.  Her customers are all her neighbors, and they patronize her business because of her good service and good products.  

Nolvia is an enterprising woman who, with a desire to get ahead and strive each day to improve her quality of life, is requesting this loan so that she can buy corn and firewood, which are the products she needs to make her tortillas.  With the support of this loan, she plans to increase her income and thereby improve her quality of life.  Nolvia is a new client who wants to work with Prisma.  Her dream is to have a better future with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- October 2014

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for her business

loans.name: Yam's Group

texts.en: Yam’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yam makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a construction worker, factory laborer, and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en: Phalla’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phalla makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe CONFIANCE est constitué de 5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO CENTRE de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le  précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait de la restauration à l’image de AMINATA qui est la femme assise devant dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100 kg de riz, 10kg de poissons et 15kg de viandes avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Confiance [Confidence] Group is made up of five married women who, on average, are 38 years old and have four children. They live in nuclear families in the Heremakono Centre neighborhood in the town of Bougouni.

These women known one another through neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. To strengthen their financial capacity in order to better conduct their business, they joined microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their second loan. The previous loan was properly repaid.

This group of women is working in the food industry through Aminata, who is the woman seated at the front in the photo. With her loan, she plans to purchase 100kg of rice, 10kg of fish, and 15kg of meat from Bougouni's wholesalers. She makes her sales at the market and from her home, at retail prices for cash to a group of customers made up of men and women.

Aminata expects to see an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs, which will be invested in the businesses and will repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak is an entrepreneurial person who is married and has adult children. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 18 years. Little by little, with the passing of time, she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to the animals' good condition, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers.

Muborak is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy young cattle.

loans.name: Donke Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DONKE est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 23 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers  à l’image de NASSOUN qui est la femme assise devant dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 paires de draps et 5 pièces de pagnes avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.500FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Donke Groupe is made up of five married women who, on average, are 23 years old and have three children. They live in nuclear families in the Heremakono Nord neighborhood in the town of Bougouni.

These women know one another through neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. To strengthen their financial capacity in order to better conduct their business, they joined microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their first loan. This group of women is selling various goods through Nassoun, who is the woman seated in front in the photo. With her loan, she plans to purchase 10 pairs of sheets and five pieces of pagne [traditional cloth] from Bougouni's wholesalers. Nassoun carries out her sales at the market and at home, at retail prices for cash and credit to a group of customers made up of men and women. She expects to see an average monthly profit of 12,500 CFA francs, which will be invested in the businesses and will repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase various goods.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline, aged 51, operates a fishing business to earn a living. She catches fish and sells these to members of her local community. She has been engaged in this business for almost 20 years. Madeline lives with her family in Carles, Iloilo. She and her husband have eight children. Their eldest child is 28 years old and the youngest is eight. Madeline is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 40,000 in order to buy fishing nets, paint, plywood and epoxy (an adhesive). These materials will help improve her daily catch. This is a great opportunity where in she can now manage her fishing business well which brings comfort to the whole family.

In the future, Madeline would like to expand her fishing business enough to support the college education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, paint, plywood and epoxy (an adhesive).

loans.name: Dominggo

texts.en:
Dominggo is a 52-year-old fisherman from Carles, Iloilo. He is a married man and a father of eight children. Dominggo has been engaged in the fishing business for several years, now. This is his source of income.

Dominggo would like to borrow a loan, which he will use to buy a new fishing boat. This loan will help Dominggo to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. Dominggo hopes to improve his business and make it a success. He also wants to save money for the school fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Florina

texts.en:
Florina landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC came to Florina's rescue by lending her money when she needed it the most. 

Now, Florina has accessed another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation to provide the needs of her family. Florina perseveres and always strives to reach her goals, which are to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.en:
Jhonny, aged 34, lives with his family in Carles, Iloilo. He and his wife have four children. Their eldest child is sixteen years old and the youngest is six.

Jhonny, engages in fishing to earn an income. He catches fish and sells these to members of his local community. He has been engaged in this business for more than ten years. Jhonny is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 in order to buy a newly furbished pump boat. With this, Jhonny would improve his daily catch and would eventually provide his children with nutritious diets.

Jhonny would like to expand his fishing business to continue financing the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy a newly furbished pumpboat

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica lives with her husband and son in San Martin, Puebla. Angelica is the proud owner of a small convenience store in her town. She works hard every day to help her husband with the home expense. Angelica and her husband have built their home slowly and their son room is unfinished.  Finish the room for their teenage kid has taken more than expected. He still sleeps in the sofa of the living room. Angelica has been saving for the last three months to buy the materials needed to finish the building the room. 
She is asking for a loan that will help her buy the last materials and start the construction.  Angelica and her husband make no more than $1,000 USD a month. However because they are not employees, the income is not guaranteed.  Getting access to a a housing credit through other institutions is impossible to them. 
She and her husband will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. This new addition will give everyone in the family the space they need. Angelica is aware that dedication and hard work is what will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building a room for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: bricks, cement, sand, gravel, metal, and to pay for labor to build a room for her business.

loans.name: Monday's Group

texts.en:
Monday is a 33 years old hard working young man. Been the firstborn to a very poor family, he had to drop out of school because his father got blind as a result of accident, leaving his mother to work hard to feed the family of 6 children. To support the family, Monday was forced to drop out of school and became a palm oil mill manual worker. For over 10 years now he has been working hard at that mill, alongside other workers with similar sad stories. 

A portion of this loan will help Monday store his own palm oil this season and make more income to support his mother in her effort to educate his younger siblings.
Monday wish to get a little stable financially soon so that he can get married.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora has made national women dresses for 9 years. Nigora affords all necessary things for her family using the profits from her business. There are 5 members in her family. Her husband is a constructor and her daughter helps  with the sewing. Nigora learned how to  sew from her mother when she was young. Her mother also was an experienced seamstress. 

Nigora needs to financial support because she is ill and must buy medicine for treatment. Nigora requests 11,000 TJS to buy medicine. She really needs to your support and thanks you for your generosity.

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es: Ana tiene 54 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Ana se dedica a la venta de queso y tamales desde hace mucho mucho tiempo. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma junto a su esposo quien es albañil mantienen la economía del hogar. Ana desea reparar las condiciones de su cocina por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, arena, ladrillo, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder mejorar las condiciones de la cocina lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Ana is 54 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their children. Ana has been working selling cheese and tamales for a long time. She has been selling in the streets for a long time, and by this she and her husband, who is a bricklayer, keep up the economy of their household. 

Ana wants to make repairs to her kitchen, and this is why she is asking for this loan from FUSAI, in order to invest it in the purchase of the material she needs, like: galvanized metal sheets, wood, cement, sand, bricks, etc. She hopes to be able to get this loan and by this to be able to make improvements to her kitchen as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy: galvanized metal sheets, wood, cement, sand, bricks, etc., in order to repair her kitchen.

loans.name: Merrycris

texts.en:
Merrycris is 25 years of age and lives in Lopez Jaena, Philippines. She is married with two children.

Merrycris is engaged in a retailing business; she buys merchandise in bulk for retail. She has had this business for 2 years now. 

She requested a loan to pay for the pawned cocoland for her desired farming project. The income from her business shall be the payoff to the loan she requested to PMPC. She has been a member of PMPC for a year already. 

In the future, Merrycris hopes to have a good standard of living for her family and adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to pay for the pawned cocoland for her desired farming project

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is a 43-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Carles, Iloilo. 

She and her husband have had a fishing business for 15 years. The business has provided Ginalyn and her family the income that they need. 

Ginalyn is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat to catch more fish. They sell it to the nearest market in their town. 

Ginalyn wants to improve their fishing business so that it will become more sustainable and productive. Additionally, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is grateful that she was granted a PHP 10,000 loan assistance which she has used to purchase quantities of raw materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials like crepe paper, glue, patterns, plastic and other materials that are needed in her "Hot Air Balloon" business, as she calls it. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilian wants to have an increase in the number of customers. She hopes that her family is always free from any form of sickness. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy crepe paper, glue, patterns, plastic and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Gladys Cecilia

texts.es:
Gladys es una granjera muy capacitada gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre la cual se dedica al cultivo de café negocio que ha pasado de generación en generación y que ella quiere mantener en pie y poder trasmitirle un día sus conocimientos, enseñanzas y sus terrenos a un futuro hijo que pueda tener. 
Gladys en el momento se encuentra con una dificultad para seguir con la protección, sostenibilidad y crecimiento de su negocio y es que las temporadas de invierno y los altos costos de insumos la han limitado mucho y como se puede observar en la foto tiene todo preparado pero le hacen falta abonos, riegos, fertilizantes, pesticidas y otros productos para el cultivo que suman el valor pro el cual está solicitando la ayuda a los prestamista del portal Kiva.
Con la ayuda de este crédito Gladys podrá seguir cultivando café y aportar con un granito la cuota de café colombiana que disfrutan tantos países en el mundo.
texts.en:
Gladys is a very skilled farmer thanks to the teachings imparted by her father. She makes a living cultivating coffee, a family business handed down through the generations. She wants to keep the business going and to one day pass her knowledge, teachings, and land to a future child of hers.

At this time, Gladys finds it difficult to continue protecting, maintaining, and growing the business. The winter seasons and the high cost of agricultural inputs have greatly limited her. 

As shown in the photo, she has everything ready, but she needs compost, irrigation, fertilizers, pesticides, and other agricultural inputs that add value to the production, and this is why she is asking for help from the Kiva lenders.

With the help of this loan, Gladys will be able to continue farming coffee and she will do her part, adding with her small contribution to the Colombian coffee quota enjoyed in so many countries of the world.

loans.use: to buy soil preparation inputs, compost, irrigation, pesticides, insecticides, fungicides, etc.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 30 años de edad  de estado civil viuda vive con su hija de 11 años en el cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar, en la comunidad Nueva Esperanza.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Rural Cooperativa Curi-Ñan  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva esperanza, esta se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Rosario se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos para criarlos y venderlos. Su meta es darle una buena calidad de vida a su hija. Su desafío es las enfermedades. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión y pasearse con su hija.
texts.en:
Rosario is 30 years old. She is a widow and she lives with her 11 year old daughter, in the municipality of Guaranda, province of Bolivar, in the community of Nueva Esperanza.

She is a member of Ventanilla Rural Cooperativa Curi-Nan, located in the community of Nueva Esperanza. Most people there work in agriculture and livestock.

Rosario is a farmer, and she also raises animals. She is requesting the loan to buy pigs to raise them and sell them. Her goal is to offer her daughter a good life. The real challenges are the diseases.

In her spare time she enjoys watching TV and going out with her daughter.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of animals.

loans.name: Augustina's Group

texts.en:
Augustina is a 46 years old woman and a mother of 4 children. She lives with her husband and children in their small house in the village. She is the village women leader and a very active member of Nke-Anyi Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society. Her effort has drawn many women from the village to embrace palm oil processing and marketing trade. Augustina did not have any formal education but her determination is to see that her 4 children achieve basic education and if possible further to university level.

A portion of this loan will enable her purchase palm fruits and process it this season so as to increase her income and support her husband in caring for the family.
In the future, she hopes to setup a mini palm oil processing mill in the village so as to ease herself and other farmers in her village the long trip to a far-off mill in the next village.
 
Augustina and her group members send a heartfelt appreciation to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en: Sergio is married and has two children. He currently works in a private college. His mother was detected with a vision problem to see from far distance and is affecting her daily activities.  He's currently supporting her financially because his mom has health problems. Due to it, she cannot work which is the main reason why she couldn't have the surgery in the past.

loans.use: to pay for an eye surgery to his mom

loans.name: Sanarei Group

texts.en:
Mangijaobi is an active woman who lives with certain principles and also takes an active role in social activities. “Every woman’s words are priceless; their decision should be respected in the family, and they should strive for financial freedom,” she says. She is pictured with the other group members and featured with her hand raised. All the group members share the same locality, which is about 35 kilometres from the main town. 

She weaves colourful, pretty shawls at home and generates income by selling and supplying her products in the main market. “I have seen that there is nothing more independent and being free for a woman than to earn their own income, and I am happy to be one of them.” She could weave one shawl per day if she got no other business and sell it in the market at the rate of 250 INR. Her husband is a daily wage earner whose income cannot be depended upon, since he spends most of his earnings in drinking. 

Mangijaobi had availed herself of a loan from WSDS in the previous years to buy raw materials for weaving. She provides education fees for her son from the profit she made out of the loan and also bought enough stock of yarn for her weaving. She says, “The loan had given me the opportunity to weave independently to earn my own income and stand on my own feet, which I'm proud of today.” She cannot thank enough the lenders for their kind act. 

Now, she aspires to buy a handloom. With the Kiva loan, she will buy a handloom and employ one person for more production and supply more products in the market. She is excited and sends good wishes to all the lenders. 

The other group members are engaged in weaving, embroidery, grocery store, and poultry farming businesses and wanted to promote their businesses through the Kiva loan. They are all very hardworking women.

loans.use: to buy a handloom to use in weaving shawls.

loans.name: Innercore School Group

texts.en:
This is a group of primary school teachers in their 30's and 40's from Umoja estate, within Nairobi, Kenya. They all use kerosene for lighting. With kerosene lamps, they do not have sufficient light for their children to study and also there is a lot of indoor air pollution from the kerosene fumes which leads to respiratory diseases. 

Currently on average each member spends USD 1.02 on kerosene every day for lighting. The loan will enable them purchase solar lamps - Sun King Pro 2 - that will cut their costs of kerosene. The solar is user friendly to both adults and children and they will now be able to channel their finances they used on kerosene to other activities. They will also significantly reduce the chances of house fire that emanate from un-watched kerosene lamps

loans.use: to purchase solar lamps

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is a 36-year-old Khmer-traditional clothes weaver. She is married with two children and lives in Takeo Province,Cambodia. 

She has been a weaver since 2009 and earns approximately $8 a day. Her husband is a 45-year-old security guard earning $6 a day. Previously, both of them were farmers. Chanthy request a loan to buy calves to fatten and resell. This loan will help her to earn more income.  

In the future, she is going to build a new house and educate her children through  high school.

loans.use: to buy calves to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Señor De La Esperanza De Huaripache Group

texts.es: El grupo “SEÑOR DE LA ESPERANZA DE HUARIPCAHE” está conformada por socias trabajadoras  y empeñosas con ansias de mejorara la  calidad de sus  familia. Rosmery  tiene 24 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida rápida en horas de la tarde y en las mañanas brindas servicios de profesora en una escuela inicial. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de insumos pollos papa aceite para la venta de comida rápida. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Rosmery es la que encuentra sentada en medio viste buzo azulino.
texts.en:
The “SEÑOR DE LA ESPERANZA DE HUARIPCAHE” group is made up of 5 hardworking and entrepreneurial members dedicated to improving the quality of their families. 

Rosmery is 24 years old, lives with her partner, and has two young children. She makes a living by selling fast food in the afternoons. In the morning, she is a preschool teacher. She will invest the loan in the purchase of supplies, like chicken, potatoes, and oil, to use for her fast food.

The group thanks Kiva lenders for the loan. Rosmery is the one seated in the middle and wearing the blue hooded sweatshirt.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, potatoes, and oil.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en: Suhrob was born in 1992. He is a smart young man and always tries to learn more. Suhrob studied well in school, and after graduating, he applied to the Tajik Commerce University. Now he is studying his last course. Suhrob likes reading. He studies in absentia and also works in an organization. He is married. His wife also is a student. They live together with his parents. Suhrob must pay for tuition but does not have money. He is asking for a loan of 600 USD to pay for tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky, 32, operates a fishing business to earn an income. He sells fish to members of his local community. He has been engaged in this business for more than 5 years. 

Ricky lives with his family in Carles, Iloilo. He and his wife have one child who is 15. 

Ricky is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 in order to buy a readymade pumpboat. This will help him increase his ongoing catch and hopefully provide his family with a nutritious diet. 

In the future, Ricky would like to expand his fishing business enough to support the college education of his child.

loans.use: to buy a readymade pumpboat

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en:
Grigor lives with his family in the city of Dilijan  and he sends his greetings from the most beautiful city of the region. He is 48 years old and he was educated as an engineer-constructor. Grigor works at the computer office to repair computers and printing machines. His wife also is employed and she works at a private company as a manager. 

They have two pretty daughters. Their elder daughter works at the insurance company and the youngest daughter is a student at the Yerevan State University. She is a linguist. 

Grigor requests 300.000 AMD to pay his youngest  daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester. Grigor and his daughter thank  Kiva in advance for the  loan and great support.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen has had a fishing business for 5 years. She catches fish and sells them  to members of her community.  Karen  lives with her family in Carles, Ilo-ilo. She is married and has a four year old child.  

She requests 20,000 PHP to buy a ready made pump boat. It will  improved her catch and eventually help to defray the family's daily expenses.

In the future, Karen would like to expand her fishing business enough to support the needs of her growing child.

loans.use: to buy  a ready made pump boat.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma  is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity and piped water.

Fatuma has operated a pub for the past two years, selling both alcohol and soft drinks. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With this loan, she wants to purchase stocks of beer, wine and soft drinks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of beer, wine and soft drinks

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 40-year-old, single lady who started baking from her house five years ago to cover the expenses and needs of her family that consists of three members for she is their sole earner.

Today, Amira is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her oven and buy a car which will facilitate her business and allow her to provide her customers with a better service, as she hopes to expand her business more in the future to own a bakery shop.

loans.use: to renovate her oven and buy a car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase woolen yarn to knit more qualified products to meet clients' orders on time

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy is 25 years old and has one child. She engages in buying and reselling used clothing within the rural community to generate an income. She aims to improve this business and make it profitable in order to gain a higher income. Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to purchase PHP 7,000 of additional stocks of the said products to resell. Through patience and strong determination, she is hoping that someday, she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Yaquelin Areli

texts.es: Yaquelin de 19 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida. Ella es una mujer muy inteligente y trabajadora que se gana la vida apoyada en el oficio de la pesca, actividad que tiene mucho tiempo de realizar, además trabaja en una barbería, por lo que logra tener muy buenos ingresos, además su compañero de vida se gana la vida como jornalero. Yaquelin tiene el deseo de remodelar un cuarto de su vivienda, para lo cual construirá una pared y encementar el piso de la misma, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yaquelin is 19 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner. She is a very intelligent and hardworking woman who earns a living as a fisherman, which she has done for a long time. She also works in a barbershop, so she has a very good source of income. Her partner works as a day laborer.

Yaquelin would like to remodel a room in her home, so she will build a wall and cement the floor. She has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a room in her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a room in her home.

loans.name: Modesta Isabel

texts.es:
Modesta es una mujer emprendedora, un verdadero ejemplo de superación personal, una mujer muy escasa de recursos que asistió un curso de sena para aprender a realizar productos derivados de lactosa y desde ese entonces de la cocina de su hogar elabora yogurt que distribuye dos días a la semana. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima como leche, endulzantes y frutas naturales buscando ser más rentable y generar más recursos para poder terminar a sus 44 años de edad sus estudios primarios e iniciar sus estudios de secundaria.
Es madre de 3 hijos y quiere seguir estudiando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Modesta is an entrepreneurial woman and a true example of self-improvement. She has few resources and attended a course to learn to make products derived from dairy. From then on, she has made yogurt in her home and distributes it two days per week. 

She requests a loan to purchase materials like milk, sweeteners, and natural fruit. She hopes to make her business more profitable and to generate more resources so that she can finish her primary school studies at 44 years old and begin secondary school.

She is the mother of three children and would like to continue to study so that she can improve her life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase milk, fruit, and sweeteners to make yogurt.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 59 years old but she still works hard and engages in fishing. Eight of her children are adult while her youngest is 17. Rosalina is asking for a loan to improve her livelihood. She will use it to buy plywood, adhesive, nails, nylon, bamboo and hard wood for her fishing boat. She is determined to keep and expand her business because this is the only livelihood she knows best. 

In the future, she hopes to further expand her business and make it more successful.

loans.use: to buy plywood, adhesive, nails, nylon, bamboo and hard wood for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hairdressing equipment and inventories to increase her turnover.

loans.name: Dhahabu

texts.en:
Dhahabu is a married woman who has two kids, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

Dhahabu operates a grocery and vegetable-selling stall. She sells at the market, to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge, namely, the high cost of transportation of goods to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale cereals shop, in the near future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her daughter's university fees.

loans.name: Al Thika Group

texts.en:
Reem is the featured borrower of Al Thika group.  She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they all work hard to develop their living.
Reem is a 21-year-old single lady, who's the sole breadwinner for five other members of her family in addition to taking care of herself.
Reem has worked as a sales person in a clothes shop for two years.  In addition to her current job, she is also employed in a special events organizing company, where she presents special traditional dances that are displayed during the opening of a wedding or any other similar occasion.
She is working hard to provide her family with the necessary living needs, while at the same time she is working hard to finish her education with a very good degree.
Since her family's needs are increasing and she is longing to finish her education, Reem is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her university tuition fees.
She hopes that when she graduates, she can find a better job that will help her start her own business and develop her family's living.
Reem is the first lady at the far right side of the picture. As for the other group members, Rouba is the first from the left.  She is single who is also acquiring her loan to pay for her university.  She is the sole breadwinner to four other members of her family.  Anisa is the lady at the center.   She is a married mother of three, who works from her house, cooking for employees who don't have anyone to prepare a good meal for them and who prefer not to order junk food.

loans.use: To pay for her university tuition fees

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Mujeres Emprendedoras” conformado por 07 socias entusiastas y dinámicas. Presentación de 53 años de edad  es casada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica  a la venta y distribución de frutas como mandarina y plátano. Fruto a su esfuerzo su negocio sigue creciendo. Su mayor deseo es contar con un puesto de venta en un mercado. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de naranja, mandarina, plátano y manzana. El grupo “Mujeres Emprendedoras” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Presentación es la segunda del lado derecho y viste chaleco plomo.
texts.en:
This group, Mujeres Emprendedoras, is made up of seven enthusiastic and dynamic members.

Presentación, 53, is married and has one dependent child.  She earns a living selling and distributing fruit such as mandarins and bananas.  Her business keeps growing as a result of her effort.  Her biggest desire is to have a sales stall in a market.

She requested the loan to buy oranges, mandarins, bananas, and apples.

Mujeres Emprededoras Group is grateful to Kiva lenders for making this loan possible.  Presentación is the second one from the right; she's wearing a gray vest.

loans.use: to buy oranges, mandarins, bananas, and apples

loans.name: Ivemy

texts.en:
Ivemy is 27 years old and married with two children who are 7 and 9 years old. She and her family live in Carles, Iloilo. 

Ivemy helps her husband in their fishing business by ensuring that the equipment is prepared and ready every time. She is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat and engine. Ivemy is optimistic that she can grow her business so she can support her children's needs.   

In the future, she plans to venture into other business opportunities while sustaining the fishing business. Her children's education is also her priority.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and engine

loans.name: Qandbibi

texts.ru: Женщину на фотографии зовут Кандбиби. Ей 43 года. Она вежливая и гостеприимная женщина. Кандбиби замужем и имеет троих детей. Ее муж гастарбайтер в Российской Федерации. К сожалению, в Шахритусе мало работы и он был вынужден оставить семью и Родину, чтобы прокормить семью. Кандбиби на данный момент занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она научилась шить у своей мамы. Кандбиби всерьез начала заниматься шитьем 2 года назад. Она принимает заказы на шитье и женской одежды у себя дома. Кандбиби любит свою работу и хочет развивать свою деятельность. На сегодняшний день Кандбиби необходимо купить швейные принадлежности, но достаточной суммы денег у нее не имеется. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
The woman on the photograph is Qandbibi. She is 43 years old. She is a polite and welcoming woman. Qandbibi is married and has three children. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. Unfortunately, there is little work in Shahrituz and he was forced to leave his family and native country in order to feed his family. 

Qandbibi currently works with sewing women's clothing. She learned to sew from her mother. Qandbibi started sewing professionally two years ago. She takes order for sewing women's clothing from her home. 

Qandbibi loves her work and would like to develop her business. Currently she needs to purchase sewing supplies, however she does not have enough money for it. For this reason she applied for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Monserrate Pilar

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Monserrate, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 15 y 12 años de edad, el mayor estudia en universidad y los menores estudian en colegio, todos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Monserrate realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposos el cual lo utiliza para su negocio, el se desplaza a otras ciudades como Cuenca, Loja, Quito, entre otras lugares a  vender adornos y cerámicas en varios diseños que el compra a artesanos de la localidad ya que son de muy buena calidad y al gusto de sus clientes. Lleva 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual el lucha día a día para darles lo necesario  a su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos. Esta desde hace 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque de esta forma ella pude colaborar con su esposo a salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos
texts.en:
In a parish in Montecristi, the Communal Bank “Para El Futuro De La Mujer” (For the Future of the Woman) meets every 15 days. This place is well-known for its rich traditional culture and the wide variety of handicrafts that are made by its residents.

Sra. Monserrate lives in this place. She is 38 years old, married, and has three children (ages 18, 15, and 12). The oldest child is studying at a university and the younger children are in high school. All of them live with her. Her husband is a merchant.

Doña Monserrate has taken out loans so that she can help her husband with his business. He travels to other cities such as Cuenca, Loja, Quito, and other places in order to sell decorations and ceramics in various designs. He buys these handicrafts in their town and they are of very good quality. His customers enjoy them. Monserrate’s husband has been in this business for 15 years and he strives each day to provide for the needs of their family.

This loan will be used to buy more handicrafts in all styles and shapes. Monserrate has been with the Communal Bank for five years and enjoys being a member because it has allowed her and husband to work together so that they can get ahead. Her dreams include providing the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts for her husband's business.

loans.name: Dzendere

texts.en:
Dzendere is married with six schoolgoing children. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated an agricultural selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak and pests affecting her crops.

With the loan of Kes 30,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Tatevik

texts.en:
Tatevik is 25 years old and married. She lives in Dilijan city with her large family, including her mother-in-law (housewife), her husband’s sister (unemployed), and her two small children. 

Tatevik has a higher education degree and a specialty of lawyer, but now she works at the private company as an operator. Her husband works at the gas station. Tatevik and her husband do their best to earn for their big family's living.

She requests this loan since she wants to buy a computer; the thing is that some part of her work she wants to do at home and she needs a computer for that. In this way, she will manage to do her work fully and to pass it to another specialist on time.

loans.use: to buy a computer in order to be able to work at home also

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes in bulk to sell at his business.

loans.name: Sonunbubu

texts.ru: Сонунбубу 60 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Образование у  Сонунбубу среднее, она на пенсии, но работает фельдшером, также с 1990 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки теленка. Благодаря упорному труду Сонунбубу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 8 коров, 5 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сонунбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы с теленком для увеличения поголовья скота и объемов реализации молока. Доходы от кредита Сонунбубу планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса, что позволит ей в будущем отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Sonunbubu is 60 years old, married and the mother of three children. Sonunbubu has secondary education. She is on a pension, but works as a medical assistant. Since 1990, she has also worked with livestock breeding, after having started this business with the purchase of a calf. Thanks to Sonunbubu's persistent work, her farm currently has eight cows and five sheep. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Sonunbubu turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows with calves to increase the number of livestock and the volume of milk for selling. Sonunbubu plans to invest the income from the loan in developing her business, which will allow her to renovate her house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase one cow with calf in order to increase the headcount of livestock and the volume of milk for selling

loans.name: Loving

texts.en:
Loving is a man of about 40 years, living with his wife and two children, both of whom are going to school.  He is involved in cattle fattening and trading, a project from which he has a steady source income.  According to him, he has been in the above activity for his entire life.

Alongside cattle fattening, Loving is involved in farming, which is a contributing factor to his source of income.  Loving has been able to educate his children plus also providing for his family's other essential necessities.  He says he is going to buy cows, and manure for his gardens.  Loving says his customers are basically cattle traders from his home area.

According to him, his biggest challenge is cattle diseases, such as foot and mouth disease, plus also droughts that dry up water for drinking.  He is described as a hard working man who has been able to achieve everything from his strength,  Finally, he appreciates work done by Ugafode Microfinance.

loans.use: To buy cows and organic manure

loans.name: Gladis Arely

texts.es: Gladis de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella tiene un chalet ubicado cerca de un centro educativo en una zona muy transitada, tiene muchos clientes especialmente los alumnos del centro educativo, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería como golosinas, galletas, dulces, refrescos, gaseosas, etc. todo por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gladis is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her partner and their son. She has a stall close to the school district, in a very busy area. She has many customers, especially students. 

She is asking or a loan to buy merchandise like candy, cookies, sweets, soft drinks, and sodas etc. She want to buy these wholesale and by this have a higher income, in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy, cookies, sweets, soft drinks, sodas etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.  Elsie has been in this business for 12 years. Elsie earns additional income from a general store.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business
